Reviews.Title: “The Whitehall's day has come and is long gone!”
Reviews.Author: ibeasinger
Reviews.Content: Starting with a front desk clerk named Alyce who has not been taught how to deal with an irate guest and chooses to give you the "talk to the hand" sign when she herself is not happy AND will correct you when you mispronounce her name .. to rooms that had no functioning heaters, life endangering situations (lightbulbs hanging from lamps by wires), mold in showers, peeling wall paper .. to staff deciding to do a "deep clean" of a room mid-stay (completely turning the room upside down without security overseeing personal items) .. to checking out with Barbara taking 30 minutes AND forcing you to take cash when, in fact, you weren't entitled to it (of course, they charge you for it later). HORRIBLE!!!! The ONLY bright spot is Night Manager, Carlos Gonzalez Jr. He went over and above in an attempt to rectify the situations my guest and I encountered. He was also the ONLY one to be appropriately embarrassed by conditions! (My photos of rooms 1202 and 1203.)

Reviews.Title: “The Whitehall was originally apartments for the Wealthy”
Reviews.Author: nlester
Reviews.Content: Read the information in the room, this hotel has played an important role in the history of Chicago. As you enjoy your stay, picture what it was like years ago. Yes it is small, yes there might be some minor decorating problems, a fuse that needs attention because your lights dont work. But staff will fix it. Try the hotel restaurants, the sampler plate in the Asian restaurant is wonderful. Try the quiche in the Italian restaurant, it is fresh was very good. The bar has been remodeled, notice the tiles on the pillar. Others have described the sleep comfort, now you can enjoy the history. I asked the valet what the qualifications were for his job, his reply, 'to listen to people and to smile' You will find that qualification at The Whitehall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: GAYLACP
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay on Hotwire and received a very reasonable rate. Although I agree with several reviews that the Whitehall's glory days may have passed, we had a very nice stay. For location and sleep comfort, you can't beat it! Also, housekeeping was prompt and friendly, and the service overall was outstanding. Rooms are well-appointed even if not terribly large--it is a big city, after all, so small rooms can be the norm. If you're looking for a reasonably priced boutique hotel near the Magnificent Mile, be sure to check out The Whitehall.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: I rarely sleep well but I had the best night's sleep here! No kidding---the bed was unbelievably comfortable. Room thermostat kept very comfortable temperature, and the room darkening shades kept the morning sun out. Very spacious room, nicely appointed, and clean. Located in a fabulous area. No noise from street or other guests for that matter. Front desk and doormen were very helpful and polite. I paid the same price for a decrepit hotel near Loyola University just a few months ago and there was NO comparison. I will definitely stay here again when visiting my daughter. Can't wait to come back. Hope I can get that same bed...

Reviews.Title: “Decent, older hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Ruthyy
Reviews.Content: XWe booked it through Priceline and got it for under 100 dollars, For a business trip where you are only in the room to sleep it is ok. The positives: safe, good location, doormen who are very prompt and nice, front desk staff genuinely warm and gracious. As far as the room, they were smart enough to have clean, new carpet, excellent mattress and linens and a small but decent condition bathroom. The negatives is the furnishings and wall paper are showing their age. The entry door to the room actually had kittle chunks out of the bottom like a big mouse nibbled on it. I can't say I've ever seen a door like that ever and was veey worried when I first saw that. But all in all, it was clean and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pleasant service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RollingStones04
Reviews.Content: Lots of charm to this older hotel. Everyone was extremely pleasant and helpful. Location is perfect for all the great shopping and sites in this awesome town

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Disney4meandmine
Reviews.Content: We got stuck with this hotel through priceline at $150 a night. Don't be fooled by the four star rating. I would give this at best 2 or 3 stars at the most. It maybe a historical hotel but that doesn't mean it needs to be run down and dirty. The water for the sink and shower cuts in and out. There were cob webs on the ceiling. There was a fake decorative tree that was covered in dust. There was pop spilled down the wall. The only nice part was the bed. The matress is amazing. The owners need to spend some money and redo the rest of the room. There were tears in the wall paper. One of the worst hotel experiences we have had.

Reviews.Title: “For the Price...Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: bschiefe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline and next time I will wait for a Sniqueaway or Jetsetter deal to pop up (they only offer deals to "true 4-star and 5-star hotels). We arrived at the hotel to great and speedy valet service, but a 30 minute wait to check-in. The hotel lobby is very small so it almost felt like we were waiting in line to ride a ride at an amusement park! When we got to our room (via elevator which I think has been there since 1920), it reeked of cigarette smoke and was generally musty. We called the front desk to change rooms- they were very friendly but made me go downstairs to the front desk to switch rooms. after another 15 minute wait, I got a key to our new room. When we opened the door, the same cigarette/musty smell greeted us. We didn't ask to switch rooms because we figured the whole hotel must smell like this. Needless to say, we did not spend a lot of time in our room. Overall, the hotel location is great, but there are numerous hotels close by and I would advise you to stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: pumpkinlantern
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in Feb 2012. The place is a little older and could probably use some renovation as noted by a previous reviewer (some peeling wallpaper, etc), but overall it is charming and clean. The staff were pleasant. The bed was my favorite part. I got a room with a king bed (was there by myself) and I just stretched out in the bed - it was so comfy and the sheets were really nice and soft. It was definitely new and was one part of the room they had renovated very recently! The coffee in the morning was okay and there's a nice sitting area where you can drink it. I had breakfast one morning in the restaurant - it was okay, nothing special, but the waiters were pleasant. The location was great in the heart of downtown, easily accessible by public transport, and in a safe area. As for price, I paid ~$90/night, which I felt was pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Pride of the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: NeilMcCabe
Reviews.Content: Attentive, accomodating staff. Universally attentive! Highlight was late night talk with Doorman, smoking under a heater outdoors. In small talk, mentioned we were visiting next day with Prexy of Roosevelt University, 15 blocks away down in the Loop. This elicited an enthusiastic review of the institution, and its new-to-the-skyline 32-storey academic tower. The young Doorman showed great knowledge of what was going on, both academically and architecturally. When a night doorman becomes a tour guide and an urban "booster" for Higher Ed.... it's different and extraordinary!

Reviews.Title: “jimnkaren22212”
Reviews.Author: Jim W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there 4 days and it was quiet and clean.I like the how close it was to downtown. The staff was very nice. Chad was very helpful to me when I called from n.c. We plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael I
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night as a result of Groupon. There was no hot water in the bath room, paint peeling over the bath tub, two of the three phones in the room did not work. Very disapointed for a boutique hotel in downtown Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Nice.”
Reviews.Author: MNfamilytravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Whitehall Hotel through Priceline. We got a very good rate of 75 dollars, but we were charged an additional 20 dollars for an extra bed. While we know that through Priceline we are only guaranteed one bed, this is the first time ever we had to have an additional charge. Usually a rollway is provided. Our first night we encountered an unhappy employee named April. We had an engineer come twice to our room: tv and phone issues. Internet required many calls because the code would be wrong. I addressed these issues with an email to the hotel. Immediately I was contacted by managers. This was impressive. Actually two managers contacted me and wanted to remedy what I had complained about. We even got a call at our home when we got back. They were very attentive. I just thanked them for contacting me. We did not receive any compensation. That was fine. The concierge William was wonderful. He got us half price tickets to a comedy club, and he helped us find restaurants. He was very helpful. The ice is a hassle-having to order it from the phone. The elevator was fine, and our room on the 13th floor had a nice view. The coffee is not ready before 7:00a.m. and bring a mug with you to carry to your room. The ambience is quaint. OVerall, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Beewacker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were going to a play at the Looking Glass theater and decided to take advantage of a Groupon at the historic Whitehall Hotel in downtown Chicago. The Whitehall is famous for the Beatles and Mick Jaeger staying there. I can understand why. The rooms are well appointed and the service is excellent. When we arrived at our room, the manager called and explained that grey needed our room. We were upgraded to a junior suite. The room was large and very comfortable. We enjoyed a breakfast at there dining room and it was very good. We'd stay ther again, but look for a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!!!! EVEN DURING A SAD TIME!â€�”
Reviews.Author: Irvinjc
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had to travel to Chicago on 01-12-2012, due to the death of her 41 year old daughter. We stayed at "THE WHITEHALL HOTEL." The stay was really nice and so were the staff. In the end we were almost sorry to leave. Upon arriving we found ourselves in a valley of smiles from the very first person we met, the Valet, the bellman: Ramone, & especially the Guest Services Manager: Derrick Beverly!!! He was very polite & intelligent, along with being very compassionate to our present situation. He explained everything I had available and put me in the most beautiful Junior Suite that I've ever stayed in, in my life!!! Entering the room, the first thing I noticed was the King-sized bed. Everything was clean and quiet (couldn't hear a noise). The bathroom is also very clean & spacious. I truly adored the marble. The shower was very refreshing & quaint! But, the bed was one thing that if I could I would have taken home with me. My sister & her god-daughter were on the top floor with 2 beautiful queen beds. We felt like we were having a heavenly experience, like floating on a cloud! We didn't want to get out of the beds. It hugged me in all the right places! LOL! These are the things that made us truly enjoy our stay at this hotel! But, my warmest congratulations are to the hotel for their choice of personnel. They know how to really make you feel at home, and if you need anything it is like asking a family member. Congratulations from the heart, you all were fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Groupon Deal”
Reviews.Author: LombardJess1
Reviews.Content: We bought a deal on Groupon and stayed at this hotel. For $99, we got a one night stay in a king bedroom room, 2 continental breakfasts, in room internet access, and valet parking. It was a great deal! The hotel is old, but very clean and comfortable. The lobby and elevators are small, but that's part of the charm. The room was smaller than we expected, but that was okay, because we didn't spend a lot of time in the room. The bathroom was spacious and updated, and the bed was comfortable. It is in a fantastic location, right off MI Avenue. We had a couple of issues with the hotel that are worth mentioning. When we checked in, we didn't receive a couple things that we were supposed to get with our Groupon (breakfast tickets and internet password), so that was a bit frustrating, but not a huge deal. Also, we didn't get the bathrobes that were supposed to be in our room. Again, this wasn't a huge issue or anything, but a little disappointing. The walls in the hotel are very thin and we could clearly hear a conversation going on in the room next to us. Also, it took 30 minutes for us to get our car from the valet, which was longer than we were told it would take (20 minutes is what we were told). Lastly, the breakfast was a bit of a joke. Normally it costs $15.75, so we were expecting a good breakfast. The options for the continental breakfast were orange juice or grapefruit juice, choice of English muffin, toast, or 3 pastries, and a choice of coffee or tea. I really couldn't believe those 3 things added up to $15.75. The service was terrible and they weren't ready for all of the people. We waited 40 minutes to get the English muffin and pastries heated up. We were pretty disappointed in that part of the experience. Overall it is a good hotel, but we wouldn't stay there again unless we had this type of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Plush old style hotel downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MarkyLush
Reviews.Content: Travelling on businesses after a long flight The Whitehall Hotel was very welcoming and extremely well located downtown. Fabulous greeting at the door by the Concierge Team and easy check in and up to a very comfortable room, although a little tired. Could not fault the service at all and everyone very friendly. I did not dine at the hotel as there was a myriad of options locally. Only 50 metres from Michigan Ave and very close to North Rush Street there is plenty to do. The room was cleaned daily and looked after very well. The internet broadband connection was very slow and very expensive. Overall a good experience, but I would not recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Groupon Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa P
Reviews.Content: For 99.00 a night I thought the hotel was great! Our room was on the 4th floor and was clean. The bed was crazy awesome. Big and comfy. The staff was nice and helped us out with whatever we needed. The elevators are small but not a big deal. Super close to shopping on Michigan Ave. The Asian restaurant off the lobby was so good. Get the sampler platter. 15.00 for small plates and a glass or wine or a soda. It was a deal all around.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & Joy”
Reviews.Author: Southbound2012
Reviews.Content: Greatest bed ever -- immersion between layers of the puffiest down is a sensation to be savored. Sort of like being in your own personal cocoon. Not one, but two side chairs, are actually soft comfortable places to sit and have a long conversation. The lobby is a little dim and disjointed, at odds with the splendid accommodations beyond. This hotel is a treasure with more to offer for a pleasant, memorable stay than many of it's neighbors in the heart of Chicago's Gold Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: Shan5176
Reviews.Content: We booked The Whitehall through hotwire for less than $100 for a Saturday night. Upon arrival we liked the boutique style. Cecilia at the front desk was very nice and was able to give us a room with a great view from the top floor. The elevators are definitely small as another reviewer noted but we had no issues with waiting for too long. I did find it odd that there was no ice machine or vending. My fiance had gone to look for an ice machine and ran into the bellman who explained that they had to bring ice up. My fiance rode down to the lobby and waited for him to get the ice. As he got back onto the elevator and said "thank you" he heard the bellman mumble a sarcastic "yeah, you too" which was our only negative. I think it's a bit ridiculous to expect a tip when most hotels provide guest access to ice AND the bellman did not have to bring it to the room. However, we loved the room and had a great experience so I won't let one cranky staff member affect my opinion of the hotel. I would definitely go back and found the location to be perfect for shopping (right by water tower place) even though we didn't have time for that this particular trip. Bed was super comfortable. Coffee in the lobby was nice as we didn't have to deal with a tiny in room coffee maker and were able to fill our to go mugs for the drive home!

Reviews.Title: “Great treatment, great room, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Dovey R
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week between Christmas and New Year's, but booked in September with Priceline. We got a super rate and still ended up with a beautiful room on the 15th floor. The front desk staff was friendly and generous, our room was beautiful and the times we ate in the restaurant the food was delicious. The only complaint I had during our whole stay was that I didn't like the lemon drop I had in the bar one night. The location is wonderful, close to shopping and lots of restaurants. We walked over to Ditka's one night and had great steaks. I'd also recommend the breakfast buffet at the Drake, only a couple blocks away. Anyway, we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service from the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Anthony S
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation at The Whitehall Hotel on expedia.com. When I arrived, Cecelia at the front desk informed me that they had not received any notice of the reservation from expedia. I placed a call and the representative at expedia kept me waiting nearly an hour before he was able to determine that an error in their computer system was causing the e-faxed reservation confirmations to not be sent properly to hotels. Cecelia was very patient and helpful. She also upgraded us to a beautiful suite even though the hotel was not at fault. She is a wonderful example of what hospitality really means and I will definitely be returning to The Whitehall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location During the Holidays”
Reviews.Author: jcovert048
Reviews.Content: In December my wife and I stayed at the Whitehall Hotel, a landmark in Chicago. The location of the hotel is outstanding because it is less than one block to Michigan Avenue; the holiday lights, shopping, and fine restaurants are at your finger tips. We did receive a discounted rate which made the stay a good bargain. The room was quite spacious and had a touch of "old elegance". The king sized bed was very comfortable and the bath had been updated with marble counter tops and new tile. After dining on Saturday evening, it was only a two block walk back to the hotel...very convenient. The only drawback we experienced were the crowded elevators full of Chicago Bears fans when we were checking out on Sunday. There are only two elevators, small in size, due to the tall and narrow nature of the building. We ended up walking down the stairs after not being able to board three consecutive elevators. We enjoyed a fine breakfast at the restaurant right next door to the hotel. The Whitehall location puts you right in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal and a great location”
Reviews.Author: philomundi
Reviews.Content: We found this as an advertized deal on a last minute trip down into Chicago for the night. The location, right behind 4th Presbyterian, across the street from Hancock, can't be beat. The restaurants in area offer a great variety in quick walking distance. The hotel has a more European feel. The rooms are nice, not great, but have good amenities that make the stay more pleasurable. One short coming was the front desk. Those working there are very cordial, but both for check in and out our wait far exceeded what should have been. Other desk help would walk by without a comment or offering to help expedite the process. If the first and last taste is the poor service offered, future visits may not be as quick.

Reviews.Title: “A big thank you to The Whitehall Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annemarie t
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip from the UK to Chicago following a fab trip to New York the year before and we love the States. Chicago is an amazing city and we loved every minute of it, people are so helpful and friendly. The hotel made the trip even better, although the bed was so comfy, I could have quite happily stayed in it for the whole trip!!! The hotel is in a great location, staff were polite and helpful. We got a paper delivered everyday to the room. Beds were made up and bathroom cleaned daily. Our room was a good size and well equiped. Before we left we read some of the negative comments on here about the hotel. Firstly, bed bugs.... we had none in our room, but when we went to New York we had read the same about the hotel there and again didnt have a problem. Secondly, some people had said the furniture and decor was dated. I personally loved the old worldy look of the halls and yes the carpet had seen better days in the room but it was clean. Yes the toilet was in an odd place in the bathroom but it wasnt an issue..... I wasnt planning on spending my holiday in there. I guess what I would say to people is that if your used to staying in a modern high end 3 star plus hotel, this hotel wont be for you. If you want a place to get your head down in, while enjoying the amazing city of Chicago and you want a place that's clean and quaint and a bargin then this is for you...... and it's in a great location. I would like to thank the staff at the hotel for a great stay, we would definatly stay with you again. You made it a holiday to remember and we really miss Chicago!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice, but. . .”
Reviews.Author: David50226
Reviews.Content: When my partner and I checked in to our room, we noticed a mildew smell immediately throughout the hall (6th floor) and the room itself. Further, our Orbitz reservation specified a king bed, and instead, we were given a room with 2 queen beds and told that there were no other rooms available. We were able to change rooms the next day to one that did not smell from mildew (on the 7th floor), but no apology was forthcoming from the staff or management. The room itself was comfortable, wonderful beds and bathroom--and as everyone has said, the location is ideal. The staff was generally friendly, although a few of the front desk clerks should take a class in customer service. Be forewarned: when a lot of people are checking in or checking out, the elevators are jammed and the lobby is packed. The wireless charge of $9.95/day, (even in the lobby!) is a ripoff. Overall, after we were taken out of the mildew room, the stay was fine. But there might be other boutique hotels in the area that are nicer. Last year, we stayed at the Allerton, and we will probably return there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Tripnena
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall Hotel is a block away of Water Tower and Magnificient Mile, so location is a good point for them. We were there for Thanksgiving and their restaurant was one of the few opened that night. Good food and price. They have a wireless phone in the room. Ours was not working and they fixed it right away. The front desk staff was very helpful, they had I-phone and blackberry chargers available for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: klenc
Reviews.Content: Bought a Groupon for this property. $99 - king room included parking and breakfast. This is a boutique property. Lobby/check in area is small. It was not busy when we arrived and check in went smoothly. We were given a room on the 15th floor. It was well appointed with a very comfortable bed. The window opened which is always a big plus for me. There are no ice machines on the floors so you have to call to have it delivered. We did this twice and it arrived in a timely manner. You can not go wrong with this deal. The location was supurb. Checked out on a Sunday morning. Even though we had called ahead and asked for our car we had about a 25 minute wait as it seemed everyone was checking out at the same time. We did not use the breakfast coupons but the buffet looked basic. The only negative comment I have is that there is an Asian restaurant in the building and my husband thought the room smelled like fried rice. We fixed this by buying a scented candle. I would purchase this deal again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “If you like bad service and small rooms this is your hotel”
Reviews.Author: Idealsmgmt
Reviews.Content: This is the worst 4 or 3.5 star hotel in Chicago. I travel alot and can say they are not even good enough to be called a hotel. Front desk is poor on check in and rooms are a closet. Restaurant is poor service and valet will take over 20 minutes to get your car. Find another hotel so you can enjoy your stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “"Historic" building, great location”
Reviews.Author: Erika T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Whitehall on a saturday night in December; our party had two king rooms booked. PROS: Great location at the North of the Magnificent Mile. Next to Bloomingdales and across from Hancock building. Could see the American Girl store from my window. My party had two rooms- both Kings, but one was much more spacious than the other. Bed was comfortable and linens were soft (unlike some other hotels.) CONS: Front desk staff was not very helpful. Elevators (2) were TINY! and waits were long. We resorted to using the service elevator. Walls were thin; although I didn't hear my neighbors, I am sure they heard my son crying. (So sorry!) Note: We used a "deal-of-the-day" package that came with the room, valet parking, wifi and a contenental breakfast. Valet parking was easy and parking in Chicago is expensive, so that was a bargain. However, the breakfast was served at a table restaurant on the corner. When I arrived the wait was 45 minutes and they could not serve my breakfast to-go. I left. My companions made it earlier than I, and were rewarded with two pieces of toast, two bite-sized pasteries and a glass of water. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Bargin Location”
Reviews.Author: buildergringo
Reviews.Content: We took a chance on a discount hotel for a one night stay in Chicago. For a $100 a night rate we really didn't know what we would get. We got lucky. The hotel is a rennovated historic building just one block from Michigan ave (Magnificient Mile) and close to world class shopping and dining that this area of Chicago is known for. The rooms were small but had everything you needed for a pleasant stay and the bed and linens were excellent. It didn't hurt that Joe the bartender in the small hotel lounge new his wines and had some very tasty and inexpensive selections. Absent all the frills of the much more expensive hotels in this area that you pay significantly for this was a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for holiday shopping in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam54
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for November 18-21 for a family of 5 (girls 18, 10 & 9) in hopes it would be a good location to Michigan Ave. shopping as well as a reasonable distance from the museums. It turned out to be perfect for both. Just a block off Michigan Ave., we were minutes from Watertower Place and the American Girl doll store (both big hits for the younger girls). A $10 cab fare got us to the museum area. Besides being well positioned for the Christmas light parade and shopping, this hotel had all the necessities we wanted. The hotel staff was very accommodating, and courteous and the rooms were nice sized. We had two adjouning rooms (with a lockout) so the kids could share two queen beds in one room, leaving my husband and I with the other room. The hotel is older, which makes it very charming; a real sense of what it would have been like to stay here 50 plus years ago. While some of the furniture was period furniture, it was nicely kept up and the carpeting and bathroom fixtures, etc., were up to date, providing all the modern conveniences. Shower was great and the room had modern temperature controls so each room could be set to the desired warmth. We really enjoyed our time and found it to be very comfortable. The price was much less than comparable properties, so a bargain for Chicago prime real estate.

Reviews.Title: “Great and convinent location.”
Reviews.Author: ajeffer
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. The rooms were clean. Many people in other reviews had multiple complaints; I found nothing wrong. Rooms were average size. They only had two elevators, but found that they moved fast and you didnt have to wait long to get on them. Furniture was outdated but added character to rooms. We enjoyed our stay there. Would definitely go back. It was in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: lmw58
Reviews.Content: Pros- the location Cons- lights broken, phone did not work, no room service, no coffee in room and none until 7am Good luck business travelers- towels worst I have had outside youth hostels when I was in my 20's. Furniture and carpets cut and frayed seriously. Furniture tables looked like they came from Goodwill. Should be ashamed

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Right from the check in I experienced rudeness and a condescending attitude. Room was shabby and need of serious upgrades. Carpet was dingy. Old furniture and towels were YMCA rejects. Got the impression that the hotel did not have the funds to keep it up. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: ironmoose
Reviews.Content: The best asset of this hotel is its location and proximity to the mag mile. The other cool thing is that it is an older historical hotel. I will say the hotel itself is worn and dated. The carpets in the hallways could be replaced a few, little touch ups here and there and the hotel would be restored to its old glory. All that aside, the hotel lobby is small, but we never felt crowded in it. We stayed in room 304. The hotel elevators are small but we never had any issue with them and I found them to be very fast and efficient, mind you I was only ever going to the third floor. The room itself was large and it seemed like it had been recently updated/renovated. The bathroom was small, but gorgeous! (With the exception of the toilet, which was older). I really liked all the tile work/patterns they had done. I didn't really hear much in the way of hallway traffic or our neighbors which is always a plus. The view out our window wasn't spectacular but that's what the John Hancock Observatory is for. The quality of sleep was incredible. The mattress was king sized and probably one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. Oh, and I can't forget the pillows! Fantastic! I noticed someone else had complained about the cleanliness of the rooms/the housekeeping. In my experience the housekeeping staff did a really good job cleaning/restocking our room. I would recommend this hotel, for not only its location, but the price point as well. Now for a few other tidbits about our trip that I would recommend. Talk to William Tune at concierge. He offers excellent insight into the local restaurants among other things. For breakfast I would highly recommend two places. The first is very close, Tempo Cafe. They are open 24/7 as well. The breakfast is awesome! If you like eggs, try an omelette, they are incredible. I'd also recommend their pancakes or french toast! Another good breakfast joint is called Yolk. Ask Mr Tune about it. He will give you his business card, if its really busy when you go, give the card to the host and you apparently will get seated a lot sooner. We went during the week so it wasn't busy. If you want an authentic rustic Italian place you should go to Quartino! And again, talk to Mr Tune at concierge and he will give you a promo card that gives you a free thin crust pizza.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Location & Staff; F for Housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: 2mchwrk
Reviews.Content: We keep coming back because of the location, the friendly staff, and because it is a Disney Vacation Club property. Everything about this hotel is wonderful if you are open to a historic building, except ONE THING--HOUSEKEEPING. It is really sad that the owners cannot remedy this housekeeping issue, but it must be a Chicago-wide problem. Just reading through reviews of many other hotels in the area, most complaints are very similar. The rooms do have many little broken things, everything is very worn, ripped sheets, etc. Issues related to the age of the building I over-look, but readers should be prepared for poor internet service, slow or dysfunctional elevators, and small spaces. I feel this hotel would be perfect if only the housekeepers could be encouraged ($$!) to care. The rest of the staff is fantastic. Wonderful bellhops, valet attendants, front desk, and William the concierge is just great! We also love both restaurants. We will keep going back to the Whitehall :~)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Affordable, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: monika301
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Priceline and needed triple occupancy so I was concerned about who would accept our offer. We were not only pleasantly surprised with the propery itself, cleanliness, space, location, but the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms themselves were spacious, although the bathroom was small but adequate. Nice lounge and it is connected to a good asian place and a good italian place. Only minor dissapointment was the workout facility, which was small and some of the equipment wasn't well maintained. But overall, a great experience and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable room with a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Tim W
Reviews.Content: First of all, we payed less than $100 a night after fees for this room. It is 2 blocks from the middle of the magnificent mile, and close to many great restaurants. Staff was wonderful. The hotel is old and in need of refurbishing, but at this price and for the location, there are no complaints. Bed was comfortable and the room and hotel was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant accomodation with great central location”
Reviews.Author: Charleypwd
Reviews.Content: We went with an alumni group to Chicago for five weeks. this is an extremely comfortable small hotel with pleasant staff. The restaurant has a wonderful breakfast menu.

Reviews.Title: “Burned by Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: WaunakeeArwen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 308. I booked the room thru Hotwire. They listed it as a 4 star hotel. We found the room to be small and shabby. Paint was peeling off the ceiling and some of the trim. Wall paper was peeling off in some spots. Tile was chipped and broken around the toilet.The thermostat did not work in our room and when I reported it to the front desk they said that was a common problem in their rooms. The overall appearance of the common areas was very worn. I would find it very difficult to rate this a 3 star hotel and certainly not a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it”
Reviews.Author: kdsgroovy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about 4 days in September 2011. I admit I was hesitant at first after reading some of the reviews. But, I couldn't recommend this hotel more. The staff was pleasant. The room was clean and quiet. The elevators worked perfectly. You absolutely can't beat this hotel for the location and price. I walked the 2 minutes to my conference at the Westin, but spent only about half the price on lodging! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Why choose this one”
Reviews.Author: loretta76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at this hotel while in town to watch my son run the Chicago Marathon. We payed the overinflated rate that you will always have when rooms are in high demand. One person in particular at check in was very rude; when we finally were able to check in to our room we found a pay of dirty underwear on the floor beside the bed, and a dirty hand towel (toothpaste on it) still hanging in the bathroom. The hotel does have a great location, right off of Michigan Avenue, but so do many others in the same price range. So why choose this one? We won't choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations in all areas”
Reviews.Author: Cathy H
Reviews.Content: Four women sharing one double queen room, and not one complaint. Room was clean, quiet, comfortable, and updated. Very nice view of the lake. No elevator issues whatever. Service was great from the front desk, housekeeping, and bellmen. Ideal location. We all agreed that we would stay there again without hesitation. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: mtngirl37
Reviews.Content: I had my doubts about this hotel when I first blind booked through a third party site. The price was just a little too good and the location too perfect for it to be real. We breathed a sigh of relief when we walked into our room. Upon arrival they "upgraded" us to a top floor, corner room and what an awesome room it was. We were staring right at the Hancock building and lake Michigan. For those of you planning a visit to the American Girl store, you will be happy to know, it is half a block away and within view of the hotel. The beds were comfortable and not too small. The bathroom was very nice, updated and clean. The shower was a bit finicky but that is to be expected in an older building. And the room did have a slight musty odor upon arrival but that went away after a few hours - again, older building. The hotel staff was courteous and attentive. They were more than happy to point us in the direction of cheaper parking rather than pay for valet - they do not have a parking lot on site. There are plenty of shops and restaurants in the area as it is just off of Michigan avenue. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: Beth E
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall is in such a great location in Chicago! We checked into a fantastic room with a killer view, and everything was quite clean in our room. Even the furniture was nice (solid, dark wood dressers with marble tops), and the bathroom had a nice, deep bathtub. The beds were deliciously comfortable, and the comforters were fluffy and not nasty or anything. The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful, and the bellman were efficient. In particular, Carlos, Cecilia, and Felicia were very pleasant and assisted us with a couple of minor issues. You are steps away from Michigan Avenue, TWO chocolate shops, Einstein Bros. Bagels, Argo Tea, The Archdiocese of Chicago, Bloomingdales, and much, much more! We recommend asking for a room that faces east.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LalaGlaser
Reviews.Content: The first room was not what I had expected, but they were quick to satisfy my expectations, however the king-size bed was a little too firm for me. The room was clean. There was no coffee maker, and the requested bathrobe (listed as an in-the-room amenity) was torn and stained. Room service got ice for me, however I was a bit uncomfortable receiving ice into a questionable bucket. One morning, I had asked housekeeping to just leave towels and not to worry about the housekeeping, however she did some cleaning and trash emptying that lasted about five minutes while we were in the room! The location was great with easy access to the Magnificent Mile shopping and restaurants, and the train. The customer service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BatgirlHalstead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of September for two nights on our first trip to Chicago. We had a king room on the 17th floor and booked it last minute on the Orbitz web site. It was great value for money for a central city location. The check in staff were very attentative, the valet parking and bell boys were very efficient. Our room was not ready but they took my cell phone and called when it was, however we were having too much fun sightseeing to go back for several hours. There is a lot of history with this hotel and the leaflet dipiciting it is well worth the read. This hotel is in a fab location, can't fault anything about it. Our floor was quiet, room spacious and very clean, shower good and the bed delightfully large and very comfy!! The only thing that seemed out of place was the old style television, having been very used to the new flat screens but now I am just nip-picking!! We loved Chicago and the Whitehall Hotel was the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: grollett
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, tucked away in the Gold Coast, yet quite accessible and quiet. Very friendly and courteous staff, although the small lobby felt a bit cramped when it was full of people and stored luggage. The cushy and comfy beds were perfect after a day roaming the city. The only downside was the drinks in the bar. We paid $12 for a call drink, but instead of getting a gin and tonic, it was gin and soda. I would return again, as the prices were more reasonable than the box hotels, even on the weekend of the Chicago Marathon. Kudos to the Whitehall, and thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago”
Reviews.Author: toby-2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights at end of Sept. Excellent location opposite Bloomingdales and 1/2 block from John Hancock tower and Water Tower Place. Chicago was easy to get around and hotel was close to several good restaurants etc. After reading some reviews about the rooms I was a bit nervous but our room was cosy, clean, and the bed was very comfortable,one of the best I've slept in at a hotel. We had no complaints even though our room (508) was opposite the lift. The staff were very helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel for its excellent value and closeness to all Chicago's attractions

Reviews.Title: “old world with great location”
Reviews.Author: kipwinchester
Reviews.Content: As others have said, The Whitehall feels very European--aka the rooms are small, the furnishings a little outdated, and a decided lack of emphasis on technology. But, we had a very pleasant stay there. The biggest recommendation for the Whitehall is its location. You are literally steps away from the Hancock Center, Magnificent Mile shopping and restaurants, Lake Michigan, and other attractions. You're also across the street from the Four Seasons so stop in there for a spa treatment. All this for a fraction of the cost of other area hotels. The room was clean and housekeeping did a thorough job of cleanup every day. Yes, the elevators are small--but they're fast. Who cares about small elevators? Our room was comfy, clean, and quiet--pretty much all you can ask for. No wi-fi, about $10/day for wired internet(this isn't unusual but still would have been nice to have free wi-fi). Fitness center was small, but well kept. I only used the treadmills so I was content. Staff was friendly, though a few of them could have used a refresher course on what their hotel offered. No hesitation in recommending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, primo location, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mike-n-Ginni
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Whitehall Hotel for the 3 nights immediately following Labor Day weekend this year and could not have been more pleased. The location is amazing (1/2 block from Hancock Tower, 1 block from Water Tower, 1 block from Rush St., 3 blocks from red line ...), the price was incredible, the staff was pleasant and helpful and the restaurants and bar are comfortable and offer good food and drinks at affordable prices. Of special note is the old lounge -- felt like having drinks in a big., comfy living room - perfect for unwinding after running around Chicago all day. We will DEFINITELY stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not a great stay at this 'Boutique' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: popejohn67
Reviews.Content: Well, what a great location this is. Near the Hancock Tower and close to the north end of Michigan Ave. Well located for a short walk to a mass of Bars & Restaurants. But....small (hot) lobby and public areas, no free wifi (and the LAN cable in the bedroom didn't work), slow lifts, a free morning coffee service that didn't start until 7am (only a problem if you are up early liike I was), Business Centre was closed for 'renovation' - although I didn't see one workman in there all week. My biggest gripe was just the overwhelming background noise in the Bedroom that meant I didn't have one unbroken sleep in the five nights I was here. One of my colleagues moved rooms three times in an effort to find a quiet spot and most of my colleagues commented on this also. Early one morning whilst working in the Lobby, I listened to a series of disgruntled guests run their various complaints past the front desk staff. Bottom line here is, Hotel needs a total re-model, right now your get what you pay for - a great location in a not so great hotel. Worth saying that every member of staff I had contact with was courteous and helpful, they just don't have a great Hotel to work with right now.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Bad”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaG-77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Chicago on a little extended vacation in the area and I have to say that the hotel at first glance is very nice, but then you get down to it the nitty gritty. The room had a comfortable bed and the staff at the front desk were very kind and accommodating - those are the pros. The water pressure in the shower is awful with variances in temperature throughout the entire 5 minute shower. I mean it will get freezing cold and hot again within 15 seconds without you bothering to touch the knob. The wall paper in the room was peeling in several places and the room extremely dusty (top of furniture, etc.) The halls are very hot and stuffy (we were there while it was cool outside) and the elevators take what seems like ages to get to you - not to mention how small they are. All in all, thank goodness the hotel was inexpensive but I would not recommend staying here to anyone. After all, you do indeed get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Afraid to be a first class hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Duckdoger
Reviews.Content: It was with a certain amount of reluctance I allowed our staff to book me in this hotel given the very hot and cold reviews, hard to know what to make of this hotel and I suspect the owners/operators have the same problem. First to address some of the more common comments posted. I found all of the staff courteous and helpful. The lobby is small, very small and that can be a problem with heavy foot traffic. The elevators are indeed small but I never waited more than 3 minutes for one and I was on the 16th floor. The hotel is in an 80 year old building people, not like they can install new larger ones, so get over it. We squeezed in 5 with carryon luggage so the constant complaints are unfounded. I was booked into a premium king. This is the most expensive room I have ever stayed in, over $200 a night so I had high expectations that unfortunately were only partially matched. The good, very nice linens and bed, fairly new and clean carpeting, AC that worked well, reasonably quite if not for the morning construction going on next door. The bad, the rooms are small, think European size. The bed was only 4 feet from the door, the wall paper was peeling all over, and some of the trim and paint work is absolutely sub-standard, almost juvenile in its quality. The chairs were threadbare and stained, the TV a tube model and no way to turn off the closed captioning. The bathroom while nicely tiled had extensive mold growing in the shower/tub. The water pressure and temperature varied slightly but wasn't enough to annoy or scald. The space around the sink was nice but tight. But the real kicker was the commercial toilet, you know the same ones you find in the gas station or the local department store. The toilet paper dispenser was in such an odd position you had to maneuver around it to slide onto the toilet seat, I was resting my elbow on the toilet paper. There were also traces of fecal matter on the underside of the lid. WiFi wasn't included in the cost of the room. Hallways were dingy and hot. It is a true shame as this has a chance to be a world class hotel. Some things are really nice, and some of the old character of the place is in desperate need of restoration. Some lovely moldings throughout that are just beat to hell. Same with the exterior. It is clear someone spent a lot of money on parts of the building a number of years ago but it has since been neglected. Reminds me of a cruise ship in need of a total refurbishment but instead gets new carpet and linens to try to hide how poorly it is looking. The promised sedan was never available and I never did see the concierge staff. Two restaurants that I didn't try. Location is good, a block from the miracle mile and the John Hancock Building. Virtually everyone I saw check in and out was business people for one or two days and I would say this is a good bet. Not a place for family or long term stays. Not a bad stay, just not the great stay it could be. This would be one I would consider again but not at the price I paid even if it was competitive for downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Central Possibilities”
Reviews.Author: skidleone
Reviews.Content: Near the North end of Michigan Ave, it is also at the foot of the Gold Coast worth exploring for the architectural interest of the private homes. It is also convenient for walking north to the Zoo and along the lakefront beach, as well as South to Millennium Park and The Art Institute. If you don't need to overlook the street, the corner room we had in the back was larger than the average room and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cheap price, somewhat outdated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: OSUnumber45
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall Hotel sits only a half of a block away from Michigan Ave. A perfect location if you're into the shopping and eating that surround this area. For the price we paid you could not have asked for a better location. The rooms, and hotel in general, were old style. Not that it is cramped, but the rooms just seem to be set up differently than more modern hotel rooms. Not that I prefer one way or another. The room we stayed in was very clean with a king size bed, 2 cushioned chairs, a desk with a computer desk style chair, and a TV. Overall I recommend The Whitehall simply because the price is too good to beat in that area of Chicago. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Foligno71
Reviews.Content: Described on Hotwire as 4 stars with Amenities: Boutique Hotel, Smoke Free Rooms, Fitness Center, Restaurant(s), Business Center, High-Speed Internet Access, Golf Nearby Rate paid was $146 for late September (During Gourtmet Wine Festival) Pros: Perfectly located at the top of Maginificent Mile; on the same block as 900 Mall; near all the high end street shops; safe and clean location (eventhough homeless people sleep at the church on the corner of Delaware and Michigan); within a $10 cab ride to the Bean and Museum Campus; Friendly Front Desk staff (let me check in at 8am); clean room and bathroom; no bedbug issue (despite what some google hits reveal) Cons: Only 2 elevators that service the entire building, and the actual elevator cabs only fit about 6 people; Plumbing can be loud from units beside, above, and below; doormen not really attentive unless they can make tips off of you; closest subway stop is State/Chicago which is about a 10 minute casual walk; interior style is a bit old which is why most guest were aged 50 and over; hotel restaurant/bar looked run down and rarely busy (you are better off going to Rush street).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: holidayhoustons
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Whitehall for 5 nights and were very satisfied with all aspects the location could not be better only a block from Michigan Avenue, the reception was friendly and helpful as well as a concierge they have a self service information computer in the lobby which allows you to get information on all the local interests and to check in and print your airline pass the suite ( superior king on 11th floor ) was a very good size, bed was comfortable with luxury linens , bathroom was small but clean and good shower. also iron and ironing board in room which was very useful. only occasional street noise which was surprising given the busy location we had breakfast each morning included in our rate, the breakfast was table service and the service was good although the restaurant was pretty busy so probably best to allow a bit of time if taking breakfast all in all a great hotel in a great city

Reviews.Title: “Updated Property Convenient to Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: 999Clarke123
Reviews.Content: Located on Delaware Place near Rush Street, the advertised price averaged around $120 per night caught my attention first, the location and rating sold me. However, I was more impressed with the updated decor of the room,and the friendly service.of this old hotel. Convenient CTA bus service is within a block, which provides access to the CTA Trains as well as MERTA Rail Service to the suburbs. Nice resturants are within blocks as is Rush Street attractions. The lobby is tiny as is the elevator, but we chose to sleep in our up-to-date, comfrotable, clean and spacious room, and do our sightseeing all round Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating but great location.”
Reviews.Author: Leslie K
Reviews.Content: The pros: Excellent location Soft, comfy beds with updated linens Nice bathrooms Walking distance to everything on the mag mile The cons: Small lobby Slow check in Old televisions Smallish rooms Outdated corridors - need new carpet and lighting The Whitehall is a throwback to the old days of Chicago. That said, the hotel could benefit from a renovation of the public spaces - the hallways especially. Just look old and in need of a fresh coat of paint, new lightning and new carpet. The furniture in the rooms (desk, armoire, headboard etc) are pretty old. The Chinese retaurant on the first floor has some decent choices. Room service was ok - they got my order wrong on a few occasions. Even with some of these drawbacks, the location cannot be beat, especially for tourists. The beds are very soft and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Delivered as promised, complaints debunked!”
Reviews.Author: jbiker
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review on my last afternoon/night at the Whitehall. I was very nervous after PriceLining a room in Chicago and coming up with the Whitehall. I started to read the reviews (too late now, did a best price in the blind) and was quite concerned. I couldn't wait to tell everyone that my experience was much better and absolutely trouble free. I read about complaints of musty smells, dirty sheets, dirty bathrooms, rude staff, bad elevators, bad water pressure; the list seemed endless.... So, as I approached the hotel on super easy public transportation (Blue Line from O'Hare, walk 2 blocks to Michigan Ave, and take one of many buses north to Delaware, walk less than a block and you're there) I took a deep breath. The gentleman that greeted me and checked me in was very polite. There were no problems with my reservation. In minutes I was on the waiting elevator up to my room. Yes, the elevators are small. Big deal. I was on it a total of 30 seconds in the four days I was in lovely Chicago. On to the room: Another deep breath as I opened my door. It was quite warm in the room - 79 degrees. A/C was set at 62. Uh oh! Before I panicked I tried turning the thermostat up to a more reasonable temperature - 74 degrees. Sometimes older A/C units freeze up if you tax them too much. If it was trying to cool to 62 degrees as the thermostat was set to maybe the unit was froze up... don't know if that was the problem but the room cooled to 74 degrees within 30 minutes of my adjustment. It was perfect for my entire stay. The room was clean and nice sized. I got an end of hall room which meant 2 sets of windows and great views of the city. Also - no noise from neighbors. Fantastic. I would definitely stay here again. The location is fantastic. The staff was polite. The room was everything I needed. Great job Whitehall Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great location, old world elegance”
Reviews.Author: MIAMISHEILA
Reviews.Content: Could not ask for more convenient location.. down the block from Water Tower Place on Michigan Ave. and Filenes basement. Still elegant but was disappointed that their gorgeous dining room is no longer being used. There are 2 other restaurants on property, Italian and Chinese. Suite was beautiful but some of the furniture was threadbare. Would have loved a coffeepot in suite, instead of having to go to lobby each morning. Would definitely stay here again if the price is right, as it was this summer. Elevators are very tiny, so don't bring tons of luggage. Service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge room”
Reviews.Author: DanceWorld
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Chicago and wanted to stay in a central hotel. We were not disappointed. The hotel is right in the centre of everything, only a few feet away from the Magnificent Mile shopping district, many tourist attractions and loads of bars and restaurants. The room was so spacious, clean and had everything we needed. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “We chose this place again...”
Reviews.Author: nfwdlf49
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Chicago was last November. We had no idea what area of the city was best for being centrally located to the main attractions. The Whitehall was a great choice. The rooms are decent sized and beds are extremely comfortable. The staff are all extremely helpful. For those reasons, along with being one of the more reasonably priced hotels, we chose to stay here again over Labor Day weekend. Restaurants galore within walking distance as is Lake Michigan and the Magnificent Mile. The place could use some cosmetic touch ups, but we love the dated look of the lobby. We arrived quite early (11 a.m.) and our room was ready and we were allowed to check in which was a surprise that we were not anticipating. The wait for the elevators, which are quite small and only two of them can be more than a few minutes around a.m. checkout time. But, other than that this place is great!

Reviews.Title: “Beware if booking this hotel thru a third party site...”
Reviews.Author: krogers1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel thru Hotwire, approx 3 weeks prior to our stay. We arrived 1 hour before check in and told that because we booked thru a third party, our reservation was NOT guaranteed (even though we had prepaid $402.00 for 2 nights), therefore we would have to wait until check in time. After a conversation with the manager we were finally given a room. The rooms are very small and VERY antiquated. The night stand drawewr handles were dangling, the bed skirt was dirty, the sliding closey doors were rickety, the walls were very thin, we could hear coughing in the room to the left of us and the toilet flushing in the room to the right of us. The TV was small and required manual turn off and on, the remote only worked for channels and volume control. There were 3 old lamps in the room, each one required a little maneuvering to turn on and off. There were only 2 outlets in the room, and each one was loose from the wall. The bathroom was clean, but very small, with the toilet wedged under the sink (very awkward). The positive aspects of this hotel. The staff (minus the RUDE front desk clerk, who later wrote us an apology and slid it under our door, ( I'm sure at his manager's urging). Also the location is great, diagonally across the street from Water Tower Place, upper Michigan Avenue. I would not stay ther again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: joshtop
Reviews.Content: Great location and good service with spacious rooms for the Mag Mile area. However, the a/c didn't work too well. Lobby was a bit dated but nostalgic. Bathroom in the room was fine All in all a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: china7774
Reviews.Content: My first time in Chicago and I happened upon this hotel through my research with corporate discounts/perks. After seeing reviews here I thought, why not. The hotel is in a fantastic location, 1/2 block from Hancock building and Michigan Avenue, minutes walk from Rush/Division. The restaurant attached, Fornetto Mei, is reasonably priced, great service and fantastic food! There is a smaller version on the opposite side for quick bites or drinks. The hotel itself is old but in good care and clean. The room we stayed in was spacious and the first night of our stay we were greeted with a lovely plate of fruit and chocolate. The concierge was extremely helpful before and during our visit there - pointing out locations, maps and instructions on how to get to and from. I highly recommend you use public transportation - the bus is great and inexpensive, very clean and never had to wait more than a few minutes for the next one. Bus 151 or 147 will get you throughout most of the city with ease. I would also not waste your money on a taxi to the airport directly. Take a $10 taxi to the Clark station and ride the Blue line to Ohare airport for $2.25. (or reverse that to get to hotel from Ohare) I frequently travel to NYC and Chicago's subway system puts NYC's to shame. Clean, efficient and well lit with signs everywhere and no guess work. I also recommend the Trolley Tour through Coach USA. The stop is in front of the Hancock bldg and is $27 online in advance. 12 stops gets you pretty much through the entire city within a few hours and you get a free sample coupon for Garrett Popcorn and Hershey. The Lincoln Park zoo is free and wonderful - take a bike or walk through and take a picnic. Don't pay the fees for the Willis Tower or Hancock Tower observatory - go to the Hancock Signature Lounge on the 96th at dusk or late night for a (pricey) cocktail or dessert, looking out over the beautiful city....with no admittance fee! I will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique, Great location, historical”
Reviews.Author: moonstarlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with family for a short stopover, enroute to New York City. We had a smooth check-in, had great rooms, comfy beds, and loved the interior which was very vintage and historical - seeing that it is a landmark location in Chicago. It is also close to the main Magnificent Mile strip, which was close to all the great shopping and food areas. But the only incident which we as a family did not appreciate was that, after getting help from the concierge in getting a cab enroute to the airport to NYC, and loading our bags into the van, and ALTHOUGH we tipped the concierge manager (thinking he would share the tip with the doorman who helped with the bags), the doorman was incredibly rude to us and made a big fuss about not tipping him. Perhaps it's an American culture we did not understand, cause when we tip in Asia, the manager always shares the tip with his/her team. Perhaps it is not the case in the United States? But it was unfortunate because they knew we were foreign, and he treated us with incredible disrespect - causing me to give this hotel a review that is a less than a 100% mark. Apart from that though, it was a great location. But if you ask me? I would not return to this property and would be exploring a different hotel for my second stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK. Should really be a three star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: solavino21
Reviews.Content: First off, the location of this hotel is excellent. It is literally steps away from the Magnificent Mile. Sadly, thatâ€™s about all that I can say about this hotel that would fall into the exceptional category. The staff was not very accommodating. I called to say I forgot my toothbrush, and they said they have them at the front desk. Iâ€™ve never had an experience in a four star hotel where they didnâ€™t have someone bring it to your room. In addition, we called and asked about the potential to get a late checkout and were told that if we overstayed our room, weâ€™d get a $200 charge. We were not allowed to speak with a manager when we asked, though we remained polite at all times and werenâ€™t lodging a formal complaint. The lobby is small and got quite crowded at several points. We stowed our luggage the last day and were quite disturbed to find that they keep all stowed luggage outside on the street. We ate at the restaurant once, and the menu was very basic. The room was clean and comfortable enough, and in fact, quite large by Chicago standards. The bathroom was very small, and the showerhead was so low that it barely accommodated me, and Iâ€™m 5â€™8â€�. Additionally, the rooms are quite dated, with ripped bedskirts, a 32â€� CRT TV, and old dÃ©cor. We stayed here because we got the room on Priceline, but if given a choice, Iâ€™d skip the Whitehall Hotel and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: Rheanneh
Reviews.Content: It was great for the location but it is definitly not a 4 star hotel. The place was clean and the bed was comfortable and the location was great. Our view was another building which I expected since we got a good deal on our room. I figured people who paid the regular price had the better room. The staff was nothing specail, except for the doormen, no one really smiled. When we checked out we had a complaint and the receptionist didn't seem to really care. Our complaint was that our phone rang randomly through out our 3 day stay there, when we would answer no one would be there. Sometimes these phone calls would be at 3 in the morning. we got at least 8 calls!! We wanted to bring it to her attention so futer clients would not have the same experience but she just blew us off! The location was the best part but there are other hotels that are close to this area that are probably better. Good thing we had a great deal on the price because if i paid the regular rate which is over $300 on their site for the same room, i would have felt ripped off!!

Reviews.Title: “would return!”
Reviews.Author: kiewelmd
Reviews.Content: Great rate, location, service and staff was very knowledgeable!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location close to the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Jack G
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in August 2011, got a great price from an internet bookings site. Best feature was the excellent location, close to the Magnificent Mile, Hancock Tower and restaurants of Gold Coast. Downtown and the Loop are within walking distance. Staff were friendly and the room was a good size, very comfortable. Would recommend the Whitehall to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TravelKitt75154
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Whitehall Hotel in August 2011 for the third time and found it better than ever. I was very surprised to read the recent reviews posted for this hotel. The first time I stayed here in 2009 they were in the process of renovating their rooms. The room we had then was nice and clean. I assumed by now all their rooms had been renovated but maybe not from the sound of some of these reviews. I stayed at the Whitehall in December 2010 and found the hotel again quite nice for the price and a great location for shopping and dining in the snow. It is across the street from the Four Seasons, a half block from the John Hancock Building on Michigan Avenue, one block from Watertown Mall and just a couple of blocks from great restaurants on Rush Street. We found the staff very friendly and accommodating. Furnished us with umbrellas, great restaurant recommendations and directions. The elevators are small but we didn't find that to be a problem. My husband and I fit in it with a large suitcase and a rolling golf bag. Capacity on the elevator is limited to 5. I guess we were just never in a hurry. We stayed on the top floor in a king room with a bay window at no extra cost. Room was spacious, very clean. Bathroom was plenty big with large vanity. The bed was comfortable and we had no problem with the air conditioner. We will definitely stay there again as we love visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: jards
Reviews.Content: Started our road trip route 66 here hotel staff very nice could not do enough for us it was raining so they lent us an umbrella to start our sight seeing.Beds were huge and very very comfortable, The hallways could do with brightening up but you dont sleep in the hallways, so that was fine. Stayed two nights couldn't complain they even made us a cup of coffee to start our travel very early on the morning we checked out. i would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “everything you need, great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: smbst99
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel but I would really recommend it and here's why. It is in a great location and has what you need, or at least what I look for in a hotel - it is quiet, the bed is very comfortable, heavy curtains make the room nice and dark for sleeping, the shower has great water pressure, and it was clean. The staff is very nice and helpful. we had a baby with us and they had a crib for us. the only negatives about the hotel are that since it is old, there are only 2 small elevators which get very backed up. also, when the doors close and lock, they make a loud noise. we ordered a bunch of desserts and wine/champagne from room service for a family member's bday and they were all delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Neat hotel, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: NMD1984
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a nice location, pretty high end. The elevators did run a little slow and broke down once during our stay. That wasn't that big of a deal to our group. The rooms were nice, if on the small side, as well as comfortable and clean. What was a big deal was the very incorrect bill we got on our last morning. We were charged $200 for parking that we didn't use. The bill was eventually corrected but it took an hour and a half to locate the manager!! Beyond frustrating! There seemed to be a total breakdown of communication between the staff and management, I was beginning to wonder if a manager existed. He came running after us as we stood on the curb grumbling waiting for a cab. Great price on Hotwire, now I know why.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: debi1018
Reviews.Content: We live just outside of Chicago and enjoy spending a long weekend in the city. We have found our home away from home at the Whitehall Hotel. The front desk staff as well as the Bellboy were very polite and helpful. We would like to give special recognition to Courtney, Derrick and Alex. They are a true asset to your company.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful old hotel in a good location but the terrible service overshadowed the good parts.”
Reviews.Author: jpa2011
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through priceline and expected the best. We checked in around midnight and most of the lobby and other downstairs rooms were closed off. We were not told about coffee in the lobby in the morning which would have been nice since there is none in the room. The first thing we noticed was how warm the room was and we called to have the air checked but no one ever came up. We also did not have a hair dryer and one was brought up. It would only work on low settings. We asked for another but did not ever get one. The light bulb by the bed was out and we made repeated requests to get another but never got one until the last night of our four night stay. The room was never cooler than 76 until the last night when it finally got fixed by the man who brought the light bulb! This hotel is very old and nostalgic and the room was very nice. But I would not go back because the service was so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: travelerfromJC
Reviews.Content: Moderately priced yet decent hotels in Chicago are hard to come by in the summertime, so we thought we'd try this one, which seemed to have overall positive reviews. But compared to some of the other places we've stayed, which cost only slightly more, it was definitely not worth it to save a couple bucks. We splurged on a king size bed, but upon getting up to our room, found a rather small bed. We went back down to the lobby. I said, "We paid for a king bed, but the one in that room looks like a full. Could we get a different room, please?" Would you believe the response the guy gave was simply: "We don't have full sized beds." What sort of customer service is that?! It certainly wasn't a king! Just apologize and say you'll make it right. (We got the king, no problem.) There are only 2 small elevators, one of which was out of service all weekend long that we were there. We took the stairs down the 4 flights every time we went out and noticed lots of other people doing the same. There is no room in the back to store luggage, so it's all right out in the open in the small lobby of the hotel. When we were picking ours up, there was no one around watching it, so we just grabbed our bags. Really safe, huh?? This is by no means a boutique or a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NO ICE”
Reviews.Author: tusmc
Reviews.Content: i would NEVER stay in this hotel again. you cant even get ice without calling room service! elevators are the smallest i have ever seen. my 3 children, my wife and i and our 2 bags could not fit on the elevator. when we were ready to check out the elevator came by 8 times before we could get down to the lobby. speaking of the lobby. it is also the smallest i have ever been in. hotel smelled old and mildewy. staff is unfriendly. wasted my money and had a terrible experience. would NEVER recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: CRR0923
Reviews.Content: My family and I had made reservations at The Whitehall for a family wedding.. Upon arrival, our rooms were not ready..We had to get two rooms to accommodate our family..The elevators were so small that we had to take separate trips up and down.And when we were leaving, we had to wait through 7 full elevators on our floor..We had to go down one at a time so we wouldn't miss our flight waiting for the elevator. There are no ice machines on any floors..They have ice buckets?? But no ice machines?? The rooms had a smell in them and we actually received a letter under our door accusing us of smoking in our room..They said they would charge us 250 dollars if it continued.. This 'luxury' hotel needs to close..It is old and worn out..Time to say good bye. Terrible Service, Terrible Management, Terrible Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Katherynne V
Reviews.Content: We were very nervous about this hotel as we saw conflicting reviews on TripAdvisor and other sites about bed bugs, noise, small rooms, slow elevators, etc. We contacted the management about our concerns and we were placed in beautiful, relatively spacious rooms with nice views. The rooms were clean, the linens and bedding were superb and our stay was wonderful with no bed bugs or other hotel problems. No hidden surprises. The hotel is conveniently located at the north end of Magnificent Mile. We highly recommend it. We were in Pinnacle Level King rooms. We found a great price online. The staff was very gracious and helpful. Secure, self-serve parking is available right across the street for $36/day. Hi-speed internet costs $10/day but there are lots of close internet cafes, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: JessMontalvo
Reviews.Content: I've never reviewed somewhere I have not stayed until today. Once I get here I will update this if my experience changes, but right now I am very shocked by the rudeness and lack of service from the employees at this "luxury" hotel. My husband and I made a reservation through Expedia for this hotel. We booked weeks ago and are leaving next week. Upon reading reviews for Whitehall, I noticed that people who did not confirm reservations sometimes have their rooms given away and no place to stay once they get there. I also wanted to know the price for parking and deposits, since it varies with each hotel. I had already called the other hotels we booked with, and they were nice and friendly and had no issue confirming our reservation and giving me the info I asked for. The first person I talked to was very rude and stated that he doesn't know why I am calling if I have a confirmation email from Expedia. I told him I still need to confirm through a person. He transferred me to reservations and they stated that they do not have my reservation on file and that they need to transfer me to in-house reservations. I got the voicemail. I called back again and they gave me a direct number to in-house. Except it is not a number to in-house, it just continued to transfer me to the front desk where I was very rudely spoken to by the front desk several times. Two of them hung up on me without even transferring me and another one berated me for trying to call and stated that it is my fault I keep getting transferred back because there is no one in the office right now. I am beyond pissed. If my reservation wasn't non-refundable, then I would cancel. Since that is not an option, I feel I should at least warn everyone about the horrible service you will receive from what is supposed to be a four star hotel. I got better service from Super 8 when I called them today. I am going to call back after 5 and try to get someone who is not rude. If that doesn't work then I am going to speak to a manager. My main annoyance is that I was spoken to like I am an idiot for wanting to confirm my reservation, yet it is no where to be found. I am quite sure that once we get there we will have no room and they will rudely attempt to shuffle us off to another hotel, as they have done to other guests. Do yourself a favor and take your business else where. It is ridiculous to pay for 4 star service and get the same service from employees that you would from a crack-house brothel front desk. Unbelieveable. UPDATE: I called Expedia, whom I set up the reservation through. They called the hotel. The agent was hung up on twice before she could get to a manager. The manager told her that she was busy and they were having some issues with a customer in the hotel. The expedia agent left a voicemail for the manager who called me over an hour later. When I explained the situation to her she stated that it was a problem with the phone system. I told her that is not the case since the people were outright rude and that has nothing to do with how the phone systems are working.
