She then stated " They were probably annoyed and wondering why the same person called 300 times." So because I want to confirm a reservation, I am a jerk? Are you kidding? She then was able to immediately pull up my reservation and inform me of parking and deposits. She offered nothing to me because of her rude employees and I hung up. I told my husband and he was beyond pissed because this is part of our honeymoon. We came to an agreement that we just want our money back and want no part of this hotel. If it is already this bad before we even arrive, I can't imagine what these people will be like in person. We contacted Expedia again and they called the hotel. The agent was on the phone a very long time and stated that she was transferred 3 times and was on hold for a very long time. She came back on the line 10 mins later and stated that they would not give a refund because the manager was gone for the day and to call back tomorrow. Seriously Whitehall, just give us back our money so when can book a hotel that actually treats their customers like human beings.

Reviews.Title: “read the reviews b4 you decide”
Reviews.Author: narlytoes
Reviews.Content: We got our trip thru luxury link. The price was not to be beaten. We checked in , no problem. I had to call down 2x for them to bring our comp wine and truffles, dinner cert. for our 3 course dinner and our free breakfast coupons. We proceeded to dinner. Our 3 course dinner was great. The gnocchi was the best I have ever had. The btl of wine and the apps were great as well. Later that night was came back to the room to wake up drenched in sweat. I thought we had had too much to drink the night b4. When we bumped the air conditioned to 68, it would go down to that and bounce back up to a sweltering 78. We got up that a.m., came back later and went out. Next a.m., same thing. Woke up drenched and the darn thermostat was back up to 78 again. I called and told them to come up after 11am. Upon opening the air cond unit...I found the filter completely blocked with dust...GROSS!!!!!!! They fixed the problem and we had a better night of sleep. The parking is $48/nt. We found garages a few blks away for $26-$28. We parked there. I was looking at the beds and noticed that the head of the bed was higher tan the rest of the bed. Kinda in a "u" shape. odd. Maybe that is why my back hurt so bad. Dunno if I would stay there unless we had a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: tumbleweedtravel
Reviews.Content: We loved the Whitehall Hotel. We arrived and the valet and bellboy couldn't have been nicer. When we checked in the staff was efficient and very helpful about places to eat in the area and directions. This hotel is in a great location and if you walk a block you are at the John Hancock building with sightseeing buses located there to take tours. It is an older hotel but has alot of personal charm and the restaurants were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Atrocious - Don't Be A Victim”
Reviews.Author: 847to602
Reviews.Content: On 7/6/11 at approximately 8:43AM, I booked a hotel room on Priceline.com for a 4 night stay in Chicago, Illinois from 8/6-10/11. The hotel room was ranked on Priceline.com's website as a 4 star property. Upon arrival on 8/6/11, the first room assigned, #1511 was unacceptable as it had an atrocious odor permeating the room. The smell was not unlike the hundreds of crime scenes I have responded to as a career law enforcement officer. I reported my findings to the on-duty manager identified as "Michelle" who told me that there were no rooms left. After discussing the matter with her for the next five minutes, she refused to issue me a refund. Soon thereafter, a clerk named Carlos - the only pleasant, honest, and friendly staff member on site - stated there was one room left (funny, as Michelle was unaware of the vacant room). Carlos - the clerk who found the room - provided me with the key and I discovered the room was located next to the room with the horrible stench; room 1510. Upon entering room #1510, I was horrified as to what I had been provided. I discovered that the wall paper was peeling; the room and bed were smaller than agreed upon; the comforter was torn; there were cobwebs on the windows; and to top it off, there was a substance on the wall which appeared to have properties consistent with dried blood to the right of the headboard. Based upon my experience with room #1511 and now, #1510, I contacted Priceline's customer service line and spoke to a service rep. The service rep, connected me to the next level of care a customer relations representative. Upon informing the customer service relations representative of my problem - and spending 15 minutes for them to understand my plight - she informed me that it was up to hotel management to refund my money. She stated that she would call the hotel to discuss it. The Priceline rep called the hotel - spoke to Michelle - and ultimately, the refund was denied by Michelle - stating that the deficiencies I pointed out in the second room were "aesthetic" and that she offered to use an ozone machine to fix the smell of the first room. The Priceline rep called me back and told me that there was nothing further she could do. I informed the rep that Priceline is a party to the civil matter and that they provided a falsely advertised product and were refusing to assist me. Meanwhile, after 45 minutes of arguing with Michelle - with the Priceline rep listening and recording the conversation - Michelle agreed to refund 3 of the 4 days of billing; refusing to refund me for the night of check-in. The Priceline rep stated she could only refund 3 of the 4 days and I would have to take up day 4 with the hotel. I have a claim into the hotel and my credit card company for the 4th day - as well as another call to Customer Service Relations Clerk "Matt" (placed on 8/11/11). Apparently, the Whitehall Hotel Manager - Abel Cartagena - approved the full refund (as I have his voice mail telling me so) but Priceline has no record of it. In all, my experience with Priceline and the Whitehall Hotel in Chicago was - and continues to be - dismal. As far as the staff, Michelle was downright rude, hostile, and condescending; she even lied to me and told me that she didn't know who the General Manager of the Hotel was when I asked her. As far as the hotel, I have the photos which depict what I wrote about above. Oh, did I mention the construction happening on the roof of the building not 25 feet away from the hotel...Stay away at all costs!!! Try the James Hotel or the Sheraton 4 Points.

Reviews.Title: “If you seek the nostalgic era of personalized service the Whitehall is for you”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: The hotel although a bit long in the tooth is anything but short on on personal charm. They even maintain the long tradition at the Whitehall of remembering guests names once checked in and the manager Michele is the most charming and gracious of hostesses. The Concierge William is extremely professional and accommodating and Carlos at the Front desk is the best. Thank you Michele for a memorable stay. We shall always return to the Whitehall as it has become our home away from home. Oh yes, the best beds on the planet.

Reviews.Title: “How many things can go wrong? Let me count them for you.”
Reviews.Author: traveler2703D
Reviews.Content: No soap in room. Robe delivered when requested, still damp from the washer. Broken air conditioner, unattended to. Not enough front desk staff to attend to check-in. Elevators too few and too small to accommodate parties of six...even fewer with luggage. Charges on credit card that were unauthorized. When one considers all the choices in Chicago, this place, though well-located, is a bad bet.

Reviews.Title: “One problem after another...”
Reviews.Author: fpfarric
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding we were attending in Chicago. I called the day before and then the morning of our arrival date to arrange early check-in. We arrived at 2:30pm for a 3pm check-in time and were told that our room was not ready. Our friends, who were also in town for the wedding, checked in 2 minutes after us and were given a room immediately. They had not called for early check in. Seems a little peculiar... We went to get into our room and found that the key didn't work. We took the elevator down 11 floors (elevators took forever in this hotel), got another key and returned to find that this key did not work either. We called from the hallway phone to have someone send up a another key. We later realized that it wasn't the keys that kept malfunctioning, it was the electronic key contraption on the door. EVERY time we tried to get into the room all weekend it took at least 5 minutes and putting the key in and out of the hole 20-30 times. Several times throughout the weekend we had to have security come up and use a special key to let us in. At one point my husband called the front desk to be let into the room yet again and the front desk was quite short with him and said someone would be up in 10 minutes because they were busy. The staff member he spoke with also said "Have your ID ready or we won't open the door". I understand security procedures, but there are better ways to treat your guests... The room had older decor and a tv that was very old (small with no flat screen). We did not watch much tv, but were surprised that it was so outdated. Our friends said that the tv in their room only showed half of the picture and the other half was back. Our other friends who were getting married told us that they had made welcome bags that the hotel was supposed to hand out upon guests arrival. We never received a bag and when I called to inquire about it, the management made excuses about why the bags were not handed out (they couldn't find the wedding guest list, they couldn't read the hand writing on the labels, they were too busy to focus on welcome bags at the time of check-in). Overall, I would NOT stay in this hotel again and I would not recommend it to my friends or fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “4 star not so sure about that!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GackOntario_Canada
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after a 12 hr drive and expected something relaxing. We entered the lobby which was really small and no air conditioning. The bell boy and valet was very helpful. Staff was courteous but not friendly. The elevators were really small and I was glad that they were working. The room was ok. I first noticed the cobwebs hanging from the ceiling. It was kind of cramped. The furniture is all very old. The windows were so dirty is was hard to see out of it. The bathroom looked like it was upgraded but the door could not lock as the lock itself was hanging at an edge. The beds were comfortable and the white bedding itself was on the better side even though the duvet covers itself was broken at the edges. For ice you needed to call the fron desk which arrived quite quickly. As for the internet. It never worked just with the code. We spent nearly 2 hrs trying to get it to work. Some technical person came up to check but then told us we needed to call the internet provider to get it sorted out. My husband spent and 1 hr doing this. The next day the same thing happened. We never ate at the hotel as it did not look good. The most I saw in the restaurants was 3 couples. The outside windows needed a cleaning really badly. The fridge was there but it was a bar fridge not for our use. The tv had very little channels. If you are looking for comfort and luxury definately not the hotel to go to. This was a damper on our Chicago trip for sure. Good location was the only thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo for room, value, location. Boo for elevator(s).”
Reviews.Author: Mikxe
Reviews.Content: We loved our spacious, attractive room. (But since this is an older boutique hotel, it's possible that rooms may vary, even within the same category.) The location, near Michigan Avenue and Rush Street, was really convenient. We did a lot of walking. We paid $150 per night on a weekend, and that struck me as terrific value for a big city. My only small complaint: there are only two small elevators, and one of them wasn't working while we were there. This led to some lengthy waits getting down to the lobby or back up to our room. (We were on the 13th floor.) Making matters worse was the presence of an elevator attendant in the tiny car, allowing only five guests to ride rather than six. Some of us discovered the service elevator and used that the entire weekend. It's really a small quibble, as I suspect that this isn't the norm. I'd definitely stay at the Whitehall again.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: Shavings
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Chicago for just a visit to see the sights.. The Whitehall was recommended by a friend, and the location couldn't have been better for a first time visitor. the room was very nice and service was excellent. Only downside was the small elevator.

Reviews.Title: “The location was out of ordinary”
Reviews.Author: butterflyAlaska
Reviews.Content: And the hotel itself - not so bad, it was oputdated, but there is a charm in it. I liked it. My back is a very special creature :) But those matresses satisfyed it. Nice place, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Whitehall - a whitehot mess”
Reviews.Author: dijas
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a three days over a weekend. The front desk staff were consistently professional, but cleaning staff was very uneven. Upon arrival, we noticed the room hadn't been completely serviced which was an indicator of our experience for the next three days. The first time the room was serviced, they provided no soap or shampoo. When we asked for some, we received (6) towels. The next day, we had some leftovers from a restaurant that we did not finish, so we threw them in the garbage. The cleaning staff did not empty the trash when they serviced the room, so we were left with two day old food in our trash can. Gross. The t.v. was from the late 1980's, so we were enjoying ESPN highlights in something akin to cave drawings. If you go, you will need the ice bucket to keep anything from the minibar cold. Don't let the refrigerator coils on the back of the unit fool you...according to staff, this is NOT a refrigerator, but service staff is careful to replace all of the items everyday so that all of the beverages are cold and fresh. From our experience with the service staff and my husband's warm beer, this is highly unlikely. The bed was fine. My husband liked the feather bed and slept well. However, the walls are extremely thin and we were promptly awakened at 6am every morning by our neighbors screaming kids. Not a feature. A surprising asset is the hotel restaurant - Fornetto Mei. I had the Gold Coast salad with mixed greens, raspberries, granny smith apples and champagne vinaigrette and a really nice beef carpaccio with fresh arugula, slivered almonds and the beef was so, so tender, thin and delicious. My husband had their pizza d'asti with hand made fennel sausage, pancetta and prosciutto. The crust was really light with nice, crispy air pockets and the sauce was simple and delicious. We didn't have a lot of expectations for this place, so we didn't bother ordering wine, but I wish we had...it was a wonderful surprise. The location is great, which just means it's a quick escape from the mediocre experience of this hotel and on to the great city of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not yet 21st century”
Reviews.Author: jjp76
Reviews.Content: Great location of this older 30's era hotel, updated to the 20th century with regards to rooms and bathrooms. However tech, TVs and internet capabilities and elevators are still old and dated. 2 small elevators, tube TV, no internet. Small lobby, restaurant(s) are currently running but dysfunctional and not managed well. The hotel is worth staying at if you get a great-good price as it is located in a very nice area (near Four Seasons, Westin, Mag Mile, shops, Restaurants. The people here are very nice and friendly. Rooms are clean, bedding is great, bathrooms have all the amenities and are clean. Overall Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Boooo”
Reviews.Author: claire1024
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I planned on staying there last week. When we arrived at the hotel, the front desk staff said that they had our reservation in the computer but since we booked thru hotwire, they didn't have a room available to us; they only had rooms for "full paying" guests. They tried to send us to a Best Wester in Evanston, a half hour away. We had plans down town that night. They said they would pay for a cab to the hotel but it was on us to get back down town and then back again to Evanston that night. The front desk staff was very rude and unapologetic. I would never attempt to stay here again. This is the first time that I have had this problem and 100% blame the hotel. And it looks like I am not the first one to have this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Book Here”
Reviews.Author: Evasgirl
Reviews.Content: I had a room booked at this hotel for several months. When I recently called to confirm my reservation, one week before the trip, they did not have my room and wanted to jack the rate to give me one, if available. I would never book here again. Its sad when the manager says that he really doesn't care about a previous arrangement and will not honor the confirmation. I can't believe a hotel will sell your room out from under you for an extra 25.00 per night. If I hadn't called ahead I would have been on he street!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Yorgurtberry
Reviews.Content: OMG! This hotelbis ridic! It started off from a phone call to confirm my reservation. Although I had book through a third party, I understand that They were in responsible for making the arragements. But becuae I have years in the industry I know that the hitel should have my resevation on the computer. There I called to make sure.The laziness and unwilligness of the front office staff made me uneasy already as he relentlessly try to divert me to my travel agent. When I arrived, we checked in and walked around. They location is a plus. Though much of a tease to be a across from the Four Season and the Westin.(def. Should book at chain hotels if you want consistent quality). Location to the mag mile and tour are prime that seem to be the only benefit. Not worth it if you an hear your neighbor throug paper then wall and creak of the elevator all night.We also attempted to use the business center, which was not in service because they didn't know the password. No ice on the foor we were at. Horrible service. This hotel wa taken upon a recommendaton by a friend.which will not ever be taken again.haha.Please don't waste you noney here.

Reviews.Title: “overall very nice”
Reviews.Author: pixie90
Reviews.Content: The service was lovely,the old hotel remodeled and comfortable. Great location close to restaurants shopping and the lake!

Reviews.Title: “Very cute”
Reviews.Author: FrontDeskSaavy
Reviews.Content: Very cute boutique style hotel in downtown. The location is convenient to Navy Pier and other common attractions. The staff was kind and professional. The drawbacks were that the front desk was slightly overwhelmed and may have needed extra help, the sheets were quite itchy, and the room itself and the bed were a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location , Great City!!”
Reviews.Author: Ben5432112345
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located for a tourist as you are 1 block from the miricle mile and a couple of blocks from the beach. We stayed in a 2 queen bed room and it was perfect for what we wanted. It is not the most modern hotel but clean and comfortable and at a very reasonable price. With so much to do in Chicago we were out most of the day and on return the beds were very comfy for a good night sleep. We stayed for 10 days and loved this city. I would reccomend it to anyone.!

Reviews.Title: “A Chicago Gem”
Reviews.Author: Carol0226
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a couple of warm summer days in Chicago at the Whitehall. The hotel is historic and unique in it's own charm. Our room was on the 8th floor and was a good size in Chicago terms. The bed was very comfortable, which is important when you spend all day walking around Chicago and need to rest at days end. We did not have a great view of the city from our room, but that was of little importance to us as we spent a minimal amount of waking time in the hotel. William, in Guest Services is a gem and helped us with reservations at new eateries and major attractions. He is an excellent source of information and an asset to the Whitehall staff. The only problem I had at this hotel was that I could not get the internet to work. This hotel was an excellent value and located well in my favorite city... Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Michigan Ave & historical, but also very dirty and old smelling except for the closet bathroom..”
Reviews.Author: Vwillis
Reviews.Content: I booked thru hotwire for 100, where you don't see the hotel. Bad idea! Customer service agent wasn't so nice at all, tried to be friendly to her (Yana) not happening.. I get to my room, Ned skirt dirty with white stains and ripped at the bottom. the chairs had Nasty dirty stains looked like urine and they were torn. The old zenith tv from when I was born in the 80s, had stains around the frame, the cabinet it was in one door was falling or leaning the hinge was broken and the other door had the knob to open cabinet missing. I understand historical, maybe that's why the furnitures wood was chipped. The bed had a mink cover to hide the rips and tears on the blanket, and not sure what else was meant to cover the tears on the sheets and a stain on sheet.. Ugh.. I'm thinking the plush pad was nice or was it one of those covers to so bed bugs can't get on top.. I didn't see any and don't plan on it cuz I'm checking out.. The bed shirt was ripped and had white stains that looked like they could have been easily washed out. The bathroom was the only decent thing, for the 1/2 I'm here I was ok sitting in there. It's like a closet tho, the toilet was right next to tub, no space between shower n toilet. If your claustrophobic don't go in there altho it's the nicest thing I saw so far.. For the price, not a good deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Really needs some TLC!”
Reviews.Author: snowbunny91
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall was a godsend in that everything was booked during a recent weather issue in Chicago that cancelled most flights. First, the good news: The beds were comfortable with clean white duvets and sheets. The bathroom was very nice as well. The bad news is the hotel is in desperate need of an update.....The Lobby looks more like the service entrance and doesn't look as if it has been cleaned in ages. One of the two VERY slow elevators was out of service. The waits were long. Once in the room, The furniture was worn out and falling apart...... Two clean white robes in the closet were marked by a big hole in one sleeve.. I had to call down to get a bar of soap for the bathroom. I understand that the competition is fierce...But this could be a great hotel in a fabulous location.....Hope someone steps in soon!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: THELITTLETHINGS_11
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money. Very old, dirty hotel with horrible customer service. Only one elevator was working which caused a long, frustrating wait each time you needed to go up to the room or down to the lobby. Wasn't able to check in until hours after the check-in time. Room smelled like smoke and the bathroom wasn't clean. Valet parking service was very slow and staff was unfriendly. The hotel is in a great location (across the street from the Four Seasons) but is not worth staying in. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: DLPHermosaBeach
Reviews.Content: The rooms were old, run down and small. One of the two elevators didn't work so the small one that held 6 people was usually full when it stopped on your floor. The televisions are small picture tube Ziniths from the 90's. The location is great but the hotel is disgusting. Parking is $45 per day. You pay $10 a day for internet service and it is as slow as dial up.

Reviews.Title: “Our second time there & we will always be back.”
Reviews.Author: StacyH4
Reviews.Content: Quaint, small but not cramped, the Whitehall is perfectly located between Rush & Michigan Ave. It has history (previously was a Men's club) & you feel like you are in a private club, yet it's so welcoming like a home. The rooms have modern amenities, there's a workout room on the 2nd floor + meeting rooms for business. The doormen are helpful, remember your name & are genuine. Definitely not like the chain hotels that dot the city!

Reviews.Title: “Best location & best value for money!”
Reviews.Author: JenJen85254
Reviews.Content: For a girls weekend we went with Expedia's unpublished rates. We ended up at the Whitehall...it was the most perfect location! Not even a 2 minute walk from Michigan Ave and the Hancock building. The only realy way to park is the valet and the staff were very helpful in everything and always very polite. The hotel restaurant was a bit out of our price range but there were plenty of places nearby. We ended up in an accessible room which didn't bother us because it was huge! And the beds were very comfortable. We had read the reviews and were only a bit wary of people complaining of noise from the street...we didn't hear any. Only issue was there was only 1 free outlet in the bedroom for all our phones and cameras.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: kimberb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Whitehall Hotel during our vacation to Chicago, from Tuesday May 24th through Sunday May 29th and what a great hotel and staff. We loved Alex and Romone at the door and Sarah Block the manager. They are top notch folks. The room was wonderful. Clean and comfortable. We will surely stay here again. Thank you Sarah for your assistance, you know what I am talking about! Michael and Kim from St Louis Missouri

Reviews.Title: “Cute place, good location, pleasant service”
Reviews.Author: haveagoodtime
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double queen room during the week. Staff was very helpful, they even printed out directions for me at the front desk. Doormen always available to hail a cab. The lounge was very comfortable for coffee and the newspaper in the morning. The bedding was wonderful and the hotel was quiet. My only complaint is the room was quite warm even after having maintenance "reset" the AC even though it was fairly cool outside and the room was too dark, with only a couple lamps. Overall, great stay for the rate we got.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and quaint old hotel”
Reviews.Author: LK14Toronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the whitehall hotel with another couple so had a room with 2 queen beds. The first thing we noticed was the GREAT location of this hotel, it is one block from the magnificent mile, just down the street from one of the lakefront beaches and a short walk to the transit system. We didn't have any complaints about the hotel, it is a lovely old hotel and has been decorated accordingly. We just didn't feel it was up to a 4 star standard, although everything was fine, the bathroom could have had better amenities (such as a slightly larger shower), and the carpets needed replacing. But these are just minor adjustments that did not affect our stay at all. However we also did not pay full price to stay here, so if you can get a good deal then I recommend staying there, but don't pay their full prices because then its not worth it. Just a comment regarding the elevators, yes they are small but they are functional and we loved the look of them.

Reviews.Title: “A NICE HOTEL AT A GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: effieandyannis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Whitehall Hotel in Chicago for two nights at the end of April as part of our route 66 road trip. Service at the hotel was moderate to good and everybody was very helpful. The room was rather small and unfortunately with view in a narrow side street. Room and especially the bathroom needed to be better maintained as the age of the building shows. Valet parking is offered at almost 50 US Dollars per night - not really worth it - as no more than 1 minute away there is a self parking facility. The Oriental / Chinese restaurant at the hotel is not a good idea as the food was very poor. Overall we would easily stay again as it offers good value for money and its centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: OConnorGoldwingers
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were attending The Oprah Show and chose to stay at the Whitehall Hotel. We were there for three nights and were very happy with the hotel, the rooms, the service. The front desk staff and the bellmen are very friendly and very helpful. They were always pleasant and willing to join in a conversation. I was having problems with my phone in my room and called for help. The maintenance staff came to my room very quickly and fixed the problem. I was very impressed with the fast, efficient service. The Concierge is absolutely fantastic. He was able to hook us up with tickets for whatever we asked. Very valuable asset for the hotel. Our rooms were good, the beds and the linens were very cozy, with nice puffy pillows. This boutique hotel is a very old hotel and has character, right down to the luggage racks in the closets! Different from the ordinary metal racks, they add some quaintness and character to the room. The elevator isn't very big, but it was sufficient and there never seemed to be a problem. I stayed in a hotel in London where the elevator was half the size! The location is ideal, one block from the Magnificent Mile, two blocks from Lake Michigan, tons of restaurants all within walking distance. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and I recommend it to anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Whitehall stay!”
Reviews.Author: SusanDelaney
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my favorite city, Chicago and stayed at the Whitehall Hotel which was walking distance from the Nursing Home where my mother was staying. It was also walking distance from just about anything- i.e. great restaurants and even Walgreens. Most of all, it was close to Michigan Ave and Rush Street, the best places for shopping or just window shopping (some prices are steep). But the hotel itself was clean and classy. The lighting in the rooms seemed a little dark, but that was great for sleeping-in. The entire staff was wonderful! Keep in mind that it is better to stay at this hotel if you don't have a car because you pay almost $50. day in valet parking! I got a fantastic room rate from Expedia and the hotel upgraded me to a Junior Suite!. There were two restuarants inside the hotel (Chinese & Italian). We ate at the Italian Restaurant and had the greatest thin crust pizza cooked in a stone oven that I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION, BEST BOUTIQUE HOTEL IN CHICAGO”
Reviews.Author: KarenMorris
Reviews.Content: When you stay at the White Hall Hotel you get the feel of Old World Charm with newly renovations. The rooms are spacious and luxurious with beds you never want to leave. The staff gets a A++ they are helpful, friendly and seems like they can never do enough for you. The in house restaurant is wonderful and if you don't feel like a full meal they have a cozy front bistro with a brick pizza oven, the room is enclosed with glass which makes it a cozy and nice casual setting. All in all I think The White Hall Hotel is a 5 Star boutique hotel which leaves you with a European taste in downtown Chicago. I would recommend this to all my friends and customers !

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great location, and Great service.”
Reviews.Author: rscott1906
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent guest at the Whitehall Hotel. Over the last eight months, I have spent one week per month enjoying the service and the comfort of the hotel. The staff is cordial and very accommodating. Great location. Less than a block away from Michigan Avenue shopping and the Hancock Building. Also walking distance to several nice restaurants on Rush street. I would highly recommend the hotel for business travelers for the following reasons, large rooms, comfortable beds, and minimal hall way traffic. Excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean, charming old boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen10151
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to Michigan ave and shopping, it was very pleasant. Even though it is old it has been renovated and the thick, soft, down comforters and king size beds were great. It is a block off Michigan so it could be a bit noisy but any hotel would be in Chicago. The lobby bar was cozy and service attentive. Pizza appetizers were unique and tasty. Service was excellent and most of all the hotel room was clean. It is a two block walk to the Hot Tix booth where great show tickets were available at a minimal price of the original. Also a block from the American Girl store.

Reviews.Title: “Faded and well past it's glory days”
Reviews.Author: tollo652
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that is clearly on it's way down. Nice and convenient location, but the interior is grotty. Bed is comfortable and clean. Room and elevators have a musty smell and it's all very faded and well past it's best.

Reviews.Title: “"Former Glam Girl" in need of a face lift”
Reviews.Author: elyette
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor â€“ Whitehall Hotel 4/2/11 This hotel was frequented by the â€œGlam Gangâ€� back in 1972. It is a designated historic hotel which was renovated in 1995. It must have been lovely then. The location is wonderful: one block off Michigan and three blocks from the Water Tower Complex. The tree-lined street is relatively quiet and pretty. If I had not gotten a great room rate, I would have been upset at what I found. The room carpet was torn, the furniture chipped, the extra blanket had a hole in it and the elevator light didnâ€™t work the entire week. My room, 402, was in the back corner. If you are a light sleeper/night person, just remember that bottles are dumped in the alley late at night, followed by the roar and clatter of garbage truck pick- ups between 6-8am every day. If you want to use the business center, the computers cost around $5.00 per 15 minutesâ€™ use. However, the free coffee in the lobby is wonderful and two blocks east on State St. find Potash grocers where you can pick up items to store in the refrigerator for a quiet breakfast in your room. Going south on State you can find inexpensive local breakfast restaurants. The church on the corner of Delaware and Michigan has good concerts for the cost of donations/free. Sdaly,this once glamorous hoteland still historic hotel badly needs a facelift. I sense that they are hurting financially.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel is great location”
Reviews.Author: lauramahony
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 4 night stay at the Whitehall hotel. Got a great deal on it on an Orbitz sale. It was a nice older hotel with smaller rooms and no fancy extras. The location was amazing - one block from the John Hancock building and all the buses to the museums. We didnt eat at any of the hotel restaraunts - too pricey, esp when there are so many great options a within walking distance. The hotel does not have free internet... its $9.95 a day. There also are not ice machines - you have to call room service for a complimentary ice delivery. A little awkward and it took them about 10 minutes to bring it. One thing I didn't see mentioned in other reviews: The hotel makes you put a 50 dollar a night hold on your credit card for incidentals. Since we stayed 4 nights, that was 200 dollars on hold. Just be prepared to make this deposit knowing it will lower your remaining credit on your card! They claim you will get it all back pending you haven't used the mini-bar or broken/ stolen anything. Hopefully the money will be restored to the card soon. It was just unexpected and something I would have liked to know about ahead of time. But overall, the hotel worked out great and we had a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and great value for the cost.”
Reviews.Author: sjmorone
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Although it is older, the rooms are very clean, beds are super comfortable, and the food is great. Wireless Internet would be a great addition (they still have Ethernet plug in option), but like I said, it's older. It's the old fashion aspects that make it so quaint and give it great Chicago character.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm and comfort in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: berkshireclassic
Reviews.Content: My associate booked us a couple of rooms at the Whitehall Hotel. I was pleased with the superior King upgrade from the lovely attendant at the front desk. The main elevators were the smallest I've seen, maybe holds 4 with luggage- not that it was ever an issue(maybe there is a service elevator for large hauls). The hotel appeared to have early 20th century construct and was very cool looking. If you like cozy in the old fashion style this is your kind of place. I enjoyed it. The room provided me plenty of space and the view from the 19th floor was enjoyable. I had to ad an extra night stay and there was no problem, not even have to change my room. The room staff was right on and the front desk staff was friendly and accommodating. There is a work out room that has one elliptical trainer and two treadmills on one side and some free weights and a universal or two on the other side. I managed to get to my equipment with no problem. I didn't rent a car because parking is expensive and traffic is difficult downtown (as most of Chicago). The bed was exceptionally comfortable and the room was quiet. I enjoyed the Hong Kong style restaurant there, as well.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY pissed off.”
Reviews.Author: BellaRose14
Reviews.Content: Rooms were dirty and very outdated. Only positives were location and price. HOWEVER, we were charged with a completely random charge on my credit card claiming we took a "first aid kit" from the mini bar. Both my husband and I never even saw a mini bar in our room, and definitely were not drinking during this trip (ie: was not possible for us to do this negligently). I am pissed.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in a great location for an excellent price.”
Reviews.Author: oedipusrex
Reviews.Content: When I traveled to Chicago alone for the first time to visit my boyfriend I stayed at a hotel that was supposed to be excellent. At the end of my trip my flight was cancelled and I had to find a hotel to stay at. The WhiteHall was the only hotel that welcomed me in for even cheaper than my first hotel! The room was so comfortable and warm. When I first check into a hotel I always check out the bathroom, it was really upscale with tile floor and granite sink top. This hotel is perfect if you are planning to visit Giordano's for some deep dish Chicago pizza for dinner or stop off at The Tempo Cafe for the best breakfast you'll ever have. It is also very close to shopping areas and The Cheesecake factory if you are staying a bit and want a variety of food. Every trip I have planned since and will plan will be with the Whitehall Hotel for it's location, price, and great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaMc
Reviews.Content: I found and booked the Whitehall online. It was our first trip to Chicago and we weren't exactly sure what area of downtown to stay. I read the reviews of the Whitehall and was sold. This boutique hotel is old, so have no preconceived notions, there are cracks along the floor boards and in some corners or the wall. I think this added to the charm. We stayed in a King room and were immediately enamored with it. The room wasn't small per say but quaint. The bathroom was teeny and the toilet was broken. We called down to the front desk and they had a service man there within minutes. Our view wasn't the best (a back alley) but the charm of the room made up for it. The hotel itself is full of knick-knacks and pictures. The decor takes you back in time and so does the lighting. The elevator and hallways are very small, but again I think this adds to the charm. We wandered into some of the anterior rooms and were again very pleased with the decor and overall feel. We never had a chance to eat in the adjoining Italian restaurant and wine bar, but we will make a point to when we return. There is a Starbucks behind the hotel, get to it in 3 minutes by using the alley. We would go for a morning coffee then wander the streets. We felt very much at home. The Whitehall is super close to the Miracle Mile and other downtown must-sees. Really did love it, and will mist certainly stay there again when we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: jod3303
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great small hotel, with a great location for not a lot of money then this is the one for you. The hotel is small but the rooms have everything you need, the beds and linens are really nice, very comfortable and stylish, although the bathroom was really small it had everything including a lighted vanity mirror that was a really nice touch,. The staff were very friendly and helpful and gave some good ideas of the best way to do things in the shortest amount of time. We really enjoyed staying here as the location was perfect to walk everywhere, you are just seconds away from the Mag Mile and everything that holds, and as the hotel is on a side street you dont get the noise and the crowds walking past 24/7. I would stay here again without a shadow of a doubt, a great little find

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: HillaDrew
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed at the Whitehall for 3 nights over the new year (10-11). We were upgraded to a suite which was a delightful surprise!! Check-in was smooth and quick. The room was by far comfortable and luxurious. We decided to eat in the asian restaurant for lunch one of the days. It was wonderful! The bar in Fornetto Mei was quaint and full of character. Check-out was also a breeze. The location, and charm made this hotel a perfect choice for our quick getaway! We WILL return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Scaryfast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I take a short trip to downtown Chicago once a year to do some shopping, see the sites, etc. We usually use Hotwire to try and find a hotel in the Magnificent Mile area for a reasonable price. This year, the hotel that popped up after our purchase was The Whitehall Hotel on Delaware. It was $73 for the evening which is VERY reasonable for that area. The room we got for that price was a "Superior Queen" room. It was small but we weren't spending much time in the room. The room was very clean and the bathroom - although on the small side again - was gorgeous and very functional. My wife really appreciated the built in lighted makeup mirror. Not many hotels have had that. The bed was very comfortable, the bedding was excellent, and the room included a Zenith standard tube TV (reception was sketchy on the local Fox TV channel and a couple of other channels) and a refrigerator. WiFi is available for a fee (come on...a fee...really?). They have a couple of restaurants attached to the hotel - a very nice Italian restaurant and a new Chinese restaurant. The lobby is very small and cozy as are the elevators. It's an older hotel to be sure, but it's very charming and that's just our style. We're not very keen on the new Chicago direction of the gleaming steel and glass Euro-style hotels. The location of the hotel is AWESOME. 1/2 block from Michigan avenue and about 1 minute walk to Water Tower Place, Bloomingdales and the Oak Street Boutique shops. It's directly across the street from the Four Seasons. As far as negatives, there weren't many. We couldn't hear people in other rooms, but you could sure hear the plumbing. When somebody would run their shower or flush a toilet, it was quite loud. But we were so tired after a full day of walking around and eating, we slept like babies and it was never an issue. Street noise was minimal - we never heard any horns or cars, etc. Delaware is a one way street that's fairly tight so there isn't a ton of traffic. Check their website for seasonal deals though. After we made our online purchase, I checked their website and saw they had a Superior King room including Valet parking ($48 value) for $119. That's a few dollars cheaper than what we paid and for a larger room. The valet parking is the way to go if you're planning to stay longer than 24 hours. There is self park across the street for $31 for 24 hours, but if you plan on staying any longer than that, it is more expensive than the $48 hotel valet parking. They allowed us to check out and leave our bags in the lobby so we could walk around some more. We left around 4:00. They were very helpful and we will definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for the money”
Reviews.Author: twji
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night here while spending two days downtown Chicago to shop and to see the sights. The hotel was fine. Nothing special except a great location to North Michigan Avenue. Room was small but comfy and quiet. Really all you need for a nights sleep. USA Toady delivered to door in morning and coffee or tea downstairs. Parked at 120E Walton in the Bloomingdale's building. 24 hours for $27.25 plus tip. One block walk. Reasonable. Lunched and breakfasted at Foodlife in the Water Tower Place across street. Great selection and price!

Reviews.Title: “Not a first choice...or second”
Reviews.Author: timandlish
Reviews.Content: The hotel, although obiviously vintage, has a great location but is showing its age. The room we had was very dated with a king size bed that was in very poor shape. The amenities in the room were damaged and the hair dryer was broken, which we all know was the major issue prior to getting ready for a night out! The hotel has a nice bar and dining area, but the lobby is cramped and frustrating. I hope you dont have a family of five that wants to travel up the elevator together... you will need two trips. The front desk staff was not plesant and very short in their abiltiy to carry on a conversation. The best I can say about this hotel is that it offers you a nice location and a good place to have a drink after shopping all day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Whitehall”
Reviews.Author: michiganartgal
Reviews.Content: Every year we spend one night in Chicago on our way to Milwaukee for Thanksgiving. This year our one night was spent at the Whitehall. We found this hotel to be really charming and cozy. The staff was very sweet and helpful. I had asked for a room with a view and sure enough, we were given a room on the highest floor overlooking the John Hancock Bldg. and Lake Michigan. The rooms are not large, but our room was very clean, elegant and cozy. This hotel feels VERY different from a large chain hotel....it is intimate and welcoming....almost a throwback to another time. The location CANNOT be beaten! This hotel is a sweet gem!

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TXAGnative
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel for what we thought was a steal on Southwest Airlines website for $85 a night for the weekend before the Thanksgiving holidays. It is in a wonderful location if you are wanting to shop the Mag Mile and not wanting to pay for all the excess of the Four Seasons etc. We are without kids so we just wanted somewhere comfy to crash in between museum hopping and shopping. Nice to walk a block for everything, red line is two blocks down, and see the parade while there. Pros: The beds were comfy, quiet for the area, fast elevator, very polite bellmen and front desk staff at any time of day Cons: Small rm but only two people, no ice or drink machine (Walgreens is a block away - just plan ahead), DO NOT VALET A CAR ($48/NT) We liked the place for our uses even if it was dated compared to the fancy newer places around it, but perfect for what we needed

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect a Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreenTravelerMA
Reviews.Content: I spent a leisurely weekend at the Whitehall Hotel after a week business stay at the neighboring Westin. Aside from the great location of both hotels there is no comparison. The Westin is a modern luxury hotel with modern amenities and the Whitehall Hotel is a moth-balled museum of vintage Chicago hotel history. A repairman was in my room repairing the HVAC system as I checked-in and for the remainder of the trip I noticed that the room felt colder than usual. The rooms are very small and there is barely enough room to squeeze between the bed and the television. The television is standard definition, the showerhead is too low to be useful and the closet was extremely small. This hotel is worth it if you can find it on Hotwire or Priceline for $100 or less - or if location is the most important thing for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fading Glory”
Reviews.Author: lindashirer
Reviews.Content: Back in the day, The Whitehall was a classy and elegant boutique hotel. Having just stayed there for four days, I regret to say that it is not what it used to be. It's still elegant, but frayed around the edges. It is rated 3 and 1/2 star but some of the furniture has seen better days, and the service was inadequate and is not what one might expect in a hotel of the three and 1/2 star category. We ordered ice sent to the room (no ice machine, no minibar) and waited 45 minutes, although we called three times to check on it. Two days out of four we had no washcloths, only towels delivered. However, the location is just ideal and the value wasn't bad; the best in the area. The ambience of the lobby is cozy and lovely, and the front desk very accommodating. But if you are looking for first class service and deluxe rooms, this would not be your place.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Boutique Style Hotel in Great Chicago Location”
Reviews.Author: jeannem52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at The Whitehall Hotel and were very pleased with our overall experience. The staff was courteous and helpful. We were confirmed in superior king accomodations. The room was good size and very quiet. The bed, pillows, linens, etc. were all of excellent quality. The bathroom was minimal but functional. We recommend that the hotel provide either a coffee maker in the room or offer a free coffee bar in the lobby for their guests because room service is non-existent. The hotel should be wired for wi-fi or at least make this service available for their guests for free in the business center. Charging for this service seemed inappropriate for a hotel with a luxury rating. Location is A Plus. Apparently, this is the hotel of choice when the Rolling Stones come to town!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MEK71
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall was a great experience. It is on Delaware, right off of Michigan Avenue. The location is perfect for shopping, restaurants and even a healthy walk to the Chicago Art Museum. It has a cozy lobby and a wonderful little bar. If you are looking for a lot of glitz, this isnâ€™t the place. It is quiet and comfortable. Other reviews commented on the noise level but we had no problem with this issue. The rooms are small but well appointed. The staff could not do enough for us. All of their suggestions for dinner and entertainment were spot on. It was inconvenient to have to call for ice and there was no coffee maker in the room but free coffee was provided on the first floor. The staff made all the difference. I would recommend it to my friends and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “European Feel”
Reviews.Author: connjohn
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Great staff. Great location in a great city. Lobby is gorgeous --like a grand manor. Nice updated granite in bathroom. Beautifully soft silk duvet. However, elevator and rooms are fairly small, limited storage. Windows don't block sound of city, nor open/close easily. Most inconvenient to have to pay every 24 hours for internet. No coffee/tea in room, although it was provided in lobby in AM, no breakfast. Connected restaurant had few reasonable options. Locked fridge?? TV was old, remote stubborn and couldn't get listed stations.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to snuff”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnobMadison_WI
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to Chicago I chose the Whitehall. It was advertised as a "luxury"hotel. After calling to let the staff know we would be a late arrival due to travel delay we checked in to be told that the room we reserved was not available and we were given the choice of a smoking room or a much smaller room There was no price adjustment. We chose the smaller. The room was indeed small. The arm chair was dirty and worn with stuffing spilling out the bottom. Bedside tables chipped and cracked. Carpet dirty and the overall paint in the room as well as the hallways was worn and chipped. The bathroom was small but nice. Room price was $372 and an additional $48 for parking. Location is good. There are better hotels for the same money in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice If You Are Paying $150 or Less”
Reviews.Author: bugsy554
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here this past weekend and we booked on Hotwire. When we got to the hotel, our group was upgraded and I stayed in a suite...I think the Whitehall Suite. Rooms are very clean and the suite was spacious. My only critique is that since this is an older hotel, I could hear every horn and siren on the street.. I was on the 19th floor. Although it was extraordinarily loud, it was very noticeable. A light sleeper might have issues

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location....average hotel”
Reviews.Author: funinsun09
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we learned that the hotel had overbooked and they sent us 4 blocks away to another hotel. (equal value) We were very frusterated by this inconvience...it was late and we had to be up at 5:00am. They told us that they would allow us to just stay at the other hotel for the remainder of our trip (3 nights total) When we went to the other hotel, we learned that we could not stay there longer then one night and so we had to have all of our things packed up to be stored when we left in the morning. (again...inconvenience) The room was fine...nothing spectacular. The location was AWESOME...just steps away from Michigan Ave. (Nordstrom side) All in all it was a great trip with a bit of frusteration at the start of the trip. If you are okay with a hotel that is just average in a great location, this is a good place for you!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a classy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: markpepe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Whitehall for 5 nights at the end of September. We found our stay extremely comfortable, loved the amenities and the staff most helpful. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: BILLBUDS
Reviews.Content: Our company staff and our international distributors stayed at the Whitehall in July during a convention. We took up about 50 rooms. As planner for these annual events I look for a mix of cost, location, accomodations, and, high on my list, staff support. The Whitehall Hotel was a win on all counts. From the first meeting with the group events manager I was set at ease with her friendly yet business-like manner. She followed through to the finish and was very pleasant through many changes in types and count of room requests over the two months from our first meeting until the show. The decor and room size is typical of European traditional. Our international guests were very pleased, as was our staff. The location is excellent for entertaining and shopping. They have a restaurant where we could pick up a quick breakfast. The service was great from the desk to the restaurant to the doormen. The beds were very comfortable. This is a historic building in the heart of the action. The building has character. If you're looking for chic decor and plan to spend most of your time in your room, this might not be for you, but if you're looking for a comfortable, clean room, convenience, service, location, and a good price this is the tops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great city great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doreen_dunmore
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel through the Disney Vacation Club and what a great hotel it was with plenty of nice touches including chocolate covered strawberries in our room upon arrival. Very elegant , staff were very good indeed checking with us after we arrived that we were satisfied with our room. Would definietly stay again, only way they could improve is to have tea and coffee making facilities in room and keep the residents bar open after 10:30 pm.

Reviews.Title: “great location, disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoFtLauderdale
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have traveled to Chicago on business dozens of times over the years and continue to visit every couple of months to visit family and friends. We stay at a different hotel each time to experience the differences in location, ammenities, decorating styles and skyline views. We recently stayed at The Whitehall Hotel on E. Deleware Place and were shocked at the rooms. We knew it was a 1920's boutique hotel and had heard favorable comments from friends who had stayed there in the past so were eager to see what we would find. We stayed two nights checking in on Saturday left on Monday morning. This hotel is listed as a four star hotel and is priced as such. Shockingly, the rooms had not been decorated (or redecorated) in at least 15 to 20-years or longer. With all of the competition from new, hip hotels with current room furnishings and flat screen TVs, the Whitehall rooms were so outdated and worn, we wondered what was wrong with the management and hotel. There is a huge difference between good traditional furnishings and worn, outdated furniture. Our room was on the side of the hotel looking at a solid wall of the building next door. I have not seen an armoir in a hotel room in a number of years now that TV manufacturers have introduced flat screen TVs but there was barely one foot of space between the beat up armoir with the large outdated TV and the foot of the bed. Very tight and inconvenient for two adults to try to maneuver in the small room. The upholstered furniture was so thread bare that the stuffing was exposed. The plaster ceiling in the bathroom was crumbling and falling apart in two places from obvious water damage from what we assumed was the room above. Again, we were shocked based on the hotel's reputation and price. The hotel was fully booked on Saturday night but they moved us to a larger and different room on another floor on Sunday night when they had less guests in the hotel. That room, while still well outdated in its decorating and furnishing, didn't have the stuffing coming through the chair seat material nor ceilings falling in. I must admit though that the beds and pillows in both rooms were absolutely heavenly and I could have stayed in the pillow soft beds for days! Both beds had pillow mattress tops, thick downy comforters and large downy soft pillows. Both my partner and I admitted that we had two of the best nights of sleep we've both had in a long time by sinking into the beds. Almost forgot, the hotel has a very comfortable panelled lounge with deep couches and chairs which was perfect for curling up and reading the Sunday newspaper along with the complimentary coffee served in this room. If the hotel would update the rooms and ditch the armoirs for flat screen TV's, the rooms would be roomier and far more appealing. With all of the other similarily priced but currently decorated and updated hotels in the Michigan Avenue area, I would need to see major changes to the rooms before I'd recommend The Whitehall Hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Grmurra
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff,great location,lobby in need of a reno.,room was ok,nothing special,probably a three star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, almost perfect service, but somewhat flakey Internet”
Reviews.Author: berkeleydude
Reviews.Content: Location is great if you want to be close to Michigan Ave, the Museum of Contemporary Art, etc... Only 5 blocks from the Chicago Metro stop, and there's a mall nearby if you need anything. I stayed there for two nights, and at first I found the staff very attentive. I'm allergic to feathers and asked to have all the feather bedding removed --- after being warned that it might take some time to get service, the fellow actually showed up within 5 minutes. They managed everything and even called a maintenance man to help me open my windows. Only problem (why I'm not giving them a perfect review on service) is that they never did bring me foam pillows to replace the feather ones. I called twice, asked the front desk, and each time after being told that someone was coming, nobody actually showed up. So I ended up using my towels to create a makeshift pillow. I even had my $5 tip waiting in my pocket to give the guy once he finished getting me the non-feather pillow, but he never showed to claim it! The internet access needs a card from the front desk and it worked fine the first night, but it didn't work the second night at all. Oh well. So this dinged the perfect review too. Finally, the attached Chinese restaurant was decent with *very attentive* staff that really made me feel quite comfortable. They gave me a discount because I was a hotel guest and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: skylar09
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, right in the shopping district. Closeby were plenty of restaurants, and across the road was the John Hancock Observatory. A five minute walk for beaches and a comfortable 15 mniute walk to Navy Pier. Our room was very clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. That was somewhat marred by the fact we backed onto very loud fans, which I assumed were the outlet for the air conditioners or something, and they came on early in the morning. This hotel was one of the posher more expensive on our trip, so we were suprised that they provided no free internet or computer access anywhere. It was the only hotel of 7 not to do so. However, our main purpose was to check in online for our flight and there was a complimentary terminal for this purpose. We didn't take the key for the mini bar, and very early in the morning I awoke unwell and sweltering from the temperature in the room that we were unable to cool for very long... there was a panel on the wall, and we probably should have asked for help, but anyway... as the hotel did not have vending machines (not being the cheap and cheerful kind), I ordered room service for 2 bottles of water. I was pleased it only came to Â£7.00. I do not really have anything bad to say about it, but it didn't blow me away.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a good stay”
Reviews.Author: rita1962Piacenza
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, close to everything and just a step to Michigan Ave. Very nice rooms, fair price considering the good standard. Everything about our stay was wonderful - the room was clean and quiet, mostly the staff was friendly and helpful. We can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much more.”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel, expecting excellent service due to the reviews. Check-in was smooth, and the front desk agent (a female. I forget her name. I hate to go by race to describe her, but she was Asian). She gave us a Pinnacle suite, although we had paid for just the standard room. Since it was a boutique hotel, the suite was still very small. It was fine for the two nights, but I wouldn't want to stay longer than that. My issue was definitely with the room service. My boyfriend and I came in around 11pm one night after visiting the city. We had just got stuck in the rain and we were soaking wet when we came in. I asked the front desk to send up a towel to our room, and the gentleman said he would. When we got to our room, my boyfriend then called down for ice. Less than 10 minutes later a gentleman came to our room with the ice, but no towel. The man looked, creepy, to say the least. He was tall, with messy hair. He then waited by the door for a tip. I obviously wasn't going to tip him for bringing us ice with no towel, so when we went to close the door on him he rolled his eyes at us. I am not at all impressed with the service at this hotel and probably should have stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanMOH
Reviews.Content: The room was gorgeous and comfortable. Rooms, I should say, since I was given a free upgrade to a suite. The hotel's look is somewhat old-fashioned, with low ceilings and narrow spaces sometimes, but it's what I expect in an older place and it doesn't inconvenience me. Everything worked appropriately (TV, etc) and the staff were friendly and helpful. I was extremely pleased with my stay, and I would book there again next time I go to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location/Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimifg
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Chicago on business so took hubby along with me. After researching on tripadvisor.com, I decided to go with the Whitehall because it had the following amenities that I really like when in Chicago: 1) In the middle of everything for hubby and I, but on a one-way, lovely street off of N. Michigan Ave. 2) The Red Line El is an easy three-block walk. 3) The 145/146 buses that run up and down Michigan Ave. are a block away (I had business on South Michigan). 4) A huge variety of restaurants of every type and price point. 5) Boutique hotel with historic details. (Real historical details/interest, not "run down" details.) 6) Valet Parking package was available (it's normal to pay $35 - $50 a day to park anywhere in or around the Mag Mile or downtown). In brief, The Whitehall Hotel is a lovely gem situated on N. Delaware between Rush St. and N. Michigan Ave. The nice thing about it is that you really do not get the noise problem from Michigan Ave. even though you are a 1 minute walk from N. Michigan. The hotel is directly behind the beautiful Presbyterian Church that's covered in ivy. (Worth a vist to see the grounds and the inside of the church, especially when they have chamber music - a great respite from the crowds). The rooms at The Whitehall are beautifully appointed with a variety of pillows and great beds. Extra blanket and pillow in the closet, along with robes, an umbrella to use on stomy days, a safe, etc. Bathtub/shower, sink area, toilet are smallish. I've had smaller in NYC and San Francisco. I was frankly suprised at the size of the bedroom (rather roomy with ample drawer and closet space and a writing desk with internet plug-in). There are two elevators. They are small. When I say "small" I mean they hold four or maybe five 175-pound people comfortably. Or a luggage cart and two people. There is a wonderful restaurant with 24-hour room service. The room service menu prices are not as outrageous as you would think for a boutique hotel on the Mag Mile. I had tea or coffee in the morning downstairs and ate out in other restaurants the remainer of the stay. I did have iced tea and the bruschetta off the bar menu yesterday afternoon, and the bruschetta was fabulous. The concierge was beyond helpful. She was wonderful. I overheard someone put her on task to find a Chinese restaurant that had scallion pancakes on their menu. And she got it right off the bat. "Red line to Chinatown, then across the street." Kudos to the concierge lady. The staff and management are very friendly. If staff are harried/hassled by confused tourists who hadn't done their research and didn't feel like walking one block to the Chicago Visitors Center across the street at Chicago Ave., they would get a little quick, but then so would I. Bellmen and valet staff were great and very responsive. This is an upscale boutique hotel in the Mag Mile area. If you like everything on the huge side (huge elevators, huge bathrooms, huge lobbies, etc.) this is not the hotel for you. Otherwise, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in great location”
Reviews.Author: MsBittersweet
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good value then you should stay at the Whitehall. The rooms are not super large but the beds are comfortable, clean and the location is great, near Rush St., shopping, Michigan Avenue, etc. We arrived early and were looking to just check our bags however, we were told we would be able to check in early which was great. I have stayed at other properties in Chicago including the Drake and would choose the Whitehall over the Drake for the money and the atmosphere (less pretentious). Also, if you like charming, older properties as opposed to chain hotels, the Whitehall is registered on the National Historic Registry. If I had one complaint it would be the restaurant affiliated with the hotel, the prices were expensive and service not so good. I would go elsewhere for your meals.

Reviews.Title: “Serves its purpose well”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Bear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Whitehall Hotel for five nights in July while visiting Chicago on vacation. The location is good, depending on where you plan on spending your time. Located in an upscale neighborhood, just a block from the Magnificent Mile, it's a twenty minute walk to the Chicago River and a thirty minute walk to the Navy Pier. The closest CTA station is Chicago, on the Red Line. Our room was quite spacious; having said that, it was located at the rear of the hotel, and may have a different configuration than some other rooms. If you care about a view, request a street-side room (it's not a particularly noisy street) or maybe a higher floor. We were on a lower floor and had a depressing view of the building's mechanicals. Not really a big deal since we were only in the room to sleep. The upside of being on a lower floor is that you can use the stairs and avoid the sometimes slow elevators. Our room was very clean, and housekeeping was attentive. The bed was very comfortable, with a pillow-top mattress cover. The bathroom was of average size but attractively updated with granite and tile. The room was tastefully decorated. Some of the furniture is showing a little wear but it is still in decent shape. The hotel's public rooms are beautifully decorated with a clubby, English feel. We did not happen to eat at the hotel's restaurant, but did look at the menu. The breakfast menu prices are quite pricey. There are a number of breakfast alternatives nearby, namely a very good pancake house on nearby East Bellevue Street, an Einstein's Bagels on East Walton Street, and Starbucks everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too many small inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: travelindan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here once a year for the past 4 years while visiting our son. Great hotel, great location, nice staff, but............ After a 9 hour drive and the Chicago traffic we arrive in our room ready to relax for a while. There was no room service menu so they sent one to us. Went to the mini fridge for a beer, no bottle opener. The remote for the TV did not work. Brought it to the front desk the next morning for repair and had to call for it at 6:00 pm as it was not returned to my room as promised. And this room's camode was an obsticle course for a Big guy like myself (6 ft, 1.5 inches tall, 240 lbs) as you had to manouver yourself in a narrow space between the tub and the camode wall that had the toilet paper dispenser extruding from the wall. When you get in place, the toilet paper dispenser is sitting in your lap. At breakfast we had to order 5 times as no one ever delivered what we ordered ( Hot tea and toast, OJ and english muffin) including the hostess who came over to take our 3rd order. We watch as others who arrived after us receive there full breakfasts and we waited to order. Rooms are nice size, beds are very comfortable, staff is very polite but I saw them too many times for the prblems. If you are a big person, a larger camode area would be nice and they do have rooms that have this but they are higher priced "pinnicle rooms". On our previous stays we were given complemenry upgrades to these rooms, they told me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nolikewinter
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant week's stay at the Whitehall after 2 rooms changes. In both instances, the Front Desk was most accomodating although the room was close to, or at capacity. Would certainly recommending avoiding rooms 10-13 on the lower floors as these rooms have no view and the noise is constant due to the fact that they face large air conditioning vents from the adjacent building. Our final room (a high level 04) was clean and large with the most comfortable king size bed we have ever slept in in all our years of travelling. IThe hotel is in a great location to the Magnificent Mile, the Hancock Building, a lakeside beach and a short walk to the Chicago Red Line Metro station. The restaurant is also good (try the Gnocchi with Oxtail and the seafood pizza) but the service was exceptionally poor the night we went. Staff are friendly (as are all Chicagoans) and helpful with information.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor customer service from front desk.”
Reviews.Author: Juicyjene
Reviews.Content: I came to visit downtown Chicago fir the first time on a weekend getaway for some shopping and sightseeing with my boyfriend. I thought this hotel would be great based on the star ratings and location. To keep things short -- front desk customer service was rude -- we booked online and we arrived from a long flight (8 hr red eye) just to tell us that we can wait for 3 hours or look for another hotel; rooms were clean, comfortable bed; but very outdated (it's known to be the oldest building in Chicago, so understandable); although location was great!!! 5-10 minute walk to restaurants, shopping district, and many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price for Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beerwriter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a long weekend in Chicago, paying $83 per night on an AARP rate; rooms are small, to be expected in a hotel built in 1928, but they've been kept up to date. Comfortable place to sleep but not somewhere I'd spend a lot of time. Especially since at this address there are many things to do nearby. One drawback is the lack of free wifi or free computer access at the hotel's business center. However, as with most of western civilization, there are many Starbucks and other wifi providers nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & really confortable”
Reviews.Author: DeFalkensteen
Reviews.Content: I would recommended this hotel to anyone due to his great location and room confort. The staff was really nice with us. However, no HD TV (wich look weird in 2010) and it cost 7$US + tax for 15 minutes of Internet. Feelings were not good to pay for 15 minutes of Internet. They are not winning point there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, shame about the Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: 44robman
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 nights in this hotel. Really pleased with the location, rooms were a little tired but very comfortable bed. My only complaint were the front desk staff, who were actually really rude at check in and other times during my stay. I rang down to the concierge, I think her name was Denise to help me book a restaurant, I had been recommend. She was fantastic, organised it all and even left a voucher at the front desk for me. When I went to the front desk they said they couldnt find it and basically tough luck. On another occasion I asked for a recommendation for a restaurant and told Rush St. was a block away and just to find one there. I wasnt the only guest who seemd to come up against the rude front desk staff, I saw another guest have a massive agrument with the front desk staff in front of about 10 other guests. Its all about first impressions, someone smiling and asking how you are is not too much to ask, after spending 8 hours on a flight. Other then the front desk staff I would recommed the hotel as you can practically walk everywhere from it.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: Hotel allows smoking”
Reviews.Author: SayGo_IGo_UGo2
Reviews.Content: Be careful when booking your room through Orbitz or another 3rd party. You can miss the fine print. The hotel can put you in any room they want, smoking or non-smoking, regardless of what you request. One step onto the 12th floor at the Whitehall and you will smell what that can mean. The hotel should be ashamed to rent rooms with such a horrible stench, in the curtains, linens, carpet, everywhere. You and your clothes smell of smoke when you leave. Basically, you have no choice and the staff is less than professional in they way they handle the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Run down hotel”
Reviews.Author: hal077
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location. Cons: Run down condition. Very noisy. Plumbing in paper thin walls will wake you up. When bathroom is used in rooms around you, it's like the lavatory is right beside your bed.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Concierge in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Julie-and-Timon
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I went to Chicago for a weekend getaway. The Whitehall Hotel had been recommended to us for its location (in Milennium Park) and affordability. The Whitehall is less expensive than the Four Seasons or the Drake, but right in the center of the action. The rooms were average sized and well-appointed. You could here quite a bit of street noise on the 14th floor. The best thing about the WhiteHall Hotel is the concierge, Denise Henry. She can make anything happen! She arranged spa appointments for us, a last minute car service to a concert, dinner reservations, and VIP entrance to two nightclubs. She even gave us her cell phone number and told us to text her if we needed anything after she left for the evening. She is the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: josephone
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hotel. Restaurant breakfast was excellent! The wireless is problematic and slow, but they are changing it. We loved the concierge! She was terrific. Do try Rick Bayless' Frontera grill if possible. We would stay again in a minute. we used Perfect Escapes and got a terrific rate including breakfast. Most guests were European!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenchapelhill
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hot Wire and later read some of the reviews from people who had booked that way. We had none of the bad experiences reported. The staff was courteous and helpful. Our room was very comfortable and the service great. The restaurant in the hotel serves excellent thin crust pizza. The location couldn't be more convenient for all that Chicago has to offer. We strongly recommend the hotel, no matter how you book.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly nice”
Reviews.Author: OhHim
