Reviews.Content: This past week, as my usual corporate recommended hotel was full due to the restaurant show, I ended up giving hotwire a shot as it does a good job of forcing some variety, and ended up at the Whitehall for the week. Despite some horror story reviews from other hotwire users, I was pleasantly surprised with the size of the room (nice and big - 2 queen beds), the bathroom was beautifully redone, I wasn't given by default a "smoking room" although it did have that faint lingering "was a smoking room last year" odor, but the bed was super comfy. Still, like any elegant in the 1950/1960s property, the furniture was drake-ish (antique, slightly worn, headboard wasn't on straight), electrical outlets were hard to locate, and I had one incorrect bellhop interruption (wrong room). Still, for the price, I was happy with the property and would use it as an alternative to my usual near-the-hancock Chicago spots (Westin, Raffaelo, and Hilton Suites) if the opportunity came up again.

Reviews.Title: “Like an Old Lady that needs Facelift”
Reviews.Author: LiamBuckley
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotwire where it was rated as 4 star. If this hotel is a 4 star then the Ritz Carlton is a 7 star. The star rating has become the most misused guide to a hotel but in my book a 4 star hotel has ammeneties IN the hotel. Not a bolt on restaurant and bar as this does. But I digress. Check in was busy and one poor lady was handling eveything (a common theme in other revies) so check in was slow. Several people came in after me and eventually the second reception desk was opened. Now the lady was very polite and checked myslef and my colleague into 1608 and 1708. Bearing in mind the 2 rooms were booked via Hotwire alarm bells went ringing in my head that the XX08 rooms are reserved for those patrons booking a discounted room type. My fears were confirmed when right when the lift door opened across a very narrow corrdor was 1608. On opening the poorly fitting door I entered a small room that could be described as European - at least based on it's size! Same could be said for the bathroom. Both have nice furnishings but this room would be unsuitable for 2 people. The metal framed window let in quite a bit of noise as did the door to the corridor - between the 2 it was a noisy room - light sleepers look elsewhere. Bathroom ameneties were quality and of a wide selection. Plenty of hot water and the bed was comfortable with fine sheets. There was a fake 8' plant jammed between the TV and the work desk - covered in dust - really come on, 4 Star??? The restaurant is not part of the hotel but can be accessed through the hotel. On the way you pass a beautifully appointed bar that is closed. What an opportunity missed. Like my tite says - older property with some nice window dressing but definitely not 4 star. Needs a refirb from the ground up and then it might be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - "Decent" hotel for the price, but call hotel directly and speak to someone on-site!!”
Reviews.Author: MotorCityFan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at The Whitehall Hotel in Chicago for our anniversary. The location was great for walking to all the sights. When I called the hotel directly to book our stay I was asked what our room preference was regarding smoking. I indicated that it must be a non-smoking room. I was told that a non-smoking room would be no problem and that a king was also available. Upon receiving my email confirmation it listed a smoking-king. I immediately called back and got Annie who is located on-site at the hotel. She was a pleasure to talk to, but told me that there were no non-smoking kings or queens available. She explained that when she is busy the phones ring over to a call bank and they book rooms for the hotel and just book whatever is available, but tell you what you want to hear. After a few minutes of going back and forth Annie did apologize profusely and was finally able to book us in a non-smoking queen room. If you are calling the hotel directly to book your reservation definitely speak to someone who is actually located on the premises in Chicago. The rooms are a bit dark and the bed was extremely hard. You have the normal sounds of a busy city. We travel with a sound machine to help with the city noise. Other than the booking issue and the few other minor issues we found the hotel to be decent enough to consider staying there again. The staff was pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “noisy hotel noisy plumbing”
Reviews.Author: edblab
Reviews.Content: Constatnt pounding during daytime must be some sort of remodel. Plumbing was a disaster, I had to get maintaince man to showe me how to flush ( takes a bone breaking slam - not a twist or turn ). When anyone in the building flushed, small children in 3 states reached for the mother's hand in terror.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel - Some Minor Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Sekao22
Reviews.Content: Great location right by the Magnificent Mile/John Hancock Tower and lots of things to do in the the area. Had some issues with the electricity going out in the room, and the door to the bathroom had some very noticeable damage. Otherwise, the room was very comfy and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice For The Price”
Reviews.Author: number10Toledo_ohio
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Whitehall Hotel April 5-9. Yes, it is an OLD but the halls and rooms have been referburbished. The place was clean and the staff very helpful. The rooms are small, after all it is a circa 20-30 hotel, and are very comfortable. If you looking to camp out on your hotel room, this is not the place to stay...go to the Hyatt or Ritz and pay the BIG bucks. You can get a nightly rate at the Whitehall for under $80.00 if u shop around. AND !!! it's located perfectly between the Mag Mile and Rush St. TRY IT. YOU'LL LIKE IT ! Though, I'm not sure it should be a four star...maybe 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel like a second-class guest since I booked through Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: macIowa
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at this historic hotel and looked forward to my two-night stay. I booked through Hotwire. I was given a smoking room (without being asked my preference at the front desk first- I just assumed I'd get non-smoking) and when I spied the ashtrays after entering my room, I asked for a non-smoking room. The management reluctantly gave me one (across from an elevator, I might add) but said I should read my Hotwire fine print more closely. Because I booked through Hotwire, I could not choose the room I received. This made me feel like a second class citizen and set a negative tone for my whole stay. Hotwire helps fill many hotel rooms that would ordinarily be empty (indeed, my floor at the Whitehall over the Sunday night I stayed was certainly not full). How I book a room should NOT affect the quality of service I receive. Many hotels I book through Hotwire, I love so much, I go back to, booking directly with the hotel. This will not be the case with Whitehall.

Reviews.Title: “Impossible to get a good night's sleep -- hotel also way understaffed”
Reviews.Author: KatieCcccc
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a horrible stay. I stayed at the Whitehall for four nights after booking it via Hotwire, which gave it four stars. The worst problem: No sleep. The hotel is very noisy (very old, thin windows and doors), and the heat in our room went on overdrive every night. My husband and I each woke up at least three times a night: At least once because it was 75+ degrees in our room, despite the thermostat being set in the low 60s, and a couple of times because of noise from outdoors or the hallways. I did complain to the front desk after a couple nights of this. The manager called my room a couple of times (during the day, when I was out), but never reached me. He did have my cell phone number, which he never attempted to call. At one point, someone from the front desk sent up an engineer. He came up, put his hand in front of the vent, said, "It's working," and left. So we were stuck with a horrible room. I had plenty of other complaints, but they were minor. However, when added up, they made for one of the worst hotel stays Iâ€™ve had in years. Hereâ€™s a sample: Very shabby hotel: It seemed fairly clean (although donâ€™t use the phones in the rooms without wiping them down first â€“ they actually smelled bad). But lots of things were falling apart. There were cracks between the windows and their frames. The water wasnâ€™t reliably hot, and whenever our neighbor flushed his or her toilet, the water would actually stop running for a second. Understaffed: The staff were all very nice, but there werenâ€™t enough of them. I had to wait in a long line when I arrived, as only one person was working at the front desk. Once I checked in, I went up to my room on the ninth floor. Key didn't work. Trudged back down, bags in tow, only to have to wait another 15 minutes in the line. Got my key fixed, went back up -- nope, still couldn't get into my room. Downstairs, another long wait, and this time a bellhop came up with me. Turned out there was a trick to opening the door -- you had to hold the handle in the down position, and THEN insert the key card. So it took me close to an hour to get into my room. Basically, it seems like this hotel is riding on its location. It has the feeling of a place that hasn't been maintained well at all, and hasn't been invested in for many years. Many of the front desk people and bellhops were very nice, but world-class service can't make up for lack of sleep and a hotel that is shabby and falling apart. I actually changed my travel plans and checked out a night early. It was great to finally get a full night of sleep. Other cons: Limited room service hours. Poor fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trishalish
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and very convenient to Water Tower Place. Many great restaurants within a couple of blocks. Beautifully decorated. Our room had a feather tick on top of the mattress. Beautiful high quality furniture and linens. Not a huge room, but not cramped either. Marble and mosaic bathroom was beautiful. We pulled into the parking across the street--$35/day. No coffeepot in room, but everything else total luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Reminds me of a London hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spenser
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel,efficient and pleasant staff. The location is right off Rush St, near the lake and and an easy cab ride into the Loop. The rooms are very nice with very good beds. What else could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay Here. They will rip you off!”
Reviews.Author: crussell10
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this place again. They ripped us off. Hotwire rated it as a 4-star, but this is certainly not at that level. I will never stay at White Hall again, and I will never use Hotwire again. Terrible mistake.

Reviews.Title: “History Without Quality”
Reviews.Author: ggbeaumont
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 6:00 PM, to wait 20 minutes in line to check in. There were stations for two agents, but one overwhelmed individual had to handle all the guests. The bellman never arrived, contrary to promise. The small hotel elevator took us to the 4th floor, complete with plastic sheets on the carpeting. As we entered our room, we were greeted by a rather dark 1940's style room. There was no refrigerator nor a coffee maker. An armoire with TV had a broken door which fell off its bracket when opened. Individual switches on each lamp made it a chore to arrange for sufficient light. Guests are limited to one very small drawers per person. We found a letter to guests, notifying them that since renovations were in progress, they should expect noise from 9AM, even on weekends. Not a welcoming message. The bathroom was immaculate and the sink tap brought forth plenty of hot water, inspiring hopes of a steamy morning shower. Those hopes were dashed at 8AM, when we shivered in the shower, as the water temps hovered roughly two degrees above tepid. As we arrived in the hotel restaurant on a weekend morning, we were turned away. The hotel management had booked a private party, despite the fact that there was a fully renovated dining room on the second floor. Our concerns about our bathroom, previously considered immaculate were reignited when we saw one single housekeeper cleaning without cart, her supplies limited to two rags and a spray bottle. No mops. No vacuum. At check out we were assured that our bags could be checked while we made a shopping trip. When we returned, we discovered all bags were unsecured, lined up in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: x94cherry
Reviews.Content: I think I paid about $65 for this room, and I got what I expected for that price--a very nicely done room that's showing its age. The room was decent-sized and clean, slightly frumpy and a little worn. It had a nice big closet and a pretty but very small marble bath. The furniture was nice, but nothing special, with the exception of the bed, which was great--very, very comfortable. The view out the window was a wall, which I suppose is fine for the price we paid. The one big problem with the room was that the shower drain was clogged. This is not OK at a 4-star hotel, period. Other than that, everything was fine, comfortable and quiet. The service was good, although I was not impressed with the common areas, they were small and dark and cave-like. And the location was pretty, not all that close to the El, but very close to Rush Street, which is fun if you like that area. So, it's not my new favorite hotel or anything, but overall I had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tack6153
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Dec 31- Jan 03 and loved it. You will be hard pressed to find a better location and the staff was super friendly and upgraded our room even though we booked through Hotwire at a really cheap rate. There was plastic in the hall due to the renovation but it was not a big deal. The room itself was fairly large for a downtown hotel room but the bath room was small. The TV is older but worked just fine. The king size bed was so comfortable that my wife wanted to take it home with us. If you want a flat screen TV and sleek modern furnishings then you might want to look elsewhere. If you want a clean comfortable room in a great location then this hotel will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the windy city”
Reviews.Author: wattg45
Reviews.Content: Hotel was as described and whilst there was obvious works going on in the hotel we never heard anything. Staff were always polite and welcoming and its situ is ideal. I would recommend The Old Pancake House for breakfast, as per other trip advisor recommendations, it is superb quality and value.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location..”
Reviews.Author: charlok5
Reviews.Content: this hotel is smack bang in the middle of everything great location and great hotel ,hotel rooms are lovely what more could you need..

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Blackcat2york
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Whitehall for five nights in mid October at a good rate, the very first destination of an extended round the world post-retirement trip with our backpacks. The helpful receptionist gave us a beautiful junior suite when she heard about our plans. This historic hotel is really well located, just off Michigan Avenue and very smartly decorated and furnished. We used the restaurant once for an evening meal and the food was very good, but expensive, but then most of the Chicago restaurants are pricey in that area. Wifi is not free but we were able to take advantage of a signal in our room from a neighbouring hotel and also many cafes have free wifi. We had breakfast at Yolk (a trendy place on Wells St) and also at the Corner Bakery Cafe on Rush, both great places. Staff were very helpful and we had a wonderful time. The only disadvantages for us were that the room was a little dark and as often is the case, it was somewhat warm, even with the air-conditioning. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a very quant environment”
Reviews.Author: jdooger1
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall is an older, but renovated of course, boutique style hotel in downtown Chicago. It is in a wonderful location. You are in very close proximity to the Magnificent Mile, Lake Michigan, Navy Pier, and Rush St... All easily within walking distance. The location is also nice because the street it is on is usually pretty calm throughout the day and night... Really the only other thing on the block is the Four Seasons. The room was small, but fairly well appointed. The bed was very nice and comfy, the bathroom was clean and updated. We booked through an online travel site at a really great rate, so honestly we were very pleasantly surprised with what we ended up with. The hotel staff was always courteous. There were always bellmen waiting at the door no matter the hour. We did not try room service or the adjoined restaurant. I'd definitely recommend this hotel if you are traveling to Chicago on a budget or a sightseeing trip. Its a really good value.

Reviews.Title: “This is no four star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stjohnqwimby
Reviews.Content: I took a chance on Hotwire, and what a mistake. It was cheap but Hotwire misrepresented the star rating. They said four stars but to my eyes it is two stars. Starting at the reception, where the paint on the wood trim looks old and five layers thick. The room is old, dated, not renovated for several decades. The air unit was noisy. The room layout was awkward. The TV was old school. The light switch did not work. Bed was good, so was water pressure. Shower curtains were the really thick plastic type that does not bend. It is an embarrassing address. Had to leave. Got no refund, lost two nights. Went to the lovely Dana down the street. Lesson...never again Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: SlaterAC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Whitehall for 6 nights last month and have no complaints. The location is perfect for exploring some of the tourist highlights, good restaurants and of course the shopping. Staff were friendly and helpful at all times and the room we had (which i think was a standard) was spacious and very nicely furnished. In my opinion you would be paying a lot more for a better hotel than this and unless you were splashing out for a honeymoon or something i wouldn't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: smoovy
Reviews.Content: I often joke with friends about people who complain about hotels on Tripadvisor...but now I know how the cranky travelors feel. We booked the Whitehall hotel through Hotwire for Labor Day weekend. It was supposed to be 4 star, and I've never been as disappointed in a hotel. This place is a dump. It's under construction and the staff is rude. (We had to wake up the front desk person to check us in at midnight last night.) We routinely work from hotels. I knew that this hotel charges for internet, but they charge $10 for every laptop you want to use...so we are paying $30 a day for internet access in this hotel which is outrageous. The room isn't even worth $30. From a typically easy going travelor, take my advice and avoid the Whitehall Hotel. It's a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Whitehall.”
Reviews.Author: SuziR
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here we nearly didn't book but expedia were offering a good rate for our 8 night stay, so we went ahead regardless and were pleased we had. From the minute we stepped out of the taxi we were made to feel very welcome. All the staff we encountered were friendly, welcoming and polite. Check in was quick and efficient and we didn't smell any strange smells in the lobby during our 8 days!! Our room was 1313, maybe unlucky for some but not for us. The room was a good size and was spotlessly clean. The bed was superb, we wanted to ship it home. The air con worked very well too (a problem for some other reviewers). The bathroom was also a nice size and very clean. Towels and toiletries were in good supply. We were obviously in one of the newly renovated rooms as there was no problem with tired looking furnishings, dusty carpets or peeling wallpaper. Facilities in the room included a minibar, TV, hairdryer, safe, iron/ironing board and robes. No tea/coffee making facilites are in the room but it is available in the lobby in the morning. Ice is brought by the evening turn down service. We were situated at the end of a corridor and rarely heard any noise from other guests. We had partial views of the Hancock Tower and because our room was overlooking the church and a quiet side road we didn't hear much noise from outside either. There is a notice in the room to warn you of renovation work and they do have plastic sheeting down in the corridors but if we did happen to be in the room during the day (when jetlag kicked in) we didn't hear any extra noise. Probably the best part of The Whitehall though is its location. Just off Mag Mile its easy to reach most of downtown Chicago by foot and its very safe. We walked as far south as Soldier Field and as far north as North Ave beach. The only public transport we used was the water taxi but that was more for sightseeing than necessity. The John Hancock Tower is virtually on the doorstep as is great shopping and lots of nice restaurants. Finally, we didn't eat at the hotel restaurant at all but can definitely recommend Tempo Cafe (2 blocks away on the corner of E Chestnut and N State) for a lovely filling breakfast. Don't be put off by the crowds outside, head to the front and put your name on the list, its worth the wait. We ate there everyday.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it -- Obviously depends on the room...”
Reviews.Author: JoJoKo
Reviews.Content: We loved the Whitehall. Our room had been renovated, which means: 1. Best bed and linens ever 2. Lovely marble bathroom with nightlight 3. Good TV Four things we loved most: 1. Great concierges. Booked us and our Chicago family on a fab architecture cruise. Also good advice about where to catch the bus. 2. Best brewed coffee in the morning in the lobby. 3. Nicest, most pleasant staff 4. Location, half block from the John Hancock tower Hint: go to the Original Pancake House for one of the best breakfast ever.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had known they were under construction”
Reviews.Author: mal1515
Reviews.Content: I just got married in Chicago and our entire wedding group stayed at the Whitehall Hotel. It would have been nice if they would have told us that they were under construction on EVERY floor. The upside is that we were so busy that we were not in the rooms long so we did not hear any of the construction, but there is plastic on the floors and several rooms on each floor are being worked on. The best part about this hotel is their beds and showers ( the water pressure is great!!). I would stay here if you want to be close to the magnificent mile, but if you are looking for a fancy hotel this is not your place.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Calvin1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our annivesary weekend at the Whitehall; and boy was it a disappointment. Although the location is terrific, we had a Pinnacle room which is supposed to be their high end room. The room (other than the bedding0 was nothing special. The bathroom needed alot of work and generally, it looked like no one had dusted in the corners for years. The worst part was that we wanted to take a architectural boat trip and the concierge pushed us to take one that was not on the list we had gotten from several travel guides. We paid more at the hotel than we would have paid at the site (including the coupon we had). What a bummer. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: LadyWanderLust
Reviews.Content: I give the Whitehall 5 stars for location; 5 stars for the morning crew's attention to detail and guest satisfaction, and 1-star for the night crew's attitude & treatment of guests. Overall, I give this hotel 4 stars. What prevents 5 stars? The hotel is under construction (limited disruption to a stay at this hotel) and just how badly the nighttime staff ignored us. However, Nicholas and Francisco (A.M. crew) more than made up for that. Those two worked their tails off to make this a great stay for us. The hotel literally is ON the Magnificent Mile--very close to shopping, Chicago Tribune, Chicago River, etc. Also, there are so many bus routes that run close to the hotel and because there is a CTA stop nearby, the whole city is readily ACCESSIBLE. The room was beautifully decorated and felt luxurious. No breakfast available, but there is tea/coffee in the lobby in the A.M. I would most definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beware of alley-side rooms”
Reviews.Author: svenfontana
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are on a budget, and seems typical of other older hotels I have stayed in - nothing flashy. The location is great for the north end of Michigan Ave., and it is about a 5 minute walk to the subway. The down side: my room was adjacent to the alley: between restaurant deliveries and daily garbage trucks I certainly didn't need an alarm, even 7 floors up. A similar phenomenon for the interior noise - anyone getting off the elevator down the hall sounded like they were two feet away with sound channeled through an ill-fitting door. Little noise coming through the walls, but the doors and windows may as well have been open. The staff were quite helpful and eager to please - I noticed that they went out of their way for a couple of different parties checking in while I was there - very friendly. A better room location would have made this 5 of 5 for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location - just beware of AC issues”
Reviews.Author: Bon_voyage79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Whitehall with my friend this past weekend. The room was a bargain - $80 (including taxes) from Orbitz. For that price, the hotel didnâ€™t have to provide much. I came in with low expectations and was pleasantly surprised. We were given a nice sized room on the 15th floor. Though we didnâ€™t really have a view, we werenâ€™t smack up against another building either, so I was happy with what we got. The room was tastefully decorated and actually looked better than the pictures on the website. The bed was fairly comfortable and the closet had tons of hangers that came in very useful. The bathroom was an adequate size and had the toiletries were refilled daily. The room was very quiet. Occasionally, we heard people in the hall, but we never heard voices or TV coming from an adjoining room. That, right there, is worth quite a bit. Now, for the AC issues. We were in a room with central air, and during the day it seemed to work great. The temperature controls responded, and when we set it at 69, the room actually cooled to 69, but for some reason, during the night, the AC did not work at all. We could set it at 60, and the temperature would continually rise. We usually woke up at about the time the room hit 77 or 78 and we realized we had flung the covers off in a fit of sweat. The room was kept clean, for the most part, but one day our room didnâ€™t get cleaned until 4:30 p.m. or so. And I noticed a few red specks/splotches on the ceiling in one area. It kind of creeped me out, but I decided to try to overlook it. Really, the best part about this hotel was the location, especially if you are a shopper. Itâ€™s only a block off Michigan Avenue, and itâ€™s super easy to do shopping and drop your bags off at your room. Itâ€™s also easy to buy a quick snack or grab bottled water at one of the nearby drugstores, the Potbelly Sandwich Works (in the nearby Bloomingdales mall), Starbucks or McDonaldâ€™s (all within a couple blocks of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Nice Hotel Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: cnote1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days on business and found the hotel to be very nice. I got a room at the back, end of the building, which allowed a larger , comfortable room. The staff was extremely attentive. The hotel has a very nice, older world anbaince. The bar is like a fabulous old men's club - heavy paneling, sumptuous sofas and low lighting - very, very nice place to work during the day when the bar is closed. Although it may be a personal taste thing; and older couple walked through while I was there and I heard the elderly gentleman say, "This is like a funeral parlour"! I certainly disagreed with him! Not much lobby, but i didn't need one. Right near the Hancock Tower, restaurants and great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection as usual”
Reviews.Author: jgflys
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Whitehall. Once again it was perfect in every way. The rooms are well decorated and plush. We stayed on the 19th floor and the view was great. We personally prefer boutique hotels because of all the little details they offer over large chain hotels. The whitehall has a great location which is close to everything. Parking is right across the street or you can valet. Shopping is right around the corner so is the bar scene. We have been to the other surrounding high end hotels and none of these hotels even come close to the Whitehall. We stayed in the Whitehall suite. The room had two bathrooms a dining and bar area, living room, dressing room, and of course an impressive bedroom. The lobby of this hotel is very nice and simple. The rooms where you spend most of your time is where all the relaxation lies. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. All in all I highly recommend this hotel. Its the only place I will stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, loud a/c”
Reviews.Author: JustBeachy5
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice (older but remodeled.) Mattress, duvet, pillows were luxurious. Room was spotless. The staff downstairs was very friendly and attentive. My only complaint would be that the individual a/c unit in our room was very, very , very noisy. I understand that the hotel is trying to replace these with central air so maybe in a year, this will no longer be an issue. On the positive side, it drowned out any traffic noise there may have been.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great beds”
Reviews.Author: MiMiPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Since we are familiar with Chicago, we were looking for a central location, walking distance to shopping and clean rooms. The Whitehall met all of our expectations. The staff at the Whitehall were courteous and very helpful. The rooms were clean and the beds extremely comfortable. The location was excellent for walking to Michigan Avenue shopping. We did hear some Air conditioning concerns from other travelers but did not have any problems in either of our 2 rooms.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Russell47
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall is located near the Magnificent mile and the John Hancock building. It is near CTA bus and rail transport and the Lake Shore. Service was great and the food in the Hotel restaurant was much better expected for a hotel restaurant. They actually gave us more food than we could eat so we difinitly felt like we got our monies worth. We had a corner room. Very clean and comfortable. The only negative..It was difficult to see the TV from the bed. Overall, a great place to stay at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: PieO314
Reviews.Content: After my experience this past weekend, I felt compelled to write my first hotel review ever. My family and I came to Chicago for a wedding and chose this hotel first and foremost because of the location. It's central location was key because we were only going to be in town for the weekend, and it was in the middle of everywhere we needed to be for our numberous weekend activities. When I arrived to checkin on Friday night around 8pm, I was told that all three of our rooms were unavailable, and the rest of the rooms were booked. They said that there had been a "plumbing problem." No effort to contact me in advance was made, even though I had booked 2 months in advance. When asked what other options there were, I was told that there were 3 rooms available at the BEST WESTERN A MILE SOUTH of the hotel. Only after some haggling did they even offer to comp the first night. I thought that this was somewhat of a luxury hotel with luxury prices, and for them to offer me a night at the Best Western was incredulous, not to mention that it put us a mile south of where we had planned to be. They wanted us to check out of the Best Western the next day and check back into the Whitehall , which was impossible because we had a schedule to keep during the day. That is not the kind of service I expect from an establishment such as this. Only after complaining did they offer to put us up at the Talbott Hotel a block away. Why did they not offer this in the first place? It made the first offer at the Best Western feel like a huge lowball offer. Their explanation was that the hotel also owned the Best Western. I guess management cares more about cutting costs than about customer service. Two hours of my Friday night was wasted with this hotel which made me miss most of the reception that was taking place nearby. The best outcome of this whole ordeal was the TALBOTT Hotel. It was a beautiful and intimate boutique hotel, with spacious rooms and an incredibly professional staff. If you are visiting Chicago want to stay in a great location with wonderful comfort, service, and style, do yourself a favor and spare yourself the hassle, STAY AT THE TALBOTT Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sloane1121
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago and we weren't quite sure where to stay. Due to the reviews on here and because I was able to get decent rates we decided to stay here. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised with with this hotel. It is in a wonderful location, the staff were very friendly and accommodating and check-in was easy. This hotel is 1/2 block off of the magnificent mile and the John Hancock building. The hotel is cozy and inviting. I loved the fact that we were in the middle of this huge city but the hotel was intimate and I felt like I was at home. The rooms are very nice and spacious enough for 2 people and the beds are very comfortable. We had a great stay and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Across from 4 Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Hiker24
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms both were a great value! Family members stayed at the four seasons and spent $400.00 a night more than our rooms. Room 1 had a king bed and a goofy sized Bathroom and the view was the side of a building. Room was very clean and cozy! Room 2 was an upgrade for $20.00. 2 Queens and a full Bathroom and the veiw was "Delaware Place" The street in Front of the Hotel. Very nice room lots of room and a much better view for the first time visitor would recommend spending the extra money for the upgrade! Room was clean and very comfortable. The only draw back was the 1 small elavator and the long waits to go up and down. Should be a lot better when they are done remodling. The staff is the best! from the door man all the way to the cleaning Staff I would give them an A+

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mightymoe75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a one-night getaway, and I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby, elevators and halls were smallish, as is to be expected from a boutique hotel that dates to the 1930's. They were nonetheless well-appointed. Check-in was smooth, the valet fast. The room itself was SWEET. It was a bit small, but well appointed too. Bed was perfect, the bathroom spotless and tastefully appointed, with higher-end guest toiletries. The only gripe would be that the walls seem a bit thin. Other than that, great stay, walking distance to the city's best restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room and location. Faultless.”
Reviews.Author: believeme79
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from 5 nights in Chicago staying at the Whitehall. The hotel was for me, perfect. A great location just off the Magnificent Mile. Close to all the shops and restaurants nearby. The loop is walkable as is Lincoln Park from the hotel. The hotel is not part of a chain group which I think makes it all the better. It has a more personal feel to it and adds to the experience. The room was great and the bed and pillows are the most comfortable I have experienced. The staff were very helpful and just after check in, the guy on the front desk (Lemar I think) called to see if we were happy with our room. Great staff, great hotel, and reasonable price. All in all, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. If I'm back in Chicago I know where I'll be staying. 10 out of 10. Richard, Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Small Feel in a Big City”
Reviews.Author: FloorPro
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was nice. The electronics and decor could use an update.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Alternative To Bigger City Hotels”
Reviews.Author: dopplersmash
Reviews.Content: A business trip to the Windy City helped me discover the Whitehall, as I was looking for a smaller property. It has a truly boutique feel with a very cozy lobby and a European flair to hallways and rooms. The elevators were super fast. My king bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was upscale and reasonable in size. The size of my room was fairly small but nothing out of the ordinary for a city property. Staff was helpful and delivered a remote for the TV to my room when I called to let them know that mine was missing. Internet access is a daily fee. What prevented this property from getting a five rating? Climate control. My room was cold the first night with no warm air coming out of the radiator when the thermostat was set to heat. I reported it the next morning and came back to find the room stifling with warm air pouring out. Even with the thermostat off and the window being kept a crack open with 30-degree cold outside, the room stayed too hot. Either 64 degrees or 80 degrees were the two choices for my room temperature, regardless of thermostat setting. I'm trying to not focus on that, however, as this property is a true find on a quiet side street in the northern part of the downtown area, just steps away from Magnificent Mile shopping. If you're looking for an alternative to the big chains in a great location, strongly take a look at the Whitehall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DonPleau
Reviews.Content: After a very nice stay in a Chicago landmark hotel our car was damaged while being stored in valet parking. The car was seven months old with out damage. The valet who parked the car confirmed there was not any damage to the car. The security officer assigned to the case was very professional and courteous. He requested damage repair bids, and reimbursed for the damages in a short period of time. Not only is the hotel beautiful, this service concerning the damage to the vehicle was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: tianuki
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews after booking and paying for the room and was very concerned about what it would be like. I just came back from my trip and I have to tell you I loved the hotel! First of all, the hotel room was quite big, with a very comfortable king bed. I have stayed at the Hilton Two Towers and the bedroom was about half the size than at the Whitehall. The bathroom was real cute, although yes you had to carefully close the faucet so it would not leak (but it was possible to make it stop leaking). Even though we paid a really low rate, we got a nice bedroom from which we could see the Hancock Tower. Service was fast (we forgot shaving cream and got it in less than 2 minutes), and the room was fully equiped with a good hair dryer, a good iron and iron board, and two nice robes. The elevators... We did not have to wait once! Almost as if it were a joke, right after we checked in the elevator's doors opened. Our conference was at the Avenue Hotel, and there you had to wait about 5 minutes everytime you wanted to go up or down. The heating system was a bit too loud. Of course the location is great, so close to the Hancock Tower. Bloomingdale's mall is nice and has a cute Christmas tree. There is McCormicks & Schmidt round the corner with a cool bar (happy hour 10.30 to 11.30pm), and other nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Whitehall Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyonslib
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful trip to The Whitehall Hotel in Chicago. I was skeptical about staying at this hotel due to some of the negative reviews. I was pleasantly surprised. I loved the hotel & will stay there again. The accomodations and service were outstanding!!! Renata and Alex in the lobby were exceptional!!!!!!!! Thanks for a wonderful stay!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: susie617
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one week at the Whitehall. It was fantastic! The most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. The food at the Hotel's restaurant was well above par. Try the corned beef hash for breakfast - BEST I EVER HAD! We plan to return again - hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, fantastic location...”
Reviews.Author: OakleyEsq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Whitehall while I was taking the Illinois Bar Exam in late July, 2008. Overall, the stay was quite pleasant. Check-in was quick, and a friend and I were both upgraded. As far as service, it was always very efficient and friendly. When I alerted the desk that the safe was not working properly, a very courteous employee came up instantly and quickly reset the safe. As far as the room, I found no major problems. I knew there may be a few "rough edges" here and there from reading previous reviews, and was not disappointed by the hotel whatsoever. There was a little bit of what seemed to be water damage on the wallpaper in a corner, and I noted one 1" slit in a pillowcase. Aside from that, everything was very clean and fairly up-to-date. Sure, the elevators are tiny and one public restroom on the ground floor was very tight, but I knew that going in. My room was very quiet (and cool via the a/c), and the bed/linens were extremely comfortable--just what I needed to relax in preparation for my exam. Some previous reviews seem a little dramatic - I had read them, prepared for the worst, and was generally very pleased with the room. And hey - for what you pay (I paid $159 a night), it was a great deal. What do you expect? I doubt you can find anything comparable (wich such a fantastic location) for less!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: prundell
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a special "Girls Weekend" and birthday celebration as we were enticed by the advertisements such as: "newly renovated boutique hotel near downtown Chicago." We arrived at the hotel and immediately had the following issues: â€¢Their restaurant and bar were not working because of some electrical and licensure issue â€¢No room service was available â€¢One of the elevators was not working â€¢The bellman would not help us with our luggage â€¢One room had no A/C during the entire stay We understood that for about one day. However, this occurred during our entire, 3 night stay. We had three rooms booked at this hotel for 2-3 nights. We brought these issues up the hotel and to the hotel manager and they would not do anything about giving us a reduced rate. We brought up directly to the hotel manager that none of the amenities that they offered and/or advertised were available for our use. They did offer us one free ride in their hotel limousine within a 2 mile radius of the hotel for our troubles as well free beer/wine in a conference room and some free pastries for breakfast. However, these amenities were already offered with the hotel, so this was nothing extra! For $250-300 per night we could have stayed across the street at the Four Seasons Hotel AND had all of the amenities that go with such a hotel for that price per night. The Whitehall Hotel has now lost five guests for good, one of which was a travel agent!

Reviews.Title: “Another stay which was fine”
Reviews.Author: Spiderpig41
Reviews.Content: Popped back in last Saturday for another night stay visiting Chicago for dinner with a friend. Slight delay at check in less than 5 minutes. Got to the room and it was fine. The only issue was the thermostat for the air conditioner needed a bit of work to sort it out. Bathroom was clean and the decor was ok. I'm not over enthused with views from rooms as I tend to treat the room as a place to get changed and sleep in - nothing more, I am not known to lift the bed to check for things. I paid $180 for the night, my companion quite liked it and we have to remember this was not purpose built as an hotel so the construction aspect of the property is not as good as say the 4 Seasons (which I find pretentious and unfriendly) or the Westin (which I found soulless). So choose which you prefer. I like the Palmer and the Silversmith but they are too far away when you only have 36 hours to meet up, shop and get on your way. So all in all I was happy.

Reviews.Title: “Joni”
Reviews.Author: jony24
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time on-line looking for the "right" hotel we would want and the Whitehall was what I wanted for our 30th anniversary. It was even better than expected. I've booked on-line before and was deeply dissappointed. But at the Whitehall our Pinnacle King was wonderful. We had a four poster bed with more than enough down pillows, down comforter, wonderffully comfortable sheets, clean room, great balthroom. The staff went out of their way to be helpful but not intrusive. So close to everything you would want:: Michigan Ave., State Street, Rush. A hotel with such wonderful character. I thank them for helping us have a wonderful anniversary weekend. We'll be back definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Checked out 10 minutes after we checked in!”
Reviews.Author: ck0728
Reviews.Content: A disaster from the start. We had reserved two adjoining rooms at the Whitehall, upon check-in were told that 1) only one of the rooms was ready (it was 4:30pm!) and 2) that they actually don't have adjoining rooms. There was confusion among the front desk staff about the difference between rooms "next to" each other and rooms "near" each other. We had waited about 20 minutes just to get to the front of the check-in line, so we just wanted to get to our rooms to relax before dinner and took what we were given. Next, the room. I'd expect better from a motel. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls (see pictures) and the a/c unit was literally falling out of the wall. After a little debate and a few phone calls, we gathered our things and checked out. I will say that the front desk manager handled the situation well and did not charge us a penny. Skip it--there are better hotel deals in the city. The only thing going for the Whitehall is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Had a Great Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: smcdermid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a hotel downtown to stay at while we celebrated our 6 year anniversary. We stayed downtown on our wedding night, so we wanted to stay downtown again. But it was the week of a huge music festival and prices were skyhigh. So we searched and found a great price online for the Whitehall. We knew nothing about it, but looked it up on tripadvisor (as we always do). Many people had good, and some bad things to say about the hotel...but our experience was all good. First, great location. Blocks away from the Hancock building, shopping, great food...and everything is in walking distance. Second, the hotel is classically beautiful and clean. Finally, they treated us well. We had a problem with our air conditioner, they fixed it quickly. When they found out it was our anniversary, they upgraded us. We were thrilled with our whole experience and would recomend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAnkeny
Reviews.Content: Has the ambience of a fine European hotel. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster....It has such potential”
Reviews.Author: mjm86
Reviews.Content: I was at the Whitehall Hotel on July 22nd & 23rd and was extremely disappointed. I had similar troubles as the other reviews such as closets that don't work and wet floors by the air conditioning unit. However, my big trouble started the night of the 23rd. After returning from dinner at about 11:30pm, the key to my room wouldn't work. I went to the front desk to get a new key, still no luck. I went back and they sent someone up that had all the keys, again no luck. I went down to the lobby and they said they were going to call maintenance. At 1am I must have fallen asleep in the lobby, around 2am, I was told there was a room they could put me in for a few hours while they wait for maintenance. I went to this temporary room around 2:30am because I had to depart by 8am I awoke at 6:30am to see if my room was available to get my things. Guess what, it still was not ready. At 7:10am, I received a call that the door was open (they had to cut the door apart to get in the room). As I was leaving, I asked to speak to the manager about my stay and was told that he was not available and would have to call later in the day. I left without settling my bill. I did receive a call later in the day from manager and he offered me a gift certificate for a future visit. After much discussion, I received credit for my stay. A few days later I had to call to have a receipt faxed up to me and found a number of room charges put on there that I never used. I am guessing the people that got the door open helped themselves to the bar in the room. I know this is a long review but I want people to be aware that this is an older hotel that has not been maintained well and when issues do arise don't expect immediate help.

Reviews.Title: “There's lots to fix”
Reviews.Author: Floraelsa
Reviews.Content: Even if we didn't have a terrible experience with the front desk about the inadequacy of our first room, I would have to comment on how the hotel has deteriated since our stay just a year ago. The staff is still extremely cordial (except for our checking in experience), but our room was in terrible shape. The sliding closet doors would absolutely not move. One was open so we had access to the hangers but could not use the safe which was behind the closed part. The magnifying mirror in the bathroom was on a loose bracket and could not be used because it hung so low, not to mention that the light on it did not work. The chair at the desk had upholstery so worn that the stuffing was coming through. It looked like it should be on the sidewalk for garbage pickup. This is very sad because we were looking forward to our return after a wonderful stay last year.

Reviews.Title: “Has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: beach19
Reviews.Content: We discovered the Whitehall Hotel in July 2007 and had a lovely stay. Went back in July 2008 and we had a TERRIBLE experience. We arrived a bit early for check-in on a Thursday and our 2 rooms were not ready. Returned at the 3 pm check-in time and the rooms were still not ready. Waited another 30 minutes before we were given our keys. One of our rooms was tiny and across from the elevator and our other room was more spacious and down the hall away from the noise of the elevator. I went down to the front desk, explained the differences in our 2 rooms and asked to be put in a room comparable to the larger quieter room. We were told that would be an "upgrade" and would cost us $30 more per night. Since I couldn't imagine how that could be, as we booked and paid for identical rooms at the same time, we were told that was the case. I asked to speak with the manager but was told that the manager was in a meeting. Because we only had 60 minutes to get settled and ready for our evening reservations, I requested the larger room anyway and asked that the manager call us when the meeting was concluded. Went to our "upgraded" more expensive room and found the following- 1) Fabric on the chair at the desk was worn to threads and the stuffing was showing. 2) Attempted to use the iron to touch up our clothes but the iron did not work. Called down to the front desk for a new iron. 30 minutes later- still no iron. After the 2nd call a new iron was delivered. 3) Closet doors were broken and we could only slide it to one side, which made access to the safe impossible. 4) Magnifying mirror in the bathroom was hanging loose from the wall. The front desk mangager called our room 1 hour later and even after I explained everything to her she was NOT going to make any adjustment. We arrived back from our evening activities to find a message from the hotel MANAGER telling us that as a "courtesy" they were reduciung the SURCHARGE FROM $30 PER NIGHT TO "$15" PER NIGHT. WOW, how generous of them!! The Whitehall Hotel is an old converted apartment house and they seem to have missed adding those nice little details that other small boutique hotels offer. Fresh flowers are displayed in the lobby but are not refreshed and sat there wilted. The lobby and halls are not air conditioned and can get very uncomfortable on hot, muggy days. The location of the hotel is great and other than the management, the staff is very nice. Chicago is not lacking in hotels, so we won't be returning to the Whitehall next year.

Reviews.Title: “Superior accomodations at a great price”
Reviews.Author: RedGoat67
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall Hotel provided us with a large room with a king size bed. The view overlooked Water Tower Place and Hancock Bldg. One block from the Magnificent Mile. The room was exceptionally clean and well appointed. It even had what appeared to be a mink fir piece covering the lower portion of the bed. The bathroom was done in marble tile and was quite attractive. Each morning we received USA Today and could get complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby. The staff was overly helpful and friendly. We arrived at 10 a.m. and called to see if we could check in at that time. They said ordinarily we could but their computer was temporarily down and they didn't know which room they could give us. They graciously took our luggage and stored it for us while we explored the city. They took my cell number and said they would call when our room was ready. They did call and we were delighted with our room. The hotel is somewhat old looking on the outside but very modern on the inside. The hallways, however, give me the ambivance of something from the twilight zone with the hall light fixtures etc.--like you experienced when you got off the elevator in MGM's Tower of Terror. Spooky, but clean, attractive and otherwise modern. This is a place in Chicago I can recommend and would stay here again. A great value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: dfiel3744
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I thought that the quality of the service made this a good experience. All of the employees are very helpful and made us feel like welecome guests. Yes, the rooms are smaller then we are used to, but the were very clean and you can tell there is pride taken in the condition of the hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Prof_Fwy
Reviews.Content: Okay, it's small. The hallways are narrow. The rooms are small. The bathrooms are small. The elevators are small. But the location? A half-block from Michigan Avenue and the John Hancock Center - -in other words, exactly where you want to be. The rooms are nicely appointed, very well-maintained, and quiet. The staff are excellent. We asked for some clothes to be pressed overnight, and they were ready and perfect by breakfast -- no bones about it. The ground floor staff are ready with directions, recommendations, and a handy taxi if you decide to cab it instead of taking the very convenient bus or El. The only thing to complain about is the size of the spaces. If you're a "big" person -- in either width or height or both -- you might seriously do better somewhere else. But otherwise? I'm looking for another excuse to go to Chicago just to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “So-So Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smashlygirl21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Whitehall from Friday 5/16 to Sunday 5/18 for our first anniversary. I picked this hotel based on its location. It is in a GREAT location! One block from the Hancock Observatory, Michigan Ave. (Magnificent Mile) and tons of great shops and restaurants. Also easy walking to the lake, Navy Pier, and other attractions. Luckily, we spent most of our time sightseeing, because the hotel room was not the greatest. It was definitely very small and old, but that's really all we have to complain about, and we didn't really mind since we were really only there to sleep. I also used the fitness center; its nothing fancy but it has 2 treadmills and a stairclimber and some weights. We walked for miles every day so if you plan to do that you won't even really need to use the fitness center! If you are planning to spend a lot of time in the hotel then you should choose a more luxurious, newer place. Check-in was very slow, and the front desk people were not very helpful, but Renata the concierge was extremely helpful! She suggested a great jazz place (Underground Wonder Bar, a few blocks away ) and got us a same-day reservation for a fantastic steakhouse (Erie Cafe.) Overall, we had a great experience in Chicago but the hotel was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: sgalla
Reviews.Content: I went with 3 moms and our daughters for a mother/daughter weekend. It was a great experience. When we arrived in our rooms, there was a bottle of wine, chocolate covered strawberries and other fruit with a note from the management thanking us for staying there. We only paid $164.00 a night also. We stayed on the 17th floor and both rooms had nice views. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were very nice and updated. The whole room was beautiful. The staff was very helpful. We were going to be gone at the play "Wicked" when we could get our boarding passes for the next day and the concierge volunteered to take our information home and print our passes for us. He did exactly what he said he would. He was also very helpful making dining reservations and making suggestions. The bar was very nice and the moms enjoyed going down for a glass of wine after a long day of sight seeing. Maybe some of the lower rooms were not as nice as ours but we loved everything about this place. We will stay here again. I would gladly recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and you can get a great Deal for this Magnificent Mile Four Star”
Reviews.Author: davsteward
Reviews.Content: Great great location across the street from the Four Seasons and ultra luxe 900 Michigan Avenue, a block from Water Tower Place and the rest of the great shopping on North Michigan Ave. Hotel is traditional with a modest scaled rooms. The one I had was not large (typical of most city hotels) but nicely done and seemed to have been refurbished recently. Lobby is very small and often gets backed up when a group is checking in. THis can make getting to the elevator difficult. The overall level of service is OK, but not great. Also there were several large tour groups of European Doctors. I got a fantastic deal on Hotwire and would recommend this hotel at the price I paid ($180) but would not pay more than $250 or as there are better options at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: msu311girl
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded when we got there so our room was awesome, even though it had a terrible view. The bed was very comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. The location is very close to Michigan Ave. and everything else we wanted to be near. We got our room pretty cheap and I was more than impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with ghostly 1920s aura”
Reviews.Author: paularea
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. It is so 1920s it is almost spooky. Fabulous character, wonderful staff and top nosh inexpensive food which I would pay a fortune for at home. Right next to Michigan Ave so all the tourist sights were in easy reach. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find”
Reviews.Author: JoDfromEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in September 07 with my husband, it was a quick city break with friends who joined us from Cincinnati. We booked the hotel on Hotels R Us and got a great deal for the short stay we were there. The hotel is located on a quiet side street and has a central location for the beach and all the shops just off the Mag Mile. The staff were extremely friendly and we had a great stay. The rooms although compact had everything we needed and were very nicely decorated. The bed was really comfy and had nice bed linens. I liked the touch of the free tea and coffee which was available each morning in the lobby, you could fill up as much as you wanted. Our friends came to visit one morning, they were staying in the Marriott Downtown and paid double the amount we paid and were every impressed with the hotel for value for money. We asked at reception if they could join us for coffee and they said to help themselves. with no charge which was really nice touch. | really enjoyed my stay here and would recommend the hotel to those who enjoy small stylish hotels with helpful staff , without having to pay top dollar to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Don't accept a sub par room!”
Reviews.Author: MelvinaSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: We went for a romantic weekend getaway post holidays, and chose Whitehall as we had been pleased with them in the past, and the location and price/value can't be beat... at least in our previous visits (4 plus times in the last 10 years). This visit, we had an unbelievable rate of approx $135 per night for a regular room. Well, as this was probably the cheapest rate ever, we were given the worst room. Unbelievable that they would even show a room like this to anyone, especially when the hotel was no where near capacity. Rm. 603 if you are interested. First, of course there is no view, we were expecting that for such little money. But then... we noticed an actual hole in the wall next to the radiator, and it went all the way to the outside... in Chicago, in Winter. The room was freezing! Was management aware of this? Well, there was a fur throw on the bed (and not one in the next room we transferred to). Because the room was walled in by larger buildings on all sides, it was dark dark dark. Now I realize if you get a bargain rate, you get a bargain rate room, but this was truly unacceptable. So we called downstairs to be moved to another room. They did not offer another room at the same price, but we could upgrade to Pinnacle level for $50 more per night. So we did. The room was actually the same size, actually the same room, on the 16th floor, with no hole and a great view. Unfortunately we learned early the next morning it was also right next to the maid cart closet... BANG BANG BANG! And if the first room is typical of all "regular" rooms, then only the "pinnacle" rooms are acceptable, in my opinion. I believe all the times previously we paid for the "pinnacle" rooms as well. Also, although the pinnacle level rooms are all the same price (except for the suites) I think many are larger and have bigger, four poster beds. On other Whitehall visits, our rooms were larger and nicer. This was by far the smallest room we had ever stayed in. So to get the best for your money, ask for a larger pinnacle room with four poster bed, away from the elevators, away from the maid closet and with a good view. My feeling is that Whitehall needs to be both price competitive (which it is) but also needs that special something (service... feeling that a guest is welcome and appreciated) that makes up for some of the inconveniences (small rooms, outdated bathrooms, tiny elevators, aging wallpaper and carpets, having to call down for ice) which can either be viewed as charming or a pain, depending on how you as a guest are treated. This time... eh...no magic. Stay here again? Not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiChic
Reviews.Content: It was the fist time my husband and I traveled to Chicago and the location of this small 'boutique' hotel was the best part of all. It's less than half a block from Michigan Ave and a 2 minute walk away from Rush St (lots of bars, restaurants and clubs on Rush). You could walk practically everywhere; we walked all the way to Navy Pier one day. There are plenty of cabs around the area in case you prefer that too. I would not consider The Whitehall as "one of the eight great small hotels of the U.S" but the service from the staff was very good! The concierge was very knowledgeable and professional. The lobby had a unpleasant smell :( but at least it did not carry anywhere else. There are only 2 tiny elevators but that's ok for the size of hotel. We had a standard room on the 17th floor, facing Delaware St. with nearby buildings as our view. The room was quite small with very little room to store your belongings (we had a lot of winter gear!). It was evident that the bathroom had been remodeled and it was very nice (with the exception that our tub would get clogged quickly!) The bedding was comfortable/clean and the AC unit worked perfectly fine. They should remodel the rooms with newer furniture though. The overall experience of the hotel was very good and we would stay there again because it's in the center of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: lindainmadison
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business - i've been around the world and was unimpressed. The price i paid was a corporate rate and still felt it was too much for the quality of of the stay. While i realize I am paying for location - off the Magnificent Mile - the hotel was just - blah.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but.........”
Reviews.Author: contessajulia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. Personal service is first class. It is quiet and central, yet sophisticated. Great staff, food and rooms. decor is restrained and a lot of wood panelling... sombre and serious , good for a quiet drink. The restaurant is attached to hotel and food /service is excellent. The only problem I had was I do not use credit cards, I pay cash. For some reason this hotel does not appreciate this commendable approach and insists on you keeping a credit balance in their favour. I have never experienced this approach in Europe. Usually the norm is to settle your account on departure. Yes, they have all your details including passport. I found this particularly irritating as I had to constantly provide deposits of dollars to satisfy the hotel desk. You wonder why this is annoying? You will find that a red light on two telephones will constantly flash when your credit has been exceeded..... if you wake early this will prevent you getting back to sleep also you feel the hotel do not trust you. This detracts from the hotels otherwise high standards. Cop on ! Why have guests if you do not trust them! I booked the holiday with my credit card Laser/Maestro, but the Whitehall does not recognise it when you are a guest. How odd is that ! Well we are not American. Get over it. great hotel otherwise. Advice ... get with the program! it's a cultural shift. P.S I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous Experience”
Reviews.Author: doughboy914
Reviews.Content: Let me begin with the good: great location and reasonably priced as compared to nearby hotels. That's it. Now to the bad: We were in Room 611 that overlooked an alley in which dumpsters from every nearby building were seemingly located. While the view was less than ideal, our issue concerned noise. On Friday morning at 6:17 a.m. (our first morning in the hotel and more than four hours before we planned on getting up) we were awoken by the incredibly loud sounds of garbage trucks backing into the alley (beeping every second or so), picking up dumpsters, and then dropping them onto the ground. If this only happened once it would still have been annoying, but might also have been a reality of staying downtown. Unfortunately, it did not happen only once. It happened repeatedly from 6:17 a.m. until around 9 a.m. (after MANY separate dumpster loads were picked up and DROPPED). Having our sleep ruined by dumpsters, we then had the rest of the morning ruined by constant whistles from bellmen hailing taxis (that lasted until at least 11 a.m.). We complained to the hotel staff who told us that there were no rooms available to move us until later that day, so we went about our business of trying to enjoy our long weekend in Chicago. When we returned to the hotel in late-afternoon, we were told that the hotel only had one room available on the 5th floor of the hotel - albeit not right over dumpster alley, but still pretty low. We asked whether dumpsters would be picked up in dumpster alley on Saturday morning (it being a weekend) and were told by the front desk person that the hotel's were not picked up on Saturday and that she did not "think" but (in fairness) could not be certain that other dumpsters would not be picked up the next morning. Having places to go and not wishing to re-pack and move to another low floor, we risked it one more night. BIG mistake. The next morning - at precisely 6:42 a.m. - we were greeted with the relentless sounds of dumpsters being picked up and dropped. Having a second morning completely ruined by the sound of crashing dumpsters, we again complained, and this time we did decide to re-pack and move to a much higher floor - further away from the dumpsters. It is scarcely believable that the Whitehall would not: a) warn their guests whose rooms overlook the alley; b) contact the waste management companies to adjust their pick up schedules; and c) work on soundproofing the "dumpster alley" rooms. Almost as bad as was the noise was the reaction of the hotel staff to our complaints. While they did ultimately change our room, most quality hotels would have comped both nights, but not the Whitehall - which ironically describes itself as a "landmark destination," "one of the eight great small hotels in the U.S.," and a hotel that "will exceed all of [our] expectations." Indeed, we didn't even get a fruit basket. From this experience at the Whitehall, if you are planning on staying at the Whitehall you should definitely inquire whether your room faces the alley. If it does, you cannot and should not stay at this hotel unless you are planning on getting up at 6:15 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: wineglobelovers
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Whitehall many times and this is a great hotel - rooms are always well-appointed and the location in between Rush Street and Michigan Avenue can't be beat. The sausage-grape pizza in the restaurant is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “good enough”
Reviews.Author: Tsekham
Reviews.Content: Not bad at all. Good location. Concierge very helpful and knowledgable. Not as expensive as many downtown hotels and the rooms are fine with all most people would need presuming you aren't coming to Chicago just to stay in your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but elegant hotel. The little hotel that could.”
Reviews.Author: TravelFairyQueen
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here I was very worried about staying here. When I arrived my fears were unfounded. Our stay was very nice. This is an old hotel that at one time was very traditional, classy and elegant. As I looked around the common areas Iâ€™m sure it used to be very lovely. In many ways it still is. Many posters have described this hotel as â€˜tiredâ€™. It is very tired looking, but is still somewhat elegant. Every place in this hotel is dark, or as someone else described it as â€˜soft lightingâ€™ and maybe for good reason, to hide its age. The staff at the Whitehall were all very professional and helpful. We called ahead and asked for a King pinnacle room. It was ready for us when we arrived later in the day. There are two tiny elevators for twenty floors. The elevators have recently had a facelift. The 17th floor appears to have had a facelift as well. We had room 1712 which is a corner room away from any other noise. The king pinnacle room was very tiny, but it was clean, the furniture all looked somewhat new, the newer bedding was very luxurious. The TV and the cabinet that held it were the only things that looked worn. The view out our window was of another building. This was ok. I wasnâ€™t there to sit in my room and look out the window. Our teeny room was nicely appointed, clean, odor free, and the bed linens were new and comfortable. There is a down type comforter also there was a feather bed over the mattress, which I found odd at first, but then I got used to it and it felt somewhat cozy. The pillows on the bed were feather pillows. I slept very well, kind of like sleeping on a cloud. Our room had a pricey mini bar and an in room safe. The closet was quite large with very nice wood hangers and satin hangers. Their was an iron and ironing board. The bathroom was clean with a blow dryer, magnifying makeup mirror, bath sheet size towels. The maid was very generous with refilling our shampoos and soaps. Our room was always cleaned early and the turn down service is a nice touch. The air conditioning/heating is noisy but in a good way. It acted as â€˜white noiseâ€™ for us at night. So we never heard anything else. There is a thermostat on the wall to regulate the temperature. One morning we ordered a continental breakfast and it was $25.00 for one person! Not worth the money, but works from a convenience standpoint. The parking is very pricy at approximately $44.00 a day. This price is inline with other Chicago Hotels. You do have in and out privileges. One night we ate at Fornetto Mei restaurant right next door. The menu confusing being Italian and oriental, but the food was good. The prices were average. It is a cozy, intimate, gold coast restaurant & pizza bar. Just the thing for relaxing in a casual yet elegant venue. I really liked it. The location of this hotel is fabulous. I love the neighborhood, very quiet but right off Michigan Avenue and close to everything. I would stay here again, if I got a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Tiny Rooms - NOT A 4-5 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: theisedj
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me just say that the location of the hotel is great, especially if you want to shop on Michigan Avenue/Rush Street. When I arrived to check-in at 5pm on a Friday afternoon, I asked the front desk personnel if it would be possible to get two double beds, or even a King (since I was travelling with a friend.) She looked at my reservation, then looked down her nose at me and said with snotty disdain "Ooh, I see you booked your stay through a third party website. I am sorry, all the kings and double rooms are "committed" for this evening." (She implied that kings/doubles are only available if you book directly with the hotel. Otherwise, you're stuck with a random room that nobody else wants.) When she said that, I found it rather odd that (1) every other king/doubles room was fully occupied at that point in the day, and (2) that every other guest had already checked in for the night, and there was only 1 room left in the entire hotel for me. If the king rooms were already "committed" to some other guest, why did I not have the ability to have them reserve one for ME??? Very suspect, and very strange. As I was waiting for the elevator, someone else came in, and asked for a king bed. The clerk "Yes, sir, we do have a king available for you." I was livid. But I proceeded to my room, and my room keys did not work. After another trip to the lobby to get proper keys, I promptly entered the room to find that it was a very odd-shaped corner room scarely larger than a closet. The foot of the bed (a double bed) was so close to the armoire, I could barely open the cabinet doors. Because of the odd shape, it was hard to find a place to set our luggage without bumping into something else. Furthermore, there was no furniture/drawer space to unpack your luggage if you are planning to stay in the city for more than one night! The furniture was terribly outdated, the table tops on the desk, nightstands, and side table were badly scratched/damaged, the airconditioner ran loudly and sounded like a washing machine in mid-cycle, the alarm clock was faulty, and kept "crackling" audibly all night, the TV cable channels sucked (a majority of the channels were either sports or news) and the walls of the room were paper thin. We could hear every conversation in the next room. The front desk staff didn't seem knowledgeable about the area. When asked where the nearest pharmacy was, she mentioned the Walgreens on Michigan (4 blocks away.) However, there was a Walgreens only about 1.5 blocks away over on Rush. The best was when I left early one morning, the door man was standing there picking his nose, then reached out to grab the door to open it for me. I made sure not to touch that door from that point on. The Whitehall should treat all customers the same...and not give preferential treatment to customers who book their room directly with the hotel vs. a third-party website. If I had to recommend this hotel, I am not convinced I would. It needs major updating, and the staff needs to be schooled on the art of etiquette.

Reviews.Title: “The odd niggle here and there but otherwise a Great Value Choice”
Reviews.Author: Art4All
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall is clearly loved by many but equally hated by others. Hopefully this review gives a more balance impression. If your looking for a 4-5* international chain hotel with modern bland features, an excessively grand lobby, vast corridors that stretch for miles and miles, and rooms and bathrooms so large that you could get lost in them, then the Whitehall is not for you. If on the other hand you're looking for a more than perfectly acceptable hotel in a superbly central location (just yards from the Hancock Tower), in a quiet location with friendly staff, then the Whitehall will suit you fine. If your budget can stretch to $600-700 and more per night then the nearby Four Seasons, Westin or numerous others (all with loyalty programs) will meet your every whim. Then again, if you're looking for change from $300-400 per night then go for the Whitehall. Sure the Whitehall lobby's small, and the elevators tiny as are most of the bathrooms, but if this means I save $200 a night then count me in. You simply can't go wrong. I also have a slight problem thinking of the Whitehall as a boutique hotel; after all it has well over 200 rooms - in Europe we think of a boutique hotel with usually no more than a few dozen rooms - but it's just a marketing label! The Whitehall will never set the world alight but I'd have no qualms in returning. It does exactly what it sets out to do.
