If the Whitehall can deliver what it does for the price then either the bigger chains are charging too much for what they offer or maybe we the customer should be looking for an even grander quality of service, delivering better value for money. Either way, the choice is ultimately yours. Hope this is helpful?

Reviews.Title: “A pure slice of HEAVEN! (+ in a great location!)”
Reviews.Author: twigtwig
Reviews.Content: Reserved a king, pinnacle room w/hotels.com for four nights at an average of $209/nt + tax - an absolute deal of the century. Arrived 5-6 hours well before check-in (see my review of Tremont Hotel, which I couldn't wait to leave in the morning...), and was treated like royalty by the Whitehall front desk staff. I told them where I'd come from the night before, what I'd experienced, and that, if possible, I would be willing to pay extra for an early check-in if something was available. They asked me to take a seat in the lobby, so I did, and within (seriously) 5 minutes, the front desk manager walked out to where I was sitting, and presented me with my room key, informed me that there would be no extra charge, and a "I know you'll enjoy your stay w/us" - WOW!! The room was a king, pinnacle - sumptuous, softly-lit, spacious, CLEAN, cool and totally relaxing. Ahhhhhhh. In my 41 years on this planet, I have never slept in a more comfortable bed!!! What appeared to be 500+ thread-count sheets and duvet (far beyond my expectations!), feather bed under sheets (dreamy), and a cloud of delicious, fluffy, warm goodness (read: down comforter) on top. Did I mention the fab pillows?? More of the same - and there were six of those! The closet was spacious, well-lit, and loaded with hangers. The bathroom was absolutely perfect w/varied lighting, 1600+ watt hairdryer, FLUFFY bath sheets (not just standard-sz towels), and great marble and tile work. Hardly worth mentioning, but the only negative I can come up with (& I hate to go there, but...) is that I have very thick hair and the shower water pressure was very poor - never was able to get all the shamp/cond out of my hair without using the faucet below in the shower on my hands and knees. The staff - oh, the staff! WOW! From bellhop, to housekeeper, to concierge - it just kept getting better and better!!! Clearly, the management is doing something right in their hiring and treatment of their employees. They all go the extra mile (how I would treat someone in my home) without being prompted. VERY impressive! These folks are happy, and it shows and shines!! The location, literally, cannot be beat. It's WAAAAAAAAAY better than their modest and humble hotel description. You will not be disappointed in this hotel. I can hardly wait to tell everyone about it - I think I just did!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, better than some reviews suggested”
Reviews.Author: jfhCroydon-UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week in September 2007. After reading the reviews on TripAdviser I asked for a room facing the street and we were given one just opposite the lifts, but this caused no problems except for someone talking loudly outside the lifts one morning. The room was furnished with dark furniture but we expected this from other reviews, the bed was really comfortable, and the bathroom, although small was perfectly adequate for its purpose. The bar prices were reasonable, the only complaint was that we were not informed about the free coffee in the mornings, which we only found on the last day. I had booked at a reduced rate with LastMinute.Com. and after booking was facing the stay with some trepidation after reading reviews on other sites warning against doing this, but our fears were unfounded it was good value for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: holamexico
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Whitehall on Saturday Sept 1. We were in town for a Cub game and due to me waiting to make reservations - we had to stay at 2 hotels over the weekend. I booked this hotel thru otel.com. I had never used them before - but it worked out well. The location of the hotel is wonderful. We were just a couple of blocks from our favorite bar (PIppin's Tavern). We took Amtrak in and did not arrive until about 9pm. We were on the 13th floor. The elevator was quite slow. It is an older hotel but we enjoyed our stay. I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “bad experience: hotel promised to hold room but didn't”
Reviews.Author: Vincent_HD
Reviews.Content: I had a 2 night, prepaid reservation at the Whitehall, and the hotel confirmed by phone that they would hold my room even though I was arriving late. They didn't and didn't make much of an effort to find me a room elsewhere: the best they could come up with, after 30 minutes of trying, was a hotel an hour out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location is about the only good thing here”
Reviews.Author: cwa83
Reviews.Content: Well where do I begin. We ordered two rooms and requested that they be side by side and with each bedroom containing 2 seperate beds. There was 4 of us and we all wanted our own bed. However, we showed up at the hotel and they not only seperated us but they had us on seperate floors. However, asked if they could switch us around but they said they could not. Therefore, we decided to check out the rooms and to deal with it. However, upon entering our rooms we immediatly saw that there was one double bed. Again, we requested two beds in the room. We were extremely upset by this and contacted the manager. He admitted there were empty rooms in the hotel but it was against their policy to move or upgrade rooms for free. He said if we wanted two double beds in each room we would have to pay the cancelation fee and the room upgrade fee. I will have to say the staff is very nice but their policy is bogus. I work in customer service and have been taught to accomodate the customer in any way possible. This means going above and beyond. However, this hotel decided not to. And our last complaint was the air conditioning. The room upstairs did not work at all. The room was very unfortable. The room downstairs did have working AC. Having said all of this, the hotel is in a great location right next to the Hancock tower. The beach is 5 minute walk, Michigan Ave is 3 min, and the pier is a 15 minutes walk. The cleaning ladies were great. Everyday the room was cleaned! I hope this is an isolated incident because as you can see, there are some great things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chariming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slow8steady
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall Hotel, a national landmark hotel in Chicago, is a charming hotel in an excellent location in downtown. Because it is old and has character, there were a few minor inconveniences. The two biggest ones for us were no ice machines(you have to call or ask someone in the hotel to get ice for you which means a tip) and trouble getting into our room with an electronic card. We had to slide the card at least half a dozen times to get our door open. But these annoying little things were more than made up for by the friendliness of the staff, the great beds and bathrooms, and the concierge service. Did I mention the location? The Whitehall is less than a block off the northern end of the "Magnificent Mile", near the El Red Line and major bus stops, and within walking distance of many of Chicago's major attractions. We were near several good restaurants and felt safe at all times. There were only 2 of us, but many families with 4 to 5 members were in the hotel. A lot of business men and women were in the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: wdog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home after a 3 night stay. We loved it! The bed was luxurious and the service was wonderful. Our room was tastefully decorated and had none of the problems other people have mentioned. I did call before and request a renovated/non smoking room and perhaps that is what made the difference. Would go back in a second -- lovely hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Why the Whitehall???”
Reviews.Author: parcvue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Whitehall on a recent business trip to Chicago. This hotel has alot going for it...the intimate scale, great location, and really nice staff make the ideal combination. What did not work for me was the airconditioning in my room and the strange menu in the restaurant. I know that the restaurants are often leased to other operators, but hotels that lease their restaurants need to understand that the restauran is a direct reflection on the guest experience and the hotels brand reputation. Please fix the airconditioning and the restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Overall not bad, but a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: spartantraveler4112
Reviews.Content: First I'll say that for the most part this was an alright hotel with a Great location right by the Mag mile. It seemed a little "old", but, IT IS! (1928) I made reservations a little more than a month beforehand and requested a " nice street view ." We arrived around 2:45 from Michigan to see the Tigers-White Sox game(7/25), room was ready(?). Went to tenth floor, cards didn't work, went back down and up again, we had a corner room(small, just enough room to walk around the king bed(nice bed though)) and a view of some bricks from the building next door. Really!?? A month's advance with a request and we still got a "brick view. " That was Very disappointing, but at that point I didn't feel like going back down and switching rooms. I normally would have but with the time constraint I didn't want to waste more. Also, we chose to self-park(which you pay for separate in the garage and was recommended cheaper than valet by the doorman(?)) and it actually came out to $44 for 24hrs and 32mins(maybe that extra 32 killed us more than we thought, huh?) Wonder what valet would've been. I just wish I had more time to devote to making sure I was satisfied and content with my stay/purchase. You may need a few extra minutes if you don't like a brick view and a bed for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Whitehall”
Reviews.Author: CleveTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Whitehall for 3 nights. The first night we stayed in a King "superior" room. We noticed the air conditioner was VERY noisy that night but just assumed that was how it was going to be. The next afternoon when we went back to our room to rest and shower before going out for dinner, we were surprised to find our room was 90 degrees and as humid as a sauna -- there was also a gaping hole where the air conditioner had been with only a flimsy grate keeping it from being wide open to the outside 11 stories up! The furniture was all pushed up against the walls. We went down to the lobby to talk to the customer service people who checked and said they were "fixing" the air conditioning -- they said that and then tried to ignore us. We informed them that we needed to rest and get cleaned up and that the room was unusable and dangerous. They again said they were working on it == and then tried to ignore us again. We again told them we coud not use the room and asked how long it was going to be == they said they were working on it but didn't know how long it would be. After we refused to just go away, one of the reps finally said he would find us another room. We were put into a King suite which was a much better room than our previous one and we thanked the rep; however, neither room was really that of a 4 (or 5) star hotel: wallpaper bubbling off the walls, uncomfortable beds (the beds were more than firm -- they were hard but then covered with a feather bed), problems with electrical outlets in the bathrooms of both rooms (in the suite the outlet was actually loose and sparked -- we could not plug anything into it), etc. We were also dismayed to find charges to our bill for things we did not use: wireless internet and minibar. When we told a rep that we did not use these things, she questioned us about them and then nastily crumpled the bill in our face and said they were off our bill. We will not stay in the Whitehall again.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best bed ever”
Reviews.Author: TA_Scott
Reviews.Content: Great value! Room was basic but nice, clean and big. Service was great. Staff were very helpful. Our internet connection was not working so they gave us a pass for free wireless access. Concierge seemed to be very helpful as well. The highlight was probably the beds. Best bed/pillows I've ever slept on. As 5-star hotels go the Whitehall is probably not up there with the Four Seasons...but neither was the price. Definitely a better value for the money than other options in Chicago (we would have paid more to stay at a Best Western).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Room”
Reviews.Author: McFred
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall Hotel is in a fantastic location, on a quiet street right between Rush St. & Michigan Avenue. You're right in the middle of all the action, but since Delaware is a smaller side street, the rooms are very quiet. Our room was small, but had almost everything we needed. The bathroom was large and lovely. Our only complaint was the view from our window--a cement wall. It is strange that they have no ice machines, the first night we requested ice to be brought from room service and it never arrived. The second night we just went down and asked the front desk for it which proved much more efficent. Bed and linens were very comfortable. The desk and easy chair were great additions to the room. The Whitehall was a great experience for us!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience at Whitehall”
Reviews.Author: pjl52
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights. May 15-18, 2007 Room was very nice. Location, great. I did not have the unpleasant experience described by others. The only thing I can add is that before the trip I called the reservation desk and asked for a renovated non smoking room. --which I did get. I reserved via easyclick.com web site and paid 443 with tax for thee nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: London_Austin
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel last week and had a good experience. Great location, just off Michigan Ave, friendly staff and clean room. At the lower end of a four star hotel but that is reflected in the cost which is very reasonable. Smallish but comfortable room, small but well-equipped clean bathroom with complimentary toiletries. Free newspaper delivered to room every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid The WhiteHall”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTrish
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredibly rude. Some of the hotel patrons were waiting on a bus and their children were pushing each other all over the sidewalk. The children tripped my mother-in-law and she fell and cut her knee. It was bad enough the children and parents did nothing to help but the doorman offered no help either. A passing paramedic stopped to help. We took here inside so I could get some towels and water and not one of the staff offered help as they watched me clean and bandage her knee. Later when we mentioned the incident to the doorman, he said nothing and then snickered to the bellhop as we left.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: JakeAdams72
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall Hotel is Chicago's "only truly independent boutique hotel." What that means for most travelers is irrelevant. And it should be. When one stays at a hotel, three basic criteria should be met: 1) the room is clean 2) the room is quiet and safe 3) everything in the room should be in working order. The Whitehall is clean. But the service is lacking in many ways. The noise from hallway activity and other room doors closing is easily audible in the hotel room. Nothing seemed to be in working order. But, things were promptly fixed. I stayed at the Whitehall four nights and just checked out. I am now across the street at the Four Seasons, as a colleague allowed me to use the business center at the hotel there. They have complimentary computer access. The Whitehall does not. The Four Seasons also has nice little amenities, like complimentary drinks in the lobby, bottled water at the front door, and stuff that makes you truly feel welcome. The staff is friendly and helpful. At the Whitehall, there are no in-room coffee makers but coffee service from 7-10am. There are no ice makers but room service will gladly bring you a full bucket of ice. The staff is friendly, but at some points in my stay of little use. One person in my party who got a room on the ninth floor moved to a room on the 8th floor because the heater/cooler/air vent box had a pinging noise that wouldn't stop. Also, the bathroom smelled like a nursing home. Even the bell captain who came in to assist in her room move put his fingers up to his nose. My room was fine. The furniture is a little worn, but perhaps that is what "boutique hotel" is all about. My clock radio was broken, so that when you went to set the alarm the time kept winding backward. I called the front desk, and a Spanish-speaking housekeeper promply came up to my room and replaced the radio with a new model. She also volunteered to set the clock and the alarm, but she could not understand the Engish directions so I stepped in (I am bilingual). Later, I learned that my phone in the bathroom did not work properly, the cordless desk phone was inoperable, the knob for the bathroom vent was broken and that the colour settings of my television were off and there was no way to fix them. I told the front desk about all of this on Friday at about 10:30am, when a package that had been sent overnight via FedEx from Miami on Thursday morning should have arrived. It was urgent, as my convention sessions were rapidly coming to a midday end, and I needed it. Fast. I waited about 20 minutes for Heather at the front desk to track down the person that takes care of packages that are sent to guests. After 20 minutes, I was told no package was there. Frustrated, I ran back to the Drake, where I was certain things like this didn't happen. But the Drake wanted me to spend about $269 a night plus tax for a room. The Whitehall, with tax, was $160 a night. For that price, this hotel - even with the little things that mean a lot to those that travel extensively noticeably absent - is a true value. It's in the heart of the Gold Coast, literally steps away from the John Hancock Tower and the Magnificent Mile. For the price, you won't be beat. If it's first-class service you are looking for, go elsewhere. Just be sure your electricity is in proper working order. At about 10pm last night the woman in room 1110 came back to find that none of the lights would turn on in her room. Nice, huh? On a post-script, upon checkout an hour ago I was asked if I received the FedEx package that arrived on Friday. I was astonished. NO!!! It seems it came in at about 1pm - just as my convention was ending. The front-desk receptionist said a text message was left on my hotel room phone. OK - this makes no sense. How many hotel room phones have text messaging capabilities? And, if so, shouldn't there be a blinking message-waiting light on the phones - or at least one of the three phones in my room? I don't know when I will be back in Chicago again, but another colleague spent about $40 more to stay at the Hilton Suites. I can at least get HiltonHonors points there and the assurance that I will certainly get what I pay for and that "little something extra" that does not exist at the Whitehall.

Reviews.Title: “Whitehall is ok...but I wouldnt come back”
Reviews.Author: LittleCutie
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. Just 2 mininutes walk from Magnificient Mile for those who love shopping...and few blocks from downtown Chicago. The hotel room itself is ok, nothing special. We got a room right across from an evalator so it was quite noisy in the early morning. The hotel used to be a luxury apartment so the wall between rooms is a bit thin. I could hear water pouring when the neighbour taking shower in the morning. The air conditioning was not working properly the second night so we got trouble sleeping. The staffs here are nice and helpful. I was actually about to book Hotel Club Monoco for this trip. I got a discount rate for Whitehall so I went with it. However, I should have gone with Hotel Monaco since I have read a lot of good feedback about it...No matter what, I had a great time in Chicago. Love the city....Definitely come back again and stay longer...:)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Fussytraveler-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Whitehall this past weekend, and felt at home in this European-style boutique hotel. One of the highlights for us was that, from the moment we entered until we departed, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful! I tend to be somewhat fussy about rooms, and like to view several rooms before selecting the one I want. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. Although the views are not amazing, one has to consider the location - which is west of Michigan Blvd. Our room overlooked part of Michigan Avenue, including the Water Tower Place and the John Hancock Building - pretty nice! I saw two kinds of rooms. One was a bit standard. But, the one we chose to stay in had a wonderful four poster bed, was a nice size and had a very pretty (albeit small) bathroom. Also, there was a plate of chocolates on the marble table which greeted us when we entered. It was the first time we ever slept in a feather bed - very luxurious! And the sheets were very soft. Connected to the hotel is an Italian/Asian restaurant. We enjoyed our lunch there - it had a European ambience. The restaurant has a bar and really comfy adjoining lounge, with lots of sofas and chairs where the staff serves drinks and light fare. But, I think that smoking is permitted in the lounge. A couple of downsides - 1. instead of having ice machines on the floors, the hotel instructs guests to contact room service for ice. It took quite a while for the ice to arrive. 2. The hotel is old.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Bertomom
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Whitehall could not be better. When I phoned to inquire about operable windows, the reservations agent took the time to find someone who could unequivocally confirm that I would be able to open my window. The room was immaculate and the furnishings were very tasteful. Everything worked properly. The bar looks charming, though I did not have time to check it out. The overall location is excellent, just steps from North Michigan Avenue on a relatively quiet street. Only one downside, and this isn't a deal-killer: the corridors look a bit weary--the paint needs touching up.

Reviews.Title: “Ok.. Expected more”
Reviews.Author: vmedinacce
Reviews.Content: We booked our travel last minute (the night before). We read a couple of reviews on this hotel and figured we'd give it a try. My fiance and I were packing all night and landed in Chicago and found out our luggage was still in Atlanta. We decided to not let it ruin our vacation and went to check into the hotel. Needless to say we were exhausted. At twelve noon they said they were still cleaning our room that check in was not until three. We decided to go have lunch (dressed in our Miami clothes with a sweater on top). Front desk told us they would be able to check us in when we returned from lunch. We arrived back at the hotel at 145 and our room was still not ready. We told the women and the gentleman in front desk that we were exhausted and would be sitting on the couch in the lobby waiting for them to call us. "No problem I will let you know as soon as your room is available. We know you have been travelling all day." I logged on to my laptop as my fiance fell asleep on the couch. At 330 I realized time had flown by and I returned to front desk. I asked it our room was available yet and the response was "Oh yes ma'am it's been available for sometime now." I was shocked. How could you not see us there waiting and my fiance sleeping from packing all night? I found that front desk was not very helpfull our whole trip. I do have to say that the concierge was great and so were the door men. The room was standard, but the bathroom needed some major mold cleaning. Also, the water coming out of the shower was either zero below or 1000 degrees. There was no happy medium. I don't think I will ever return to this hotel again because there were many other hotels in the same region that had more or less the same price and I'm sure would provide us with better customer service. BTW our luggage arrived in the hotel at 7pm.

Reviews.Title: “VERY disappointing...substandard.”
Reviews.Author: XYZPDQ
Reviews.Content: I live in the Chicago area & had a very good friend visiting from CA for a weekend, so we decided to stay downtown for a few nights & enjoy the city. We wanted to stay near MI Ave. shopping, but to save $ for shopping, spas & dining, so decided to stay at the Whitehall instead of 4 Seasons, Peninsula, Ritz, etc. Based on our experience, I would absolutely NOT recommend staying at the Whitehall for the following reasons: 1. We were promised a non-smoking room with 2 beds. When we were shown to our room, it absolutely reeked of smoke the minute you opened the door and we immediately asked to move. 2.The only room available had one bed, which was not preferable, but we were willing to deal with that. However, once we started getting settled, it was apparent that the bed had NOT been changed from the previous guest, nor had the room been cleaned. There was even still personal food items in the minibar. YUCK! There were no other rooms available at that time, so they did send up a crew at that time to clean it (who were very pleasant & apologetic....though see below about makeup bag!). We were in a rush to get to dinner, so left them there cleaning, and the room was fine when we got back. 3. The next morning, I realized that I could not find my makeup bag, filled with at least $250 worth of expensive cosmetics), which I had left out when getting settled. I thought that perhaps I had left it at home, but when I got home, it was not there. When I called to see if it had been found, my call was never returned. My only conclusion is that the crew who cleaned the room as were were leaving to go to dinner took it. 4. They ran out hot water in the showers after about 5 minutes & this was one of the coldest weekends of the year...5-10 degrees out! Brrr....thank God we had spa appts. & showered there. 5. When we checked out & reported these problems, the staff was not apologetic, not were they willing (or, according to them, sanctioned) to give us any kind of compensation, in fact, told us the room we were in was NICER than the one we had reserved and/or had a higher rate. WHAT?! We did manage to get the same rate, so we could get out of there. I also overheard several other guests complaining about the cold water, broken faucets, etc. My friend was in a hurry to get to the airport, so we didn't push it any further, but if we hadn't been in a time crunch, I would have spoken to the manager. Instead, I am (finally) speaking to you--the consumer! 6. When I wrote an email about my experience to the hotel management I never received any response. Not surprising, but was the final push in deciding to post this review. My only conclusion is that the Whitehall has gone WAY downhill in recent years, they do not care about customer service, and I would absolutely never stay there again or recommend it to out of town guests. If you are looking for a small hotel in the are when you are planning to visit Chicago, go elsewhere! Calling it a "boutique" or "luxury" hotel is absoultey laughable. I have had better experiences at highway motels!!! Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: stb1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here at least 5 times and it keeps getting better! This is a very nice smallish hotel on Delaware between Michigan Ave and Rush St.. The rooms are very pleasant, although some in the new decor are on the dark side. The bathrooms are attractively tiled, the beds are very comfortable. The staff is pleasant and friendly throughout. Location is perfect - a two minute walk from busy Michigan Ave and across the street from the Four Seasons Hotel. The restauarant went through a change in the last year or so and although the food is very good, the service at breakfast is excruciatingly slow! The wait staff just seems to fall all over each other and not know what to do. There are two small elevators which cause some people to mutter, but I never felt inconvenienced. This hotel is an excellent choice in Chicago and you will not have to mortgage your house to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Smoky and a bit shabby, great location, nice linens”
Reviews.Author: jestans
Reviews.Content: Sadly, this hotel is somewhat overrated. I was expecting a nice, smaller, elegant boutique hotel. Unfortunately, this property smells of cigarette smoke and was somewhat shabby. We checked in on a Thursday evening. We were given a room on the 12th floor that can only be described as one step above flea-bag. The paint was peeling off the walls, the furniture was battered, the carpet was dirty, the bathroom was out of the 60's or 70's and dirty with burned out light bulbs. The entire room reeked of must, mildew, and cigarette smoke. The windows were frozen shut. When we pointed that out to the bellman and asked if he could open them, he shrugged and did nothing. The next morning the smell was so bad that we asked to be moved to a new room. We were then informed that the entire 12th floor was smoking. We had never been asked (either when booking the room or at check-in) if we preferred smoking or non (we are both non-smokers). We were told that our luggage would be moved to a new room while we were out that day. We returned to the hotel that evening and nothing had been moved. We were then given a new room which seemed out of a different hotel - clean and nice with a remodeled bathroom. It was 1000 times better. The linens and beds are very nice. I do agree with previous guests that the hallway carpeting is beyond shabby and stained. Also, the cigarette smoke smell tends to creep up and down the elevator shafts and you can still smell the smoke on non-smoking floors pretty strongly, even in the rooms. Avoid this hotel if you can't stand cigarette smoke. Unfortunately, none of the staff were very helpful. This hotel has a great location and could be a real gem with some effort.

Reviews.Title: “Descending into Shabbiness”
Reviews.Author: JavaB
Reviews.Content: We picked the Whitehall because friends had raved how elegant it was. Unfortunately, that was some years ago and our experience suggests that the Whitehall is descending into shabbiness. Exiting the elevator on our floor, the wallpaper was beginning to peel from the walls and the carpet was deeply stained--downright grungy. Rooms tend to be small in this part of town, but there was no excuse for the dirty bedskirt. It was obvious that some prior guests had stained it with their shoes, there being little leg room if you sit in the chair to try to watch TV. The TV, by the way, was an old Zenith on its last legs, the picture alternating from red to purple. In the bathroom, the ceiling above the shower had numerous dark brown water stains. Rings upon rings of water stains. Disgusting! Forget about taking a bath. The stopper mechanism had been removed and there was no plug or stopper or any kind. Though the Whitehall touted its 24 hour room service on check-in, when we called at 8:30 pm, there was no answer. Though the bed ws comfortable, we left feeling that this hotel was definitely past its prime. We won't be back. There's plenty of competition within a few block radius.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked”
Reviews.Author: Sapper123
Reviews.Content: I don't understand how a hotel plans to make a good impression on its clientele if when you arrive they tell you - "Sorry, we overbooked so we will need to send you to another hotel." May I also say that I booked the room at normal price - $350/night - and this fact still didn't guarantee me a room. Very poor planning by a, supposedly, 4-5 star hotel. Then they think I will simply forget about the problem and come back the next day when they have room available. Sorry guys, you just lost my business forever. Good luck to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: OhioChowhound
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night before the Chicago Marathon. Room was nice, recently updated with a really nice bathroom. It was small, but not too bad. The front desk help seemed to be clueless about the marathon and had no coffee available until 7:00 am (we had to be there at 7:00). They suggested that we could pay for a breakfast buffet just to get coffee. We found a coffee shop down the street. We asked for a late check out and were told it would cost $50. It is a pretty nice hotel, and you can't judge it completely by a marathon weekend, but I probably would stay somewhere different next time. It does have a great location and I have no complaints about the rooms, but the service was pretty unfriendly and unaccommodating.

Reviews.Title: “going downhill fast!”
Reviews.Author: NY Tripster
Reviews.Content: Hotel was looking shabby. Non-smoking room smelled badly of cigarette smoke. When we left early because of the smoke odors, they tried to collect a cancellation fee for early departure. Don't pay it! I didn't and they backed off. Staff was not very helpful and corridor noise was horrendous. This once lovely old property has clearly fallen on hard times

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little oasis in the mist of a bustling Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jill052
Reviews.Content: I booked a room using [---] for my daughter and myself and we stayed 5 days over the Labor Day weekend. We booked a hotel/air package. I called from the airport as we were leaving to check to make sure they were expecting us and talked with a very NEGATIVE lady! I asked if we could have a queen or king if not two double beds and she told me that since we booked through an internet website ( arrogance in her voice) we would be supplied with a double!! She was very short with me. As I was telling her that was fine and we'd make do, she transfered me to the front desk. I told the gentleman, that I'd just called to make sure we had a room and had just inquired about beds and had been informed that there was NO way we could change from a double to a queen, king or two doubles and that was FINE. No problem. I was really not upset about it UNTIL the lady was so rude to me. Anyway, be that as it may, we did have a very postive experience at the Whitehall. Freddie, who greeted us at the front desk is THE PERFECT representative for a hotel!! I apoligized for the misunderstanding and told him a double would be fine to which he agreed that we'd be more comfortable with more space and presented us with a king room! I have to say, his generosity and graciousness, along with the friendliness of the staff is what any hotel should strive for in order to add that extra touch often missing in the larger nonpersonal "super-mega" hotels. We stayed on the 8th floor. Unlike a previous review, we didn't have hardwood floors but carpeting. The bath and bed were spotless! I said before in other reviews that I love the covered comforter and the white bedding. You know you're in a clean bed because it's a little hard to mask spots on white linens. The furniture in the room was a bit worn but tasteful and the hallway carpet needs to be replaced. Having said that, I need to agree with my daughter that I'm glad the hotel took care of the most important things to renovate first, like the bath and beds. I can live with the other. There are no ice machines but the hotel provides ice which is complimentary (when you call room service ). We didn't use this service but I'm sure if used, a small tip would be appropriate. We did take advantage of the free coffee and tea in the lobby each morning. It was brewed perfectly. They offer REAL cream and not creamer which was a nice touch. There are only two elevators but we were there during the Labor Day weekend with an abundance of guests and we only had to wait a couple of times with the elevator being full and it returned to our floor within a few minutes. The location of this hotel is one of it's best selling points. It's a half block from Michigan Avenue and half block from Rush Street. You can walk everywhere from here if you're a walker and if not, there are cabs and transportation right out the door. This little hotel is unique. I hate hotels that are so large, you feel like you're lost on a cruise ship! This hotel isn't for everyone. It's older, therefore historical which is just another reason I love it. It's not lush, but is tasteful with a bit of European charm thrown in. The rooms aren't memorable but the beds are spotless and clean as well as the bathrooms. Our sink had a small back up problem in the mornings when everyone was using the plumbing but it eventually drained after a few minutes. You couldn't ask for a better or friendlier staff. Also, my daugther and I had a man follow us into the hotel and into the elevator and before we figured out what he was doing, he followed us out of the elevator. The moment we stepped out of the elevator, I put it all together and as the doors were closing I told the man on the elevator. He called the security. Also there was a maid on our floor and we told her as she was standing near our door. I had already confronted the man and she did too and told him he needed to leave if he wasn't a guest. The security were there within minutes to deal with this man and talked with us in order to make a report . We should have been more aware of our surroundings and I hadn't realized that he'd been trying to touch my daughter on the elevator! If I'd known, I'd never have gotten off and would have stayed on with the other guests ( a man and his wife) and reported it with them. (safety in numbers) This could have ruined our stay but didn't as it was handled very professionally and quickly and we felt safe and stayed more aware for the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: vingale
Reviews.Content: We loved the Whitehall hotel. The beds were so comfortable I had a difficult time getting my family motivated to get up and explore. The service and staff were excellent. I'd stay there again! If you're looking for historic charm (built in 1928, recently renovated), this is the hotel for you. Our room had hardwood floors and feather beds. And most important, they welcomed my 9-yr-old. The location is perfect for sightseeing Chicago. The Hancock Observatory is practically across the street. Famous restaurants, shopping, etc. are in walking distance Taxi's line the street waiting to take you where you need to go. Or, there is a subway two blocks away. Going to the game at Wrigley field was very easy. NOTE: If you have two or more in your group, I would recommend taking a taxi to and from the airport versus a shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: CupcakeToo
Reviews.Content: Called the hotel before we stayed here and request a room on the higher floors (non smoking only goes to 11th floor). They accomodated. Our room on the 10th floor(1012) had very new surfaces in entire room. Yes, a few stains in the hallway carpet, but this place is Busy, and it was not that bad. Our reservation was posted to them on the Wrong date by "Last Minute Travel", so be sure to print out and take your receipt. We did, and Freddie, at the front desk ,did a great job getting us in, no matter what it said in the computer. For our Entire stay, Freddie was a wealth of help, information and friendly service, as was Everyone at this hotel! Our room had no view, but everything else was perfect, and the bed was Heavenly! Maid service was good, as well. No vending in the hotel, so go to the small uptown grocery stores and quick stops near the hotel for drinks and snacks. They will bring ice to your room and were very prompt ; we tipped 2 dollars-very worth it! Concierge Ron found us an awesome place to eat a special dinner out, and took it upon himself to tell them of our honeymoon at Spiaggia, and we got extra special treatment there too. Location of this hotel is Prime to shopping, sights and eateries, too. (You HAVE to go to Sarah's bakery off of Rush street, about a 2 block walk from the hotel! :) Doormen and bellmen were friendly and helpful at All times, and we agreed we would definitely stay here again, as we encountered NO problems of any kind at the Whitehall; just a great group of people who went out of their way to make our stay a Pleasure, in a very nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Abisar
Reviews.Content: I took my 6 year old daughter to Chicago for a 2 night stay, and I picked the Whitehall using this site and reviews. The location, as mentioned, is PERFECT for shopping (American Girl Place especially)! It is an older hotel, so don't expect modern, and I didn't. We were both greeted warmly and welcomingly EACH time we entered the doors. The doorman opened the doors for us EACH time, and said, "welcome back." I liked that touch, and my daughter felt like a princess. The price can't be beat for the location. I do agree that the ceiling in my bathroom was a little worn down, but I just didn't look up :) I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: sarahevan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Chicago for 2 nights mainly just for siteseeing & a relaxing weekend. I am a student and am on a tight budget so I was looking for a hotel that was cheap but in the metro area. If you've been in my position before you know its a hard thing to find. But the Whitehall Hotel does offer a PRIME location for it's price. In the heart of the Magnificant Mile, its walking distance to all the great stores, water tower, Hancock Building and even The Loop. The staff is very friendly and ready to help. The room I god was a bit small, but it was only for me so I didn't mind. If you have a bigger group I wouldnt recommend it. The bed, however, was INCREDIBLE soft and comfortable. Loved it! The view wasn't spectacular but I wasnt staying there for the view anyhow. I think my only complaint would be that I was charged a $50 fee to use their internet jsut to "verify" my credit card even though I was already being $10 per 24 hour period to use it. When I questioned the front desk about this they said it was only verification and wouldnt come out of my checking account, however, it did and I had to contact their accounting office several times to get it resolved. Other then that it was a fantastic stay

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This place is Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Whitehall Hotel for July 1st -- just a one night stay in Chicago -- to go watch my daughter and her boyfriend skydive at the nearby Chicagoland Skydiving Club. Because I got a FABULOUS price ($128) via LastMinuteTravel[--], I figured we'd get an interior room on a lower floor. However, we could not have been MORE PLEASED!!!! We got a corner room on the very top floor overlooking Lake Michigan. It had a huge bay window with a window seat on one side of the room and a smaller window facing the lake and Michigan Avenue on the other side. The beds were just like the "Heavenly Beds" at the Westin. They had feather beds on top of the mattresses with down comforters and down pillows on top of that. VERY COMFORTABLE. The decor was absolutely beautiful -- rather old European style with dark ornate woodwork. The bathroom was small but impeccably clean and well-decorated. The only "problem" if you want to call it that was not really a problem at all, because of the considerate way that management handled it. When we first arrived, the air conditioner was not working in our room and they were in the process of replacing it. They allowed us to bring all of our belongings up to the room at check-in time, but we did not want to be in the repairman's way, so my daughters and I took off to do some shopping on Michigan Avenue, while my husband went down to the restuarant on the first floor to grab a bite to eat. When he had finished eating, he was told that there would be no charge for his food because of the problem with the air conditioner -- That was a very pleasant surprise!!! The air conditioner was replaced and running perfectly by the time we got back to the room. We would DEFINITELY stay here again! Great location, great hotel, great rooms, great staff. They rate an A+++++. Definitely top-notch. It can't get much better than this!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on here for this hotel, I arrived with some trepidation, especially as my job involved staying in a lot of hotels, so my standrads are quite high. However, I was pleasantly surprised - maybe I just got lucky with my room. After a very long journey from London, I was sooo ready for a shower and a lie down. The staff who greeted me were pleasant and helpful and I was checked in fairly quickly. The initial impression of the Reception area was that it was calm, elegant and nicely decorated. The room itself was perfect for my needs - a lovely big bed with a plump quilt and pillows. the bathroom was clean and the shower most welcoming. I slept very well in that bed. Although it describes itself as a boutique hotel, it doesn't quite follow the definition as it is in Europe and other parts of the world, and as I see it - boutique to me is minimalist lines, neutral colours, very modern / contemporary, little fuss. However, i would still describe this a more luxurious hotel, has its own style and is comfortable. The location - well, it's 2 mins walk from The Magnificent Mile, so nothing wrong with that!

Reviews.Title: “White Hall Inn”
Reviews.Author: Capt_Jack_Sparrow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White Hall Inn and had problems with the AC, plumbing issues that I would liken to Old Faithful and our friends who were booked for a king size bed got a full size. While at breakfast, we overheard several other guests complain about similar problems. Management refused to do anything other than comp the breakfast, which they did a lot that morning.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location excellent price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week at the Whitehall Hotel. We liked it we had one of the refurnished bathrooms and the room was pleasant. The best about this hotel is the location. Right in front of the four seasons hotel, 1/2 a block from the magnificent mile, you can't dream of a better spot for such a price.

Reviews.Title: “Very smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hercules
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a five day trip to Chicago, while there we stayed at the Whitehall. First of all the location was excellent, fifty yards from Michigan Ave and a very short walk up towards Division street where there were a host of pubs and restaurants. On checking in to the Hotel we were greeted by a lovely receptionist who by a stroke of luck was married to a scotsman, therefore she could understand our dulcit tones. We were placed on the 12th floor looking on to East Delaware, not much of a view but we spend very little time in the room anyway. The room was massive with a huge bed, impeccably decorated and laid out, it had all the hallmarks of a very upmarket hotel but not at the same prices. We also never heard a sound from any other guest rooms, (maybe they were empty), also the complimentary coffee in the morning has a refreshing touch. The concierge went out of his way a few times to help us out, he even phoned one of his contacts to get us to the airport, same price but smarter car with loads of room. To sum up a very good choice of hotel with an excellent location with great helpful staff, will be going back next summer, the concierge has told me to e-mail him directly and he will see me allright with room rates. Cant ask for anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is great, property OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Whitehall just after the new year. Staff was all very helpful and friendly. Virgina and Julia were both cheerful and went out of their ways to help out with recomedations, because their was no concierge available. Unfortunately, my chats with the front desk staff was frequently interrupted by ringing phones. I travel quite a bit, and have never witnessed anything quite like this. Shouldn't an operator or other employee be in charge of answering phones? The girls at the desk were swamped with reservation calls, and even room service orders at times! With that much going no one gets the attention they deserve. While the staff of the Whitehall is great, their understaffing puts everyone, guests and employees alike, in a poor situtation. I must say there are aspects of the hotel that are charming and it couldn't be in a better location, it does not under any circumstances live up to the somewhat "overly-glowing" reviews. I was treated well and hotel was average and old. I did not feel like a celebrity! I was not Lapping up all the Luxury! Not sure if you have to tip like a mad man or work for the hotel's sales team to be able to write a review like that, but in any event, the hotel is fine, but their best feature, their staff, are over worked and under appreciated. I will most likely stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: maresa
Reviews.Content: We had a Gold Coast package which included parking and breakfast and a room on the 14th floor with a partial view of the lake. The hotel caters to business people but we were there for a vacation. The hotel was quiet and the bed was extremely comfortable. The only quibble we had was with the heat---I suspect it's controlled from the the front desk even though they made a big deal about how we had our own thermostat (it never responded unless I called the front desk --- it was November and would get cold in the room). It's within easy walking distance from the Visitor Information Center and the bus lines. The hotel staff was very helpful and the onsite restaurant/bar was fine for breakfast or lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall advertizes itself as once being Chicago's premier hotel. Unfortunately, those days are long gone. Although the bar and lobby faintly echo lost days of glory, the halls were dirty and smelled stale, the rooms had damaged furniture, the bathrooms are tiny and dark. Worse, the manager was surly and the persons who parked our vehicle were careless with items stored in the vehicle. It appeared that it was given the "Ferris Bueller" treatment. We stay in Chicago frequently, and this is one place we will not revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like coming home”
Reviews.Author: vbdonato
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago quite often for business and I love this hotel. I alwasy feel at home here and comfortable. Ask for the Delaware Suite it is great and very warm and inviting. The bar and pizza oven next door are great and the dark wood adds to the feeling of comfort. This will be the only place I stay when in town and I have stayed at all the high end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “a classic that needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: newworker
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely old hotel, but one that badly needs renovation to regain a luxury status. The furniture is worn, the bathrooms outdated. The concierge is knowledgeable. The staff is courteous. The location is ideal. If spruced up, this would be a first-rate choice. A New Yorker

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read some of your reviews before chosing the Whitehall. Like anything else they ranged from excellent to poor. We were favorably impressed. Location excellent. Desk and maid service excellent. Hotel staff, including Concerige excellent. We certainly found out stay to be comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “We were very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Albertm
Reviews.Content: we reserved several weeks ahead and requested a quiet location. We were placed in a corner room with large fans from adjacent buildings below on both sides of the room. The room sounded like being next to a freeway all night. The room was very tired in appearance. There is a safe in the room that would not close. The bathroom turned out to need a lot of cleaning and repairs. The shower grout was black in several areas, the ceiling over part of the shower area was peeling, there was no stopper to take a bath. The dressing mirror would not stay in place. The location is good, but the hotel needs refurbishing, and to honor clients requests when placing them into a room. We were offered a different room and declined. We cancelled the balance of our stay and the staff wanted to charge us a cancellation fee. The manager was called and there was no cancellation fee. We then moved to a lovely hotel a block away at a simular rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: LoveSun2010
Reviews.Content: The Whitehall has a solid reputation for service, location and amenities. I agree with the service - it was EXCELLENT, from the doorman to the front desk and housekeeping. The location is EXCELLENT - shopping and nightlife within walking distance. Down comforter and pillows a nice touch. However other amenities were a bit on the ragged side - our room had a very slow draining bathtub, dirty carpeting, chipped and worn tile in bathroom, poorly lit powder room, towel ring came off of hand towel holder, and the curtain rod for sheers came out of ceiling when trying to draw drapes. Yikes! Updating definitely needed!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Happy Happy”
Reviews.Author: copswife1598
Reviews.Content: Whitehall was great!!!! If you are super snooty stay home and have your butler make your coffee. I was there on the 20th of Aug. with my older sister and it started out with the Gal at the front dest (@3pm) saying our room wasn't ready. (Super Sweet....she said 10-15 Minutes it would be ready) So instead of throwing a hissie fit, we asked where the hotel bar was. We sat down and my sister asked if we got a free drink because our room was not ready yet? TONY the bar manager at the time said "Well sure you can" So we did. And then we had another because the staff at the lounge bar was so fun and full of info as to where to dine, lunch, dinner, shop, dance, people watch. (Air Show was going on) Now off to the room we went.........Wonderful! We had two double beds and a view of the lake. We lucked out with a corner room!!!! The staff was so sweet to us, and yes they opened doors for us. Remembered our names and where we were from. The key at any Hotel is to treat the staff like you would treat your friends walking into your home. If you treat them extra nice, they will do the same for you. If I had someone come into my home and start complaining about the thread count or the selection of wine I picked out for the night etc, I will apoligize and tend to my other guests with open arms. But here is the deal........I do not have 20+ floors in my home. So I think all of you with bad remarks need to settle down a bit and look at the Whitehall as a great hotel. Tony, Joe, Leo.....Wonderful in the Bar/Reatrauant The location is wonderful!!!! The doormen are great. We keep our bags there after checking out and it was tip top. So, yes it is Chicago, and there are many hotels to choose from, BUT The Whitehall does do a wonderful job!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - we'd go back”
Reviews.Author: sikronfl
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent Aug. 12 -14 at Whitehall. I called them several days before our check-in and requested a room with a nice view. We got on the 17th floor looking out at another building which was fine. We didn't stay in the room much anyhow inorder to sightsee. The hotel location is great! You can go right down the block to catch the free trolleys or doubledecker buses. Most things are within walking distance. Hancock Observatory is right down the street with great meals at the Cheesecake Factory patio. We also grabbed a quick burger at Johnny Rockets on the other corner from Whitehall. An excellent Italian restaurant called Papa Milanos was a couple of blocks away. The reception girls were pleasant and friendly at Whitehall, as were the doormen, and valets. The room was nice with a double bed, new carpet, and plenty of lights/ lamps. The furniture was quaint and in excellent condition, as was the bed - great sleeping. Mirrors were plentiful - full length on the double sliding closet doors, huge mirror over the desk, and in the bathroom. Drapes were in fine condition, windows were clean. The air conditioner worked great. There were 3 phones - one on the desk, one on the nightstand, and one in the bathroom. The bathroom was large, and very clean, with lovely tile flooring, large vanity, and hairdryer. (The room also had an iron and ironing board.) The concierges were excellent - Ronald and Tim. They didn't rush us and had all the needed maps and info. To get ice, we had to call down to room service. They brought it up within 5 min. The adjoining lounge had a relaxing atmosphere with a piano player and singer. We didn't check out the fitness room - no time. We would stay there again. We had a very pleasant experience with Whitehall Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “extreme disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for one night through (---). I prepaid and rec'd a confirmation notice from the WHITEHALL. After driving from Little Rock, AR to Chicago and arriving at 10pm to check in with my confirmation in hand, I was told by McKenzie at the Whitehall front desk that there was no room for my family. They had a guest extend their stay. She attempted to send us to a 2 star hotel down the street which we drove to in desperation, but wouldn't let my dog spend the night in the hotel she found for us. Therefore we drove back to the Whitehall, again told that there was no room for us, wouldn't refund our money which we pre paid and then she and the night time manager got very rude with us. We had to drive 3o minutes outside of Chicago to find another hotel, we checked in one finally about 1:30pm. The Whitehall staff does not care about the paying customer. I would not recommended staying there to my worst enemy. A good business person would have told the guest requesting a longer stay that there was a pre-paid customer checking in that evening and that the room was needed and they should find alternate lodging, NOT the person arriving at 10pm believing they had a room to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fendibag101
Reviews.Content: We got the room for $140 on hotwire for one night. Loved the location. The room was nice sized as was the bathroom. Did not care for the front desk gal at all. Other than that, concierge was helpful in guiding us to the El for a Cubs game. The neighborhood is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to believe it”
Reviews.Author: LALeB
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this stay for us, so we hoped we would get one of the better rooms. Not the case. For $269/night, we were shown to a tiny, dingy, musty old room with a window facing a blank wall. The furniture was outdated, and wallpaper tried unsuccessfully to mask a large crack in one wall. The bathroom was not big enough for two people. It really did have old cracked tile on the floor and the shower was mildewed beyond belief! I called the desk clerk immediately and simply said the room was unacceptable and asked for another. She said she would call back in two minutes. After 15 minutes without a reply, I called again; she had forgotten! This time she said we could move to one of their "nicest, recently refurbished rooms on the club level" and when we got there had to believe that The Whitehall just doesn't know any better. The room was larger, with no apparent cracks, and a little view of the city around the corner of a brick ell. However, the dark granite that replaced the old tile in the bathroom didn't quite hide the mildew in the corners, and the furniture was exactly the same as in the first room. One good thing stood out--the beds in both rooms were the same: very comfortable, with luxurious fine linens. We were never offered the club level amenities, but what kept us here for 4 nights was the concierge staff (Tim is exceptional!), the location, and the bed! Take away those three things, and you have an $80/night Best Western with so-so housekeeping. By the way, our friends' room had such lumpy carpeting that it was a trick to negotiate walking; they were shown another room but it wasn't much better. They did, however, have much newer, nicer furniture than ours!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique, cette inconnue.”
Reviews.Author: anticorpo
Reviews.Content: Somebody should explain the management of this establishment that the qualification of BOUTIQUE stands for "small & sofisticated " , not "small, decrepit , dusty & noisy ". Unfortunately, American people are so fascinated with Europe that tends to accept every forgery of a European Establishment, whether British, Italianate or even French-looking, and be very forgiving of every possible drawback. In fact, this hotel , in a way, peculiarly encompasses the worst of European hotels (small rooms, tiny bathrooms, dingy hallways, crammed elevators, funny receptions, pretentious common areas) with the worst of American establishments (noisy AC, bad food, mediocre toiletries, neighbours having sex at 4 a.m. and rude yobs from the country spending the W.E. in the Big City) . But not all is so depressing : the bed is extremely comfortable, room was clean, the doormen are very friendly and the all-Black-young women frontdesk is crisp , attentive and (to me) exotic. The Bar is indeed very nice. All of this for 239 $ a night. Better somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service, and Location”
Reviews.Author: pennstate10
Reviews.Content: We just completed an extremely pleasant stay at the Whitehall Hotel. The Hotel is in a perfect location, the room was wonderful, and the service was great. We never opened a door walking into the hotel, and the concierge was extremely friendly with reservations, and the complimentary limo ride to our restaurant. We had an excellent conversation with the limo driver, Colin, who was very courteous. We will certainly stay at the Whitehall again in the near future!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Serivce”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Whitehall Hotel the weekend of June 10th. Our room was classically dressed, clean and quite large enough for 2 people. Bathroom was roomy as well. What really stood out to us, was the incredible serice EVERYONE on the staff gave. We were always greeted and doors held open for us. The concierge was most helpful with tickets to museums, maps and specific directions for the L & buses. Fornetto Mei was just as wonderful. We will certainly stay again at this old gem of a place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Whitehall second week in June. Several conventions were in town, and most hotels had raised room rates to full fare -- so the Whitehall at $169 a night was a find. I try to stay away from large corporate style hotels when possible since I find the service and personal touch of smaller hotels more friendly and personal. The Whitehall did not disappoint on any measure. Room was plenty spacious and clean. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Quirky holdovers from days past include the small elevators and small hallways. No ice machines, but they delivered a bucket on request within a few minutes. Grocery stores, restaurants and transportation all within a short walk. Decent fitness center and complimentary morning coffee/tea made for an altogether excellent stay. Give me a Whitehall over a Hilton any day.

Reviews.Title: “Know yourself, love the Whitehall...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 4 days at the Whitehall and we absolutely loved it! We researched the hotel on trip advisor ahead of time, and some of the reviews were admittedly a bit disconcerting. But we read enough "between the lines" of the bad reviews to realize this was probably our place â€“ and it was! The most important thing to know about the Whitehall is that it is a boutique hotel, not a â€œmega-telâ€�. It is small, quiet, elegant, and personal. This has to fit your personality or you will be disappointed. Otherwise it's like finding a diamond! Front Desk: All of the counter staff were superior, and they went out of her way to make us feel at home. Shift changes only proved that this service was status quo and every request was handled impeccably. Room: We stayed in a king-room on the Pinnacle level, which was fabulous. Our room's furnishings were very attractive and proper. Nothing was overused or worn. We saw no mildew, stains, peeling paint, or any of the other things mentioned in other reviews. On the contrary, it was very top notch and our linens were exquisite. Food: Multiple uses of room service proved the fare to be wonderful. We will crave the home made potato chips with fontina cheese fondue the next time we need a snack. Service was always quick and professional, and if you need some inspiration, they will give you some wonderful ideas for entrees and snacks. Concierge: Unfortunately, for us, this was a sore spot and a disappointment from some earlier reviews. I don't want to focus a hotel review on one person so I'll spare the details, but the resulting misadventures could have been achieved sans the $20 tip. As we planned to continue using the concierge services, we let him know of our misfortunes. Unfortunately, he made no attempt to recover. Therefore, we just spent $9.95 a day for internet access and did everything else for ourselves. Maybe it was just a bad day or a new/different concierge, but be aware. Location: Others have covered it, and even the bad reviews concur, so I won't belabor the point...it is PERFECT. The Whitehall could not be in a better spot for dining, shopping, or sight-seeing. So it comes down to what you want: if you do not see the historical relevance and charm in a small wood-paneled elevator (yes, wood creaks) then the Whitehall may not be the place for you. But if you find quality more important than quantity and enjoy the personal touches that come from a very accommodating staff, youâ€™ve got your place. If you are contemplating the Whitehall and this type of hotel appeals to you, you are sure to enjoy it as much as we did. We are currently planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But....”
Reviews.Author: BGRUD
Reviews.Content: 5/24/05 We Have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Whitehall Hotel. The location is just fabulous, 1/2 block off Michigan Avenue. The hotel is a small chic property, just across the street from The Four Seasons. Our room on a club floor was beautifully furnished in a traditional decor. Our room had data ports, and the fee of $9.95/24 hours seemed reasonable for a big city hotel. OUr room included a breakfast, which was very good, and one cocktail in the evening, with some hors'de'ourves, served in the bar. Bar area was very relaxing, like a library. On the weekends there was a piano player and vocalist, a nice touch. Only complaint......some areas of the hotel were under construction, this affected the water pressure in the shower....sometimes the water stopped in mid shower....it came back on in a few seconds..but it was very annoying. All and all a good stay, would definitely stay again. Staff most helpful with reservations and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Travelzoo Deal or Not, Over-Priced and Over-Rated”
Reviews.Author: ljbh
Reviews.Content: I see there is a new option here on Tripadvisor.com that allows you to add photos! I wish I had taken pictures of the peeling paint, the mildew on the shower curtain, the water stain on the ceiling, grungy carpeting, dirty grout... You get the picture, this is NOT the special place, the "boutique" hotel, they would like you to think it is when making a reservation! If that's what you're looking for, stay around the corner at the Tremont! Yes, we got it for the bargain price of $139 on a weekend Travelzoo special, but there are plenty of hotels (even in similar excellent locations) where you can get that kind of price on a weekend in Chicago. I would have to echo an earlier review here on tripadvisor.com: "The Whitehall is listed in the publication "The Best Small Hotels in the World." Please. The Whitehall is the worst Chicago hotel at which I have ever had the misfortune to stay. The location is excellent - one block west of Michigan Avenue. That's where the good news ends. The staff is uppity. The rooms are VERY small. The hotel is badly worn, in need of a face lift. The noise from the pipes is awful. This is an expensive hotel. For the same price you can stay at wondeful Chicago hotels - Fairmont, Peninsula, Meridien, Intercontinental. Do yourself a favor - avoid the Whitehall."

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Whitehall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife andI stayed at the Whitehall for our 25th wedding anniversary.It was my first trip to Chicago,my wife and her mother have been many times before and have stayed at the Whitehall and always had a very nice stay.I myself had a great time.I thought the hotel was first rate.We did have a problem in that the room was not ready,when we arrived but we took the time to sightsee. I found the staff very helpful,the room was very clean and had a wonderful view.the bar was perfect. To all the other people who complained {some may have been legit}but a few were over the top and vicious.And I'm sure the hotel is glad that some of these people will not be back.It will make it easier for me to get my next room this spring. We feel that the Whitehall rules.

Reviews.Title: “Darrin & Monica--a great team!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the problem is with some of these people that write these reviews, but my stay at the Whitehall was wonderful!! It was an absolute delight mainly due to Darrin (the front desk agent that checked me in) and Monica (the wonderful concierge). I was staying at the Whitehall over Christmas on business that couldn't be avoided & was naturally depressed and irritable about not being with my family for the holidays. I'll admit, I didn't want to be there and actually wanted to hate it. This must have been obvious to Darrin as he was checking me in because he thoughtfully noticed that I would be there over the holiday and subtly acknowledged that it must not be easy to be away from family. He said that maybe a quiet room on a high floor with a view would make it a bit easier! From that point he had me laughing so hard about my situation that I was almost GLAD to be there! He said that I can at least brag about my room while I am on the phone with my husband, etc. Darrin was great and obviously has a intuitive sense about people to know what I needed--a kind face, a good laugh, and a great room. He directed me to Monica, who was the greatest concierge I have EVER been fortunate enough to have. She was so knowledgable and accomodating! She is an EXPERT on the Windy City and has the gentle demeanor of a reliable friend. I will say, despite Monica & Darrin, the entire hotel could use a facelift. The lobby is a bit dowdy and the heating unit was loud at times. I could notice, also, a huge difference between the front desk day shift and the front desk night shift. Darrin and the young woman working with him during the day were wonderful, the night shift seemed immature and downright unprofessional and unruly. The restaurant, Fornetto Mei, was alright I guess; but it seems to try too hard and fumble over itself in the process. The obnoxiously loud, bawdy breakfast manager of Fornetto Mei needs to tone it down. . .alot. It is too early for all her noise. I would definately recommend the Whitehall to everyone. . .and pray that Darrin and Monica are there!

Reviews.Title: “Whitehall is a Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Crescentciti
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel made my recent visit to Chicago a delight. The decor is pleasant and fresh, with an adequate size room and nice, shiny bathroom. Providing terry robes eliminates the need for packing a bulky item. The lights in the room are GREAT, lots of wattage for reading (unusual for hotels). Personnel were accommodating. One can't beat the location, half a block from Michigan Avenue. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to others and certainly hope to stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Whitehall not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: carolinamom92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Whitehall 11/3 - 5. We had two adjoining rooms that were very adequate -- not huge, but fine. We were a little nervous after reading some of these reviews, but were pleasantly surprised. We had gotten a good rate on Expedia, much less than anywhere else close by, and I would definitely stay again.
